Today in ‚ÄúI know we bust on comics a lot around here but there are still plenty of comics worth your time‚Äù I think Robin Lives is off to a promising start!  Also I have to say I found myself comparing it to Three Jokers. For one thing it seems like much more of an examination of trauma than Three Jokers was purported to be. For another while Three Jokers had me doubting that Geoff Johns really read The Killing Joke Robin Lives feels like JM DeMatteis gives a crap about what actually happened in ‚ÄúDeath in the Family.‚Äù  But my petty grudges aside here‚Äôs what I liked about Robin Lives #1 with lots of spoilers. (And images of child murder and such obviously.)  <!-- more --> Unless there are shenanigans later Joker definitely dies on the very first page.   ALT Falls at Bruce‚Äôs feet. Aw. :(  So this presents to us an instant mystery! Was Bruce responsible? Or was it Jason? Someone else entirely? Looks like the answer will be in three more issues. For now we flash back to the aftermath of Jason‚Äôs near-death.  DeMatteis deals with Joker‚Äôs infamous ambassadorship by simply‚Ä¶ taking it away. Which is pretty funny to me.  ALT ‚ÄúHonestly we were coming off a pretty wild party when we made that decision. Who knows what we were thinking? Hahaha no hard feelings right‚Äî What‚Äôs that gas??‚Äù  I should note the narration in the purple box which starts before this scene. Halfway through the issue we learn that this story is being narrated by Dr. Saraswati Dev (aka Sara) a trauma doctor that Bruce hires for Jason. As we read what happens in this deviation from canon she examines how we should view people who do such terrible things when their own lives and actions are affected by mental illness their own trauma and so on. It‚Äôs an admittedly blunt story-telling tactic spelling out the nuance for the reader but I don‚Äôt mind it and it tells us that this version of Jason‚Äôs story won‚Äôt end cleanly.  Sara also clearly knows much more about Batman and his sidekicks than the average civilian which raises the question of how she gets so involved in their lives. I‚Äôm hoping it‚Äôs not because she becomes a love interest‚Ä¶ but then again if that‚Äôs presented as one of Bruce‚Äôs screwed up mistakes that has potential!  Anyway as reviewed in a previous post Joker was uneasy about killing Jason from the start and that doesn‚Äôt change in this version. When Bruce rescues the Iranian representatives Joker tries to downplay what he did.  ALT Hee hee ‚ÄúBatsy-boo.‚Äù  Joker can‚Äôt escape for long though.  ALT And I have to pause here to note that this scene is reminiscent of the climax in the ‚ÄúGoing Sane‚Äù storyline which DeMatteis also wrote.  ALTALT Batman: Legends of the Dark Knight #68  There are differences in the scenarios of course but the other thing about ‚ÄúGoing Sane‚Äù is that Joker/Joseph repeatedly refers to the urge to return to his former self as drowning.  ALT Batman: Legends of the Dark Knight #66  So in Robin Lives it adds an extra kick when Bruce overturns Joker‚Äôs boat and then stands by as Joker drowns.  Oh god that feeling when your secret fears come to fruition  But don‚Äôt worry!  ALT This is all an interesting variation ‚ÄúDeath in the Family.‚Äù Then in his grief Bruce was constantly fluctuating on if he was going to kill Joker and his eventual attempt was trapping Joker in a crashing helicopter. In Robin Lives he seems ambivalent too again engineering the circumstances for Joker to die but not being an entirely active participant and also not angry at Clark for rescuing him. (Speaking of which Clark sure as heck didn‚Äôt rescue Joker from the original helicopter incident. I guess he‚Äôs ambivalent in his own way!)  So Joker is returned to Arkham Asylum where Bruce talks to the current director Dr. Benjamin Stoner (who evidently really was the director at the time but also a literal agent of chaos??? OK I guess I‚Äôll keep that in mind). Stoner pushes back on Bruce‚Äôs assessment of the Joker.  ALT At the time Bruce vanishes but as we see in the narration when Bruce faildads hard with a recovering Jason he later seems to reflect on Stoner‚Äôs words along with Jason‚Äôs.  ALT The page already notes that no this chat is not going to be enough to get Jason back to baseline. But it‚Äôs also darkly hilarious that Dick thought it would be especially keeping in mind that the implication is that this is the only time Dick comes over and it‚Äôs after Jason has been listless for some time. It‚Äôs almost like this whole family is bad at feelings.  But Bruce does finally hire a professional our narrator.  ALT Of course Jason overhears their discussion and thinks Bruce is planning to send him away.  ALT Ouch.  Jason decides to prove that he‚Äôs totally fine actually by saving a gala from Scarecrow by himself. Did you guess that he gets hit with fear toxin? Because yeah they always get hit with fear toxin!  ALTALTALT Oh my god he just wanted his mom to save him üò≠  ALT OH GOD FOR A SECOND I FORGOT IT WAS FEAR TOXIN  I should take a second to jump back and note that Jason imagining Joker getting one right between the eyes just like we saw at the start feels like a solid indication that in the end he will definitely be Joker‚Äôs killer‚Ä¶ but well you really don‚Äôt know until it happens.  So Jason is out of commission but before Scarecrow can kidnap him for interrogation Batman finally shows up. Bruce beats the everloving crap out of Crane obviously still consumed with anger about what happened in Ethiopia. The freaking cops have to ask him to stop.  ALT And then the final page is just more of the saddest of sadtimes.  ALT I do love that first narrative detail in the top panel. Bruce is feeling angry and guilty but also humiliated and ashamed. He knows Jason is a vulnerable kid who needs help but as always Jason also represents Bruce‚Äôs personal failures. He couldn‚Äôt get Jason to do exactly as he was told. He couldn‚Äôt protect Jason from harm. He couldn‚Äôt maintain the image of Batman as invulnerable not with this terrified boy shaking on the ground. Bruce does not have control.  It‚Äôs very human and it‚Äôs a key ingredient in whatever disaster is to come. Even if we didn‚Äôt have Sara‚Äôs final questions in the last two panels we can already tell that Bruce is going to continue to make not-great choices.  I‚Äôve already ordered #2 and I‚Äôm looking forward to reading what DeMatteis has in store in the next three issues. Barbara has to make an appearance right? And she‚Äôd be a great candidate for the shooter‚Ä¶

post_body: Superman and Batman returned to the Watchtower after a particularly harsh mission both visibly shaken. One of them had come close to dying. As they re-entered the Watchtower they split from the other members and take their showers to wash off the blood of battle. Soon enough they find themselves back in the hallway they make sure they‚Äôre alone with a quick glance and the two of them start making out pushing against one another to get into Batman‚Äôs room as quickly as possible.   They‚Äôre drunk on each other their senses entirely focused on the other.  They get in the room whispering sweet nothings in one another‚Äôs ear (‚ÄúI got so scared‚Äù ‚ÄúFuck Clark you smell so good‚Äù ‚ÄúI really can‚Äôt lose you‚Äù ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs okay I‚Äôm right here baby.‚Äù ‚ÄúPlease I can‚Äôt wait anymore‚Äù).   It‚Äôs when they separate for Clark to get on his knees that they finally freeze at the sound of a prolonged incredulous ‚ÄúUhmmmm ?!‚Äù  Wrong fucking room.  Batman has to threaten Booster to not tell anyone. Booster is short-circuiting. Superman is dying of embarrassment. Batman switches strategy and tries to bribe Booster. Booster is still short-circuiting now he‚Äôs muttering about ‚Äúhow terrifying it is that the two most resourceful and powerful men in the world are fucking‚Äù. Superman had died of embarrassment.

I like to think Bruce has so perfectly constructed his Brucie persona that he can just straight up tell people his identity and no one believes it.  .  Someone walks in on him changing in his office.   Bruce in the Brucie voice: I‚Äôm Batman  Poor schmuck who accidentally walked into the CEO‚Äôs office without knocking: Haha good one Mr. Wayne.  .  Villain of the day: Now that you are thoroughly under the effects of my Truth serum/potion/spell/gadget/magic/whatever; you will tell me. What is your secret identity?  Batman compelled to answer: I‚Äôm Bruce Wayne  Villain: How are you resisting!?  Batman: I‚Äôm not.  .  I think it infuriates no one more than it does his fellow JL members. In large part because the day Bruce finally decided he trusted them enough to tell them his identity might have gone something like this.  Bruce wrapping up a Justice League meeting: By the way I‚Äôm Bruce Wayne.  Green Lantern/Flash/Someone IDK: Hardy har har Bats. Look if you don‚Äôt trust us just say it. Don‚Äôt‚Ä¶ patronize‚Ä¶ us.  Bruce removed his cowl halfway through their talking and is just waiting for them to notice: ‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm Bruce Wayne.  JL several minutes of blue screening: ‚Ä¶   Same someone as above: Mr. Wayne? post_body: WFA spoilers ahead  Content warning for discussion of mental illness  <!-- more --> Can I take a moment to appreciate how they showcased Jason‚Äôs PTSD in the latest ep? This isn‚Äôt the first time but I feel like this round struck much closer.  Although this is the website where people are open about mental illness there‚Äôs still a reluctance to address the ‚Äúloud‚Äù or ‚Äúfrightening‚Äù or ‚Äúangry‚Äù or ‚Äúmessy‚Äù side of it. Stuff like bipolar schizophrenia addiction PTSD. It‚Äôs why I‚Äôm extremely hesitant to talk about my own problems even under anonymity.   Conversely there are mainline comics (and other media) that use this category of mental illness as an excuse for characters to go all-out in their aggression. Even if not intentional it perpetuates the idea that a trigger will always send the person spiraling until either the worst happens or someone steps in as the ‚Äúhero.‚Äù It‚Äôs basically sending the message to people like me that we‚Äôre a ticking time bomb.   Then there‚Äôs WFA. Jason‚Äôs not fully present during his episode. It leads him into a dangerous situation while at the same time he‚Äôs unable to grasp things like pain. The adrenaline and the overwhelming sense of fear drives him into fight mode. He gets tunnel vision while he‚Äôs beating up the bar patrons to try and find the Joker. Without getting into details I‚Äôve been in Jason‚Äôs shoes. I‚Äôve found myself in risky places doing things I‚Äôd later regret. All because of the disconnect from reality that makes me believe what I‚Äôm doing is necessary. Not even justified just necessary. Almost like a survival instinct.   And what‚Äôs so important is that Jason isn‚Äôt a villain and Dick isn‚Äôt a savior. Dick reaffirms Jason‚Äôs trauma and guides him through tangible steps rather than giving broad sweeping advice. Of course there‚Äôs no one-size-fits-all coping method but the biggest thing is having somebody in your corner who sees you beyond this bad episode. Sometimes I have that sometimes I don‚Äôt. WFA won‚Äôt show it since it‚Äôs all about family but the times I didn‚Äôt have someone were exponentially scarier.   At the same time there are consequences that a simple grounding exercise can‚Äôt remedy‚ÄîJason got hurt he hurt others and his appearance at Noonan‚Äôs definitely put him on someone‚Äôs radar if not the Joker. And they‚Äôre just as real as his feelings and (hopefully) he‚Äôs gonna be held accountable. Because that‚Äôs how it goes in real life. Something sets me off I screw up I get bailed out and once I come down from it I have to fix the mess I made.   Maybe I‚Äôm just reading too much into a fan comic. But I know that if a few panels can resonate so closely with me then it‚Äôs worth talking about because someone somewhere is also feeling the same way.
Batman and Catwoman by Davi Go

secondary_tags: ['superman'  'wonder woman'  'justice league'  'dc comics'  'dcau'  'gotham'  'metropolis'  'themiscyra'  'diana of themyscira'  'bruce wayne'  'clark kent'  'new jeresy'  'delaware'  'tennessee']
post_body: A DC au where things make more sense to me Bruce Wayne was only 8 years old when a common thug killed his mother and father. He was too young to understand why they wouldn‚Äôt just wake up the little dress pants that he wore to the theatre now damp with blood as he pushed poked and prodded his parents‚Äô heavy bodies. His voice grows more and more worried as time passes for he can see the color draining from their skin ever so slowly revealing veins that have begun to transition from blue to purple. His soft whine becoming a full screaming sob.  It‚Äôs only after roughly half an hour of continuous wailing that lights appear in the surrounding houses and apartments. Disgruntled residents telling him to shut up and more empathetic people checking on him from their windows. It was only one man that came out to see the horrors the boy had witnessed. Not too soon after Gotham Police Department arrives with a young junior detective and his senior partner.  A grizzled Harvey Bullock with sunken eyes from years of sleep deprivation and a rasp in his voice from the combination of chain smoking and hard liquor orders James Gordon to quell the cries of the boy. Jim looks uneasy with his orders. He‚Äôs never been good with kids but he watches intently as the boy heaves deep breaths and chokes on the spit and snot pouring from his face.  A gentle hand touches the young Wayne‚Äôs shoulder clasping it as if to offer reassurance.  ‚ÄúMy name is Jim. Can you tell me your name?‚Äù Jim is careful not to mess up the scene as he gingerly crouches behind the boy.  ‚ÄúB-b-br-bruce.‚Äù The boy stutters trying to collect himself. A Wayne must be strong. That‚Äôs what dad always said.  ‚ÄúBruce? I‚Äôm sorry we had to meet like this‚Äù says Jim as he tries to ask empathetically ‚ÄúBruce do you think we can talk more? I have friends that can watch them for you. Why don‚Äôt you take a break?‚Äù  The boy then looks behind him to find the gap-toothed sympathetic smile of a lightskin black man with freckles and ginger hair under the soft yellowed glow of street lamps. And in the night air are the screeches of bats as they hunt for insects‚Ä¶  ‚Ä¶  10-year-old Clark Kent awoke from his sleep in a sweat. He could have sworn he had heard the sound of a gunshot as if were right beside him. His ears were ringing. He stumbled out of the motel bed shambled to the bathroom and promptly lost his dinner.  As he was cleaning up the sink which he vomited into he went to twist the knob to rinse it out. It must have gotten looser since they were using it earlier. Before it stuck a little and while not hard to turn did require a little more effort.   As Clark removes his hand from the knob he sees why it was so much easier to turn. He looks intently at the cracks in the plastic knob and when he went to tap it it crumbled into hard clear shards.  Clark laid back down thinking he must be in some fever-induced dream but he had a hard time going back to bed. Not only did he feel as if he was moving faster than his mind was moving as he walked back to the bed but as he laid there with eyes shut tight it was as if he could see through his own eyelids.   Clark continued to lay down now just staring through his eyelids at the ceiling above him. He decided to quiet his mind by thinking of home. He couldn‚Äôt wait to get back home. He missed the farm. He missed the trees. He even missed his chores. He was ready to harvest the corn they had grown for the summer and play with the cows in the barn. He didn‚Äôt like the thick air of Metropolis; it smelled of car exhaust and sewage. Though he honestly couldn‚Äôt tell if that was the fault of Metropolis or the city of Gotham across the Delaware Bay. But the constant noise of cars and yelling protests against STAR labs and sirens zooming down the streets that was definitely Metropolis. The flash of cameras blinding him whenever Mama and Pop took him to look at the city. Eager journalists and paparazzi alike looking to get the scoop on anything and everything. Where there should be tall trees and bustling forests there were instead skyscrapers and just behemoth concrete and metal structures. No he wanted no part of it he just wanted to be back on the Kent farm in Gallatin.  Eventually Clark dozes off thinking about home and his friends there. He dreams of his best friend Alex and the lab in his garage. He dreams of his dad landing his STAR labs contract so they can go back home and start working again. He dreams of home but is seeing a man and a woman and can‚Äôt make out their faces but their bodies don‚Äôt resemble Mama and Pop‚Ä¶ It‚Äôs while he dreams these things that his body begins to hover a little over a foot in the air.   A true sight for his mother and father to see when they go to wake him up for a city tour at 9am. Perhaps it‚Äôs time to have the talk with Clark‚Ä¶  ‚Ä¶  ‚ÄúARES! GIVE ME YOUR COURAGE! ATHENA! YOUR WISDOM! KRATOS! BLESS ME WITH STRENGTH! HERMES! LET ME POSSESS YOUR SPEED! ZEUS! FUCK YOU!‚Äù A mighty high-pitched battle cry from young warrior Diana of Themiscyra. ‚ÄúYOUR LIGHTNING MAY HAVE LIT THE FIRES OF MY KILN BUT YOU HOLD NO POWER OVER ME!‚Äù  ‚ÄúWatch your words Diana. We revere the gods. They allow us to live and bless us with what we need to live.‚Äù Queen Hippolyta scolds her daughter. ‚ÄúZeus heard my cries to mother a child and gave me you. I thank him daily.‚Äù  ‚ÄúMy queen I respect you and the other gods. But I do not recognize Zeus as the King of Gods as that would make him my king. And I serve no man.‚Äù  Her mother can do nothing but chuckle as lightning crackles across the sky. My daughter molded of clay and born by lightning. I think he sees your power and knows the threat you pose to him. I will protect you from him. Train you to be the best Amazon to have walked the Earth.  ‚ÄúAre you done praying child?‚Äù Hippolyta dawns her helmet and grabs her spear; shifting her feet to prepare for what comes next. Her stance is strong she looks nigh unmovable. A necessary skill against her current opponent.  ‚ÄúNot yet mater.‚Äù Diana grins at her mother slyly. Without breaking eye contact Diana retrieves her shield from the boulder she lodged it in during the last spar and unsheathed the sword on her belt. ‚ÄúASCLEPIUS! KEEP MY MOTHER HEALTHY! PAEON! PATCH UP WHAT YOU MUST AFTER!‚Äù I will dethrone Zeus and protect those I love from tyrants like him.  Lightning strikes the fighting pit leaving glass shards scattered across the arena. Fuck you Zeus Hippolyta says in her mind and the spar continues‚Ä¶

post_body: I‚Äôm weeping

I like to think Bruce has so perfectly constructed his Brucie persona that he can just straight up tell people his identity and no one believes it.  .  Someone walks in on him changing in his office.   Bruce in the Brucie voice: I‚Äôm Batman  Poor schmuck who accidentally walked into the CEO‚Äôs office without knocking: Haha good one Mr. Wayne.  .  Villain of the day: Now that you are thoroughly under the effects of my Truth serum/potion/spell/gadget/magic/whatever; you will tell me. What is your secret identity?  Batman compelled to answer: I‚Äôm Bruce Wayne  Villain: How are you resisting!?  Batman: I‚Äôm not.  .  I think it infuriates no one more than it does his fellow JL members. In large part because the day Bruce finally decided he trusted them enough to tell them his identity might have gone something like this.  Bruce wrapping up a Justice League meeting: By the way I‚Äôm Bruce Wayne.  Green Lantern/Flash/Someone IDK: Hardy har har Bats. Look if you don‚Äôt trust us just say it. Don‚Äôt‚Ä¶ patronize‚Ä¶ us.  Bruce removed his cowl halfway through their talking and is just waiting for them to notice: ‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm Bruce Wayne.  JL several minutes of blue screening: ‚Ä¶   Same someone as above: Mr. Wayne? How did you get here? Why are you impersonating Batman?? Why is he letting you???  Bruce: Hhhhnnn‚Ä¶  Same someone: Haha. Pretty spot on too.

When he put stuff in the analyzing machines and came to his own conclusions. I mean really it would already improve so much if they just had Bruce read out/think the computer conclusions rather than have some digital voice say it. Especially because im 75% sure that isnt how that works. Anyway. Whatever

post_body: WFA spoilers ahead  Content warning for discussion of mental illness  <!-- more --> Can I take a moment to appreciate how they showcased Jason‚Äôs PTSD in the latest ep? This isn‚Äôt the first time but I feel like this round struck much closer.  Although this is the website where people are open about mental illness there‚Äôs still a reluctance to address the ‚Äúloud‚Äù or ‚Äúfrightening‚Äù or ‚Äúangry‚Äù or ‚Äúmessy‚Äù side of it. Stuff like bipolar schizophrenia addiction PTSD. It‚Äôs why I‚Äôm extremely hesitant to talk about my own problems even under anonymity.   Conversely there are mainline comics (and other media) that use this category of mental illness as an excuse for characters to go all-out in their aggression. Even if not intentional it perpetuates the idea that a trigger will always send the person spiraling until either the worst happens or someone steps in as the ‚Äúhero.‚Äù It‚Äôs basically sending the message to people like me that we‚Äôre a ticking time bomb.   Then there‚Äôs WFA. Jason‚Äôs not fully present during his episode. It leads him into a dangerous situation while at the same time he‚Äôs unable to grasp things like pain. The adrenaline and the overwhelming sense of fear drives him into fight mode. He gets tunnel vision while he‚Äôs beating up the bar patrons to try and find the Joker. Without getting into details I‚Äôve been in Jason‚Äôs shoes. I‚Äôve found myself in risky places doing things I‚Äôd later regret. All because of the disconnect from reality that makes me believe what I‚Äôm doing is necessary. Not even justified just necessary. Almost like a survival instinct.   And what‚Äôs so important is that Jason isn‚Äôt a villain and Dick isn‚Äôt a savior. Dick reaffirms Jason‚Äôs trauma and guides him through tangible steps rather than giving broad sweeping advice. Of course there‚Äôs no one-size-fits-all coping method but the biggest thing is having somebody in your corner who sees you beyond this bad episode. Sometimes I have that sometimes I don‚Äôt. WFA won‚Äôt show it since it‚Äôs all about family but the times I didn‚Äôt have someone were exponentially scarier.   At the same time there are consequences that a simple grounding exercise can‚Äôt remedy‚ÄîJason got hurt he hurt others and his appearance at Noonan‚Äôs definitely put him on someone‚Äôs radar if not the Joker. And they‚Äôre just as real as his feelings and (hopefully) he‚Äôs gonna be held accountable. Because that‚Äôs how it goes in real life. Something sets me off I screw up I get bailed out and once I come down from it I have to fix the mess I made.   Maybe I‚Äôm just reading too much into a fan comic. But I know that if a few panels can resonate so closely with me then it‚Äôs worth talking about because someone somewhere is also feeling the same way.
Batman and Catwoman by Davi Go

Can i just say that the increased modernising of the Bat‚Äôs tech sucks ass? Like maybe this is because i dont really care for all that but like YAWN. Where is the fun in a computer telling Batman everything? I like it when he does the stuff himself yk like a detective. Machine/tech help is ofc great but when it takes over its like‚Ä¶ yk boring i guess. It makes him come across as less smart tbh even if he build it himself. (Which he nowadays barely does with WE and all that) Maybe its bc im a little sceptical of technology idk.  ‚ÄúExo-suit analysis of sewer water.‚Äù BOY WHAT DO YOU THINK? I‚Äôd rather he just take regular samples and analyzed them bc i find that more interesting and i guess realistic as well. It seems logical for him to keep up with his city? This shouldnt be a surprise for mr prepared. Also its kinda like just asking God and getting and answer on the spot like in Monty Python. Literally could have been a thought bubble/brick ‚Äúi analyzed the sewer water/ive been analysing the sewer water regularly‚Äù yk like its not hard. Idk it just comes across as lazy writing to me.

secondary_tags: ['my hand slipped'  'random'  'dcu'  'dc'  'two face'  'harley quinn'  'bruce wayne'  'harvey dent'  'harleen quinzel'  "this wasn't actually the original idea"  'it derailed somewhere around the middle there'  'it seems incomplete because it is'  "i lost the thought but i wasn't about to not throw this at y'all before going to sleep"]
post_body: Bruce and Harley are friends. Bruce and Harvey are friends.  May I present: All three grew up together.  They met at a park one day or even on the first day of first grade and decided that they were gonna be friends forever.  They all probably kissed once just to see what it would be like. They also made a promise to marry each other/move in together if they weren‚Äôt in a committed relationship by a certain age.  They definitely planned to work together in the future all having to do something with the law. They were gonna be the good guys kicking ass together because there‚Äôs no way they‚Äôd ever stop being friends.  And then Bruce‚Äôs parents were killed.  And then they couldn‚Äôt all go to the same high school because Harley lived in Park Row and Harvey lived in Old Gotham and Bruce lived in Bristol.  And then Bruce disappeared.  And then Harley went insane.  And suddenly Harvey was the only one left.  But Bruce came back! And Batman appeared. And Harvey was busting his ass trying to keep the city safe while also reconnecting with Bruce and telling him what happened to Harley. Harley joins The Joker entering a relationship with him.  Batman has to keep locking Harley away in the very place she wanted to help people and Bruce dies a bit every time because that‚Äôs his friend he keeps putting there.  Harvey goes insane calling himself Two-Face.  And suddenly Bruce is the only one left.  None of them are doing what they set out to do.  Harley - in nice terms - is no longer with Joker. Harvey is still in and out of Arkham. Bruce now has three two kids.  Harley reforms getting the help she needed but she doesn‚Äôt go back to what she‚Äôd grown up wanting to do. Harvey keeps going through the revolving door that is Arkham Asylum but he knows Batman won‚Äôt hurt him because Bruce would never hurt his friends on purpose. Bruce now has 7 kids two of which he can‚Äôt officially adopt because one still has living family and the other doesn‚Äôt want that. Bruce and Harley reconnect.

post_body: No one literally no one     The legendary cryptids of Gotham:

Started The Joker War‚Ä¶‚Ä¶??? Why WE manufacturing weapons all of a sudden?? I thought there was a basic understanding that they didnt do that? Also Bruce is written a lot more violent/worse than in Tomasi‚Äôs comics before this? Whats up with that? He‚Äôs such an asshole like even more than usual in current comics? Also bordering on being careless and killing especially in the Two-Face part of the comic. He really is so unsympathetic also kinda curt with Harvey when they confronted each other for the first time in this comic but that might be bc of the panelling.   Speaking of Two-Face; THE IMPROMPTU BRAIN SURGERY??? Is it medical malpractice if you dont have a license because i think Bruce just went a step too far. Its one thing to practice field medicine/basics without formal hospital training (not to say he didnt have training/good education on it but yk) but BRAIN SURGERY??? Did i miss something??? Back to the violence he really was going to town like‚Ä¶ idk. What is it with writers making him beat the information out of people so much and so violently like gang‚Ä¶ stop it. Idk maybe Tomasi rewatched the Nolan movies for this.   He and Kate are kinda cute tho. I do miss the days Bruce said please and thank you on the regular(ish) i really liked that subtle thing about him. Such a polite young man. But thats what you get if you jump around between older comics and current ones i guess. Speaking of: the difference between the detective work then and now‚Ä¶ oh how i miss the times before that damned speaking computer. When he put stuff in the analyzing machines and came to his own conclusions. I mean really it would already improve so much if they just had Bruce read out/think the computer conclusions rather than have some digital voice say it. Especially because im 75% sure that isnt how that works. Anyway. Whatever

post_body: Bruce and Harley are friends. Bruce and Harvey are friends.  May I present: All three grew up together.  They met at a park one day or even on the first day of first grade and decided that they were gonna be friends forever.  They all probably kissed once just to see what it would be like. They also made a promise to marry each other/move in together if they weren‚Äôt in a committed relationship by a certain age.  They definitely planned to work together in the future all having to do something with the law. They were gonna be the good guys kicking ass together because there‚Äôs no way they‚Äôd ever stop being friends.  And then Bruce‚Äôs parents were killed.  And then they couldn‚Äôt all go to the same high school because Harley lived in Park Row and Harvey lived in Old Gotham and Bruce lived in Bristol.  And then Bruce disappeared.  And then Harley went insane.  And suddenly Harvey was the only one left.  But Bruce came back! And Batman appeared. And Harvey was busting his ass trying to keep the city safe while also reconnecting with Bruce and telling him what happened to Harley. Harley joins The Joker entering a relationship with him.  Batman has to keep locking Harley away in the very place she wanted to help people and Bruce dies a bit every time because that‚Äôs his friend he keeps putting there.  Harvey goes insane calling himself Two-Face.  And suddenly Bruce is the only one left.  None of them are doing what they set out to do.  Harley - in nice terms - is no longer with Joker. Harvey is still in and out of Arkham. Bruce now has three two kids.  Harley reforms getting the help she needed but she doesn‚Äôt go back to what she‚Äôd grown up wanting to do. Harvey keeps going through the revolving door that is Arkham Asylum but he knows Batman won‚Äôt hurt him because Bruce would never hurt his friends on purpose. Bruce now has 7 kids two of which he can‚Äôt officially adopt because one still has living family and the other doesn‚Äôt want that. Bruce and Harley reconnect.

post_body: Something about the Jason‚Äôs favourite spots being rooftops overlooking Gotham because of a combination of him being scared of confinement and small spaces and being in a body that feels too big and wrong for him (it would be to anyone who wakes up as a 6 foot+ shit brick house when they last thing they remember is being a gangly 15 year old who hasn‚Äôt had their growth spurt yet). Like almost every room feels suffocating but being on a rooftop overlooking Gotham will never fail to make him feel small and it‚Äôs one of the few things that remained constant in the roller coaster that is his life

post_body: i love being an astrology girlie because i can tell you if your characters‚Äô birthdays make sense. Bruce Wayne is a Pisces? here‚Äôs what makes sense:  experienced a traumatic event and made it his whole personality feels everything profoundly good with kids  gets along (so to speak) with everyone else (perks of being the 12th sign) extremely creative and adaptable    and here are some opportunities:  leading a double life that requires immense inauthenticity is draining. we hate being fake it would be nearly impossible to keep this going for a long stretch of time without resenting and avoiding those events (checks out) emotions are kinda our whole fare so Bruce should be waaaay better at communicating them and at the very least should show profound self awareness showering each of the batkids with love and affection especially nonverbally (ironically) conflict avoidant

post_body: Bruce and Harley are friends. Bruce and Harvey are friends.  May I present: All three grew up together.  They met at a park one day or even on the first day of first grade and decided that they were gonna be friends forever.  They all probably kissed once just to see what it would be like. They also made a promise to marry each other/move in together if they weren‚Äôt in a committed relationship by a certain age.  They definitely planned to work together in the future all having to do something with the law. They were gonna be the good guys kicking ass together because there‚Äôs no way they‚Äôd ever stop being friends.  And then Bruce‚Äôs parents were killed.  And then they couldn‚Äôt all go to the same high school because Harley lived in Park Row and Harvey lived in Old Gotham and Bruce lived in Bristol.  And then Bruce disappeared.  And then Harley went insane.  And suddenly Harvey was the only one left.  But Bruce came back! And Batman appeared. And Harvey was busting his ass trying to keep the city safe while also reconnecting with Bruce and telling him what happened to Harley. Harley joins The Joker entering a relationship with him.  Batman has to keep locking Harley away in the very place she wanted to help people and Bruce dies a bit every time because that‚Äôs his friend he keeps putting there.  Harvey goes insane calling himself Two-Face.  And suddenly Bruce is the only one left.  None of them are doing what they set out to do.  Harley - in nice terms - is no longer with Joker. Harvey is still in and out of Arkham. Bruce now has three two kids.  Harley reforms getting the help she needed but she doesn‚Äôt go back to what she‚Äôd grown up wanting to do. Harvey keeps going through the revolving door that is Arkham Asylum but he knows Batman won‚Äôt hurt him because Bruce would never hurt his friends on purpose. Bruce now has 7 kids two of which he can‚Äôt officially adopt because one still has living family and the other doesn‚Äôt want that. Bruce and Harley reconnect.

One sickening crunch will ring through the crowd before the screaming starts when they realize it isn‚Äôt part of the show.   Dick‚Äôs life will never be the same after this not remotely.   ‚Äî   An experiment is made of mistakes. Therefore it would be logical to conclude that if enough things go horribly wrong eventually something that makes it worth it will happen. post_body: Something about the Jason‚Äôs favourite spots being rooftops overlooking Gotham because of a combination of him being scared of confinement and small spaces and being in a body that feels too big and wrong for him (it would be to anyone who wakes up as a 6 foot+ shit brick house when they last thing they remember is being a gangly 15 year old who hasn‚Äôt had their growth spurt yet). Like almost every room feels suffocating but being on a rooftop overlooking Gotham will never fail to make him feel small and it‚Äôs one of the few things that remained constant in the roller coaster that is his life

post_body: i love being an astrology girlie because i can tell you if your characters‚Äô birthdays make sense. Bruce Wayne is a Pisces? here‚Äôs what makes sense:  experienced a traumatic event and made it his whole personality feels everything profoundly good with kids  gets along (so to speak) with everyone else (perks of being the 12th sign) extremely creative and adaptable    and here are some opportunities:  leading a double life that requires immense inauthenticity is draining. we hate being fake it would be nearly impossible to keep this going for a long stretch of time without resenting and avoiding those events (checks out) emotions are kinda our whole fare so Bruce should be waaaay better at communicating them and at the very least should show profound self awareness showering each of the batkids with love and affection especially nonverbally (ironically) conflict avoidant

With very little thought Danny hands over a flash drive that has everything about the goings on in Amity and then passes out‚Ä¶ And that is where my brain disided to stop and jumped to other topics but I liked the idea that I wanted to draw what I think would be the suit upgrade would be.

Heroes & Villains The DC Animated Universe - Paper Cut-Out Portraits and Profiles DeeDee With the Joker apparently dead Harleen Quinzelle was finally free of the Clown Prince of Crime‚Äôs enthralling influence. She retired from her role as a super villain and carved out a life for herself a life as a civilian.   Some forty years later the reformed villain found herself caring for a pair of twin granddaughters named Delia and Deirdre Dennis. These two sisters were quite the handful. Although ‚ÄòGrandma Harley‚Äô did her best to steer them in the right it was not to be as the sisters had inherited from their grandmother her hunger for action and mayhem as well as the propensity to fall under the sway of smooth-talking scoundrels done up like clowns.   In their early teens Delia and Deirdre fell in with the gang of hooligans known as The Jokerz. Both sisters were highly accomplished gymnasts and hand-to-hand fighters and they took on the joint alias of ‚ÄòDeeDee.‚Äô At first they joined a gang led by an angry cad named Bonk but it was not long before the gang was taken over by a mysterious man who by all rights appeared to be a resurrected Joker.   The Joker sent the gang to steel various components that would eventually enable him to take control of an orbital weapons platform that could fire destructive particle beams down unto earth. The gang remained largely in the dark of the leader‚Äôs ultimately plan and in that he had viciously murdered Bonk none were brave enough to question the matter.   Batman was ultimately able to thwart this plan and stop The Joker. DeeDee and the rest of the Jokerz gang were apprehended. In that Delia and Deirdre were both minors the sisters were released into their grandmother‚Äôs care.  Both Delia and Deirdre were voiced by actress Melissa Joan Hart and appeared in the animated feature Batman Beyond: Return of The Joker.

post_body: My Top 10 Batgirl (2000) Moments This is my list of top 10 Batgirl (2000) moments!! There were so many to choose from but these are my personal favs :)). Counting down from 10 to my absolute favourite.  10. Volving An absolute classic. Perfectly encapsulates what Cass does throughout the entire run and more writers should play with Cass‚Äô use of language like this!  9. Beat Up Every Mob In Gotham Perfect encapsulation of the early Barbara-Cass dynamic and one of the funniest moments in the series. Just love the expressions and the way this shows so much of Cass‚Äô character.  8. Choosing to Write The entirety of issue #2 builds up to this heart-wrenching moment. After delivering a dead man‚Äôs final message to his wife Cass sees the wife‚Äôs reaction to the written message and decides to learn to write. A foundational moment for her character and a nice motherly Babs scene too.   7. Alpha Redemption Capping off issues 35 + 36 Batgirl unmasks herself to convince Alpha (an amnesiac villain) that he doesn‚Äôt have to be defined by his past. Brilliantly displays her core belief that people can change and the fact that her belief pays off makes this moment extremely moving.  6. For God‚Äôs Sake Possibly a controversial pick but I really like this moment because it underscores some of the fundamental conflict between Babs and Cass. They love each other but they don‚Äôt always understand each other particularly in regards to each other‚Äôs disabilities. A painful moment that should have been explored more.   5. Fight For Your Life My favourite Stephanie and Cass moment in this run. You can feel Cass‚Äô grief throughout this hallucination but there‚Äôs also so much hope and love (for Stephanie and for herself). It‚Äôs an amazing conclusion to Cass‚Äô initial suicidal tendencies: instead of desiring death she now actively fights to live.   4. Darknight Detectives  This interaction sums up a lot of Bruce and Cass‚Äô best moments. Cass‚Äô unwavering moral beliefs Bruce‚Äôs pride their instinctive understanding of each other; they just get each other in a way few others do. I picked this one instead of the ‚Äòinstinct/good answer‚Äô moment because it also marks Cass‚Äô development in her detective ability. From Moment 8 above to here the confidence in her mental capacities has grown so much. She really volved!  3. Perfect For A Year I mean of course this had to be here. These lines literally take up 90% of my brain space it‚Äôs an incredibly tense moment that illustrates Cass‚Äô desire to be perfect her need to be useful and good. This issue is also just awesome.  2. You‚Äôre‚Ä¶ Not Another absolute classic. Illustrates Cass‚Äô compassion and her belief that people aren‚Äôt defined by their lineage which is particularly personal to her given her own dad. This struggle between good/bad parent/child defines many of Cass‚Äô best stories.  1. Who Do You Think You Are? + Father‚Äôs Day What else would number 1 be?? Issue 33 is my favourite in the entire run and the entire thing is stacked with moments that could fill up this list. I just love 'who do you think you are‚Äô because it‚Äôs all of Cass‚Äô rage spilling out and yet she still loves David Cain in her own complicated way (and he reciprocates too). Then we have the ending which is the BEST Bruce and Cass moment ever. The sparse meaningful dialogue the expressions the reveal of the TITLE: comic book writing at its finest.   Honorary mention to the Shiva/Cass fight which just narrowly missed out.

post_body: Clark Kent meets Matches Malone (Bruce Wayne) drawing details - Illustration for @susiecarter - Poker Face (AO3) Video edited by: @daviwea  When it comes to DC shipping I‚Äôm an absolute forever fan of wonderbat and I love to make fanart on that theme but I found susiecarter‚Äôs DCEU fanfics really fascinating and I wanted to do an illustration for one of her works one day while drawing my usual pictures so here it is. It was a lot of fun to draw Bruce with his set hair fake mustache and horrible suit as befits Matches Malone.

Do you guys ever think about how overly sexualized Bruce might be because of his Brucie persona. Like he is known as a dumbass drunk who hooks up with all kinds of people all the time.  But he is also a family father and a person and people don‚Äôt see that. They see Brucie rich guy easy to get on with and rich enough to get something out of it and sometimes I wonder if the man ever struggles with that.  On one hand he is batman Mr I live in the shadows my I work alone and don‚Äôt trust anyone. And then he takes of the mask and he is dumb rich kid that everyone wants to use.     <!-- more --> Also thinking in that direction always makes me think about how easily people cross the line when they think it‚Äôs the norm for other people. How many unwanted touches stares and comments the man gets and having experienced those u wonder how he‚Äôd react to the experiences his kids went through.

post_body: Tim Drake head cannons from someone who is very tired and feeling very much like a Tim Drake kin.   -Iced Coffee   I will stand on this head cannon that he will only drink iced coffee. It could be blizzarding out and a chilled XL iced Americano with 2 extra shots and one pump SF vanilla and hazelnut each will be cradled is hands.   However he can justify his pickiness. Iced coffee is easier to down quickly. It‚Äôs quicker to make and in his opinion lighter on the palate. (He doesn‚Äôt take price into account like at all and Jason loves to bring this up)   -Squinty face  He does this thing when he has been up for too long where he tilts his head and squints his eyes because he honestly can‚Äôt tell if he is hallucinating yet. Everyone thinks he is being sarcastic intentionally. He is not. That is his face and the ground is also moving.   -pain meds  I feel like with Tim he sits on both extremes most of the time and this is true with pain meds. post_body: To the characters we make that are women:   I love you. You deserve to be wrong and right and face the consequences of being either one.   be ugly or pretty without it being ensconced with another character‚Äôs development i hope you hate and love things and there‚Äôs not a moral superiority there within the conflict.  I hope the things you care about are specific and personal with genuine reasons that arent what‚Äôs simply expected of your role in a character.  I hope your attractiveness in body and mind isn‚Äôt just a character trait that just happens to make people gravitate to you. I hope you initiate attractiveness be aware of it and take advantage of it when you decide to.   I hope you are written with your own intentions and selfishness even if those intentions are selfless.   I hope you make mistakes and struggle in how to fix them whether it be bc of the inward self or the feelings of others.

post_body: Tim Drake head cannons from someone who is very tired and feeling very much like a Tim Drake kin.   -Iced Coffee   I will stand on this head cannon that he will only drink iced coffee. It could be blizzarding out and a chilled XL iced Americano with 2 extra shots and one pump SF vanilla and hazelnut each will be cradled is hands.   However he can justify his pickiness. Iced coffee is easier to down quickly. It‚Äôs quicker to make and in his opinion lighter on the palate. (He doesn‚Äôt take price into account like at all and Jason loves to bring this up)   -Squinty face  He does this thing when he has been up for too long where he tilts his head and squints his eyes because he honestly can‚Äôt tell if he is hallucinating yet. Everyone thinks he is being sarcastic intentionally. He is not. That is his face and the ground is also moving.   -pain meds  I feel like with Tim he sits on both extremes most of the time and this is true with pain meds. He thinks that giving himself ANY painkillers is blocking off his body‚Äôs way of communicating with him because pain is just a signal that something is wrong.   However if it is too bad so that he cannot move or get what he needs to done he is totally on board. He is so high he feels absolutely nothing and can be seen waving to giant spiders. (It‚Äôs Gotham. To Tim it‚Äôs not super out of the ordinary)  On that topic   -Weird Stuff happening around him   He‚Ä¶ Just moves on. Too much stuff happened with young justice that he really could not care less. He does have to be able to rationalize it but once again that is a minor inconvenience. I personally have not gotten to read the young justice comic but dang dude that stuff was kinda insane.

He‚Äôs thinking hard.     I animated this on a 9hour flight I have an eye infection starting and I woke up forty minutes before a job interview but I did good so it‚Äôs ok. I‚Äôm praying that the quality of the gif doesn‚Äôt get messed up.

post_body: Poison from the Same Vine  Chapter Four  Word Count: 5.5k  Pairing:  Bruce Wayne/Batman x fem!OC  Rating: 18+ eventually  Warnings:  Creator chooses not to use warnings in this chapter.  Author Note: My laptop has died and trying to format the screenshots I made of their texts is proving to send me over the edge. I swear there‚Äôs more.     August Twenty-first  There had been small introductions as time passed. With his secret still safe and kept locked away I proved to be more of an asset with what knowledge I carry from years of consuming stories. But there were some failsafes put in place: Only information that was necessary would be given freely I wouldn‚Äôt talk about the Gotham Gallery unless they showed up and I reserved the right to not say things in the event that it could seriously damage a timeline. You felt the last one was a bit of a copout but after plenty of pleading Batman acquiesced.   In the wee hours of the morning Bruce is still out galavanting around the Gotham skyline. He‚Äôd managed to stop two muggings and a robbery this evening. While he is working I am learning to man the computer with Alfred. According to Bruce it was time I made myself useful if Alfred insisted that I be around the property as he liked to keep a closer eye on me.  But like I‚Äôm helping Batman at the Bat Computer. That‚Äôs fucking dope.  After midnight though it had been oddly quiet. Batman is following a lead down at Gotham Dockyards. The warehouse catwalk that Bats was perched on left him fairly exposed if a rogue flashlight pointed in his direction.  His cowl and earpiece were synced together and able to do text-to-voice when he was in stealth mode. As the newest member of Team Bat I am given a direct line to him. A bonus during my training. Alfred asked me to fire off a message to him to test it out.     <!-- more --> I toss my phone onto the desk in a huff narrowly missing a few controls and I sulk back into the chair. Alfred shoots a look over his shoulder with a chuckle. ‚ÄúIt appears that the sync between your phone and the suit works well.‚Äù  ‚ÄúApparently‚Äù I deadpan. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs an ass.‚Äù  ‚ÄúHe may be my lady. But he‚Äôs the financier for this entire endeavor and as you pointed out with your knowledge he is the world‚Äôs greatest detective. Try to not let him get to you.‚Äù  When Batman‚Äôs feed scans out over the warehouses I can see that there isn‚Äôt much going on thankfully. He‚Äôd gotten a tip from a small-time drug dealer that there was going to be a movement of product near Wearhouse Eight around two this morning.  The mob had been pushing boundaries a little lately and as more wiseguys were getting locked up courtesy of the caped crusader they were trying to get more creative on how they moved their supply in through and out of Gotham.     Though he would come home restless on the quieter nights his adrenaline not having had any sort of cathartic outlet I am silently grateful when he would come home unscathed. At least on Alfred‚Äôs behalf.  Not that Alfred wasn‚Äôt already having me put some of my newly learned medical skills to good use on the days where he would need IVs or mild first aid but I couldn‚Äôt fathom how someone would willingly put themselves through this day in and out.  But I‚Äôm also not a masked vigilante and that‚Äôs not entirely a thing where I‚Äôm from.     ‚ÄúAlfred‚Äù Batman tapped the earpiece in his cowl.  ‚ÄúYes Master Bruce?‚Äù  ‚ÄúI‚Äôm revoking her contact privileges.‚Äù  ‚ÄúYou‚Äôll do nothing of the sort. It‚Äôs a second form of safety that I for one am exceedingly grateful to have in the event that there‚Äôs an emergency and I am indisposed.‚Äù  ‚ÄúWhen have you ever been that indisposed?‚Äù  Alfred scoffs ‚ÄúThat is entirely beside the point Batman. She‚Äôs another set of eyes and ears when you are out at night. Over time I think she could be an integral part of The Batman‚Äôs operations. Give her time to adapt.‚Äù  ‚ÄúShe made you those scones you like didn‚Äôt she?‚Äù  ‚ÄúWell‚Ä¶yes.‚Äù Alfred chuckles and sends an updated schematic to Batman‚Äôs wrist communicator. ‚ÄúRegardless instigating her as Bruce Wayne in the daylight shouldn‚Äôt preclude you from her retaliation when you‚Äôre out as The Batman.‚Äù  Air passes quickly through Batman‚Äôs nostrils in a mild snort before he jumps to a rooftop. ‚ÄúSounds like you‚Äôre on Chase‚Äôs side over mine.‚Äù  ‚ÄúI am not taking sides. I am merely making an observation.‚Äù  There‚Äôs a hum of acceptance rumbling in his throat while his eyes scan across the docks. The only sound he can hear is the mild lapping of water against the piers; and after his earlier run ins perhaps it was best the night had gone quiet.  ‚ÄúI‚Äôm going to give it another twenty minutes. Maybe the intel wasn‚Äôt good. It‚Äôs quiet and it doesn‚Äôt look like anyone‚Äôs around.‚Äù     ‚ÄúTHE SHIT DID YOU SAY THAT FOR?!‚Äù I shout helping to haul Batman‚Äôs body across the table after he‚Äôd staggered off of his bike. ‚ÄúYOU STUPID FUCKING‚Ä¶!‚Äù  ‚ÄúChase‚Äù Alfred reprimands in warning while he retrieves the medical kit from across the lobby of the cave. When he returns he sets me in motion to check vitals.  ‚ÄúFucking stupid‚Äù I mutter ripping the cowl off his head and tossing it aside. While I shine the pen light in his eyes and check for a possible concussion I keep berating him quietly.  ‚Äú ‚ÄòOh it‚Äôs so quiet out. Oh it‚Äôs so calm‚Äô.  ‚ÄúWho says that you moron! Nurses say it? ER gets slammed. Cooks say it? Biggest rush of the night. Cops say it? Whole fucking precinct is hopping. And you think it‚Äôs a good idea as one guy in his pajamas flouncing around at night to say it while you were in the middle of the mob‚Äôs territory?  ‚ÄúFucking stupid.‚Äù  ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs enough Chase.‚Äù Alfred‚Äôs voice cuts into my monologue. ‚ÄúHelp me get the suit off now.‚Äù  It‚Äôs a whole process to get Bruce out of the suit on a good day. There‚Äôs an order that the pieces are put on and taken off. He‚Äôs got it down to a science and can get ready in under five minutes if he is truly pressed for time.  But now? It is unbearably difficult to get him out of his ballistic skin because he keeps writhing on the table and his suit is slick with blood.  ‚ÄúMaster Bruce stay still‚Äù Alfred commands as he fills up a syringe. It‚Äôs one of the cocktails he has included in the kit over the past few years with something for infection.  ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt have time for this‚Äù I hiss between gnashing teeth. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm cutting him out of the pants. I can‚Äôt get to whatever‚Äôs bleeding!‚Äù  ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt you dare‚Äù Bruce growls. ‚ÄúJust get me out of the suit.‚Äù  ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt get this off you! You‚Äôre not exactly helping and I haven‚Äôt taken Batsuit 101 yet you asshole!‚Äù  The trauma shears do not make a dent through the tactical fabric and armor much less cut it open.  ‚ÄúWayne Tech‚Äù Bruce laughs while he tries to peel off his gauntlets with Alfred‚Äôs help. ‚ÄúPricey. Made to withstand‚Ä¶‚Äù  You snatch one of the scalpels from the tray and start slicing into the fabric. Bruce is frozen dumbfounded and Alfred takes this opportunity to administer his cocktail into Bruce‚Äôs now exposed thigh.     ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt move.‚Äù  While my eyes are locked onto his each word is punctuated with an edge as sharp as the tool in my hand before I cut my way from his waist to his ankle. With some assistance from Alfred in peeling blood-soaked tactical fabric from sweat-slick skin my eyes begin evaluating the damage. A four-inch slash runs along his inner thigh from where he had a run in with a switchblade.  To his credit Batman was spartan-kicking a guy off of the steel catwalk in the warehouse when the guy took a piece of Batman with him as he fell.  ‚ÄúEvaluate Chase.‚Äù  Your eyes snap up to Alfred whose stoic demeanor gives me enough of an inclination that Bruce isn‚Äôt in any mortal danger. Regardless I sit stunned for a beat before I physically shake my head and stare back at the wound.  ‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt be serious‚Äù Bruce groans sitting up on his elbows. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre going to just let her take over?‚Äù  You blink twice before irrigating the area and wound ‚ÄúYeah what he said.‚Äù  ‚ÄúThis is an unfortunate but necessary component to working with The Batman‚Äù he nods before walking to retrieve a suture kit. ‚ÄúHe will be injured from time to time. He bleeds. He needs time to recover and heal. More time than those bloody comics of yours allow.‚Äù  He washes his hands and opens the kit for me. ‚ÄúClean yourself up. I‚Äôll slow the bleeding down with a tourniquet. But you‚Äôll be fixing him up because you can and because you must.‚Äù  Any argument dies on my tongue and I take my leave to scrub my hands. Over the sound of rushing water I hear Bruce arguing with Alfred presumably over my insertion into the medical aspect of tonight‚Äôs events. The exchanging of words and the fervor with which Bruce seems to voice his displeasure are enough to sow doubt in my mind.  ‚Äú‚Ä¶because you can and because you must‚Ä¶‚Äù  ‚ÄúAlright Alfred. I can stitch him up once you‚Äôve cleaned the wound out. You did say my sutures look better than yours‚Äù I try to make light of the situation before me with false bravado.  The butler nods cleans the wound and situates a towel across Bruce‚Äôs lap.  ‚ÄúI will be close my lady. But you need to act quickly.‚Äù  ‚ÄúI know‚Äù I agree clinically. ‚ÄúIf I don‚Äôt start now I won‚Äôt jump to it when it really counts.‚Äù  He hums quietly to himself. ‚ÄúType of stitch you plan to use? Remember your patient doesn‚Äôt listen and tends to not follow doctor‚Äôs orders.‚Äù  ‚ÄúI can hear you you know‚Äù Bruce turns his head to side-eye Alfred. ‚ÄúPretending I‚Äôm not here isn‚Äôt going to help.‚Äù  ‚ÄúI‚Äôm thinking an interrupted vertical mattress suture will work that way if he pulls a stitch the whole set isn‚Äôt shot. And maybe a little on a zig-zag to minimize scarring?‚Äù  ‚ÄúIn this particular instance I‚Äôd be partial to the continuous subcuticular. But your logic is sound enough. You‚Äôre using monocryl so it‚Äôll be absorbed over time assuming he doesn‚Äôt rip his leg open.‚Äù  You nod pull the needle through his skin. Bruce jumps and slams his hands on the table.  ‚ÄúBefore you growl at her again‚Äù Alfred reaches across him to the tray. ‚ÄúI have another shot to administer.‚Äù  ‚ÄúThanks for the anesthetic Alfred. Don‚Äôt feel like getting stabbed more than once today‚Äù the vigilante‚Äôs dark humor ebbing into the conversation.  You peer up over Bruce‚Äôs leg at Alfred and ask ‚ÄúWhy the subcuticular? Doesn‚Äôt that hurt?‚Äù  ‚ÄúOf course it does.‚Äù  Bruce closes his eyes and rights his head on the table ‚ÄúYou make it sound like you stitch vengefully on purpose.‚Äù  ‚ÄúOnly when you deserve to learn a lesson Master Bruce.‚Äù  The needle lances through his skin after I tie off another suture and he flinches.  ‚ÄúHow long until the anesthetic kicks in?‚Äù  ‚ÄúWhat anesthetic? I administered a tetanus shot‚Äù Alfred mumbles sitting down at the nearby chair to monitor my work. Bruce cracks an eye open at him and scowls.  ‚ÄúI suggest you harken back on the training you have to regulate your own pain and come to terms with it while Chase is here with us. She‚Äôs a part of this team now Master Bruce.‚Äù     With only two stitches left to go my row is neat and nearly looks like it could be photographed for a textbook. Alfred occasionally interjected a word here and there to either make me pause or propel me forward but all in all this wasn‚Äôt the worst experience. I mean I am sewing up Batman but‚Ä¶you know.   Wearing his blood up to my elbows a mistake of wiping my brow with my forearm caused a smear of rust to mar my face.  ‚ÄúTwo left Bruce. How are you doing?‚Äù the words quiet but not unkind.  ‚ÄúFine‚Äù he all but grumbles from up the table.  In truth I feel poorly about how Alfred‚Äôs done him dirty tonight. You didn‚Äôt intend to start a family dispute nor did I relish the fact another human being was in pain at the expense of my needle. There was a point where I tried to reach for a vial so that I could administer local anesthetic near the wound but Alfred tutted at me and asked that I get back to work.  ‚ÄúHe will not always have the luxury of pain medication my lady. He can relearn that lesson tonight too.‚Äù  Not once did Bruce twitch or flinch after that while I sewed him up; his eyes closing and more than likely putting his body into a meditative state. An apology fell from my lips when I thought I had dug too deeply with the needle halfway through the gash but still he hadn‚Äôt moved.  With the final suture tied off and cut the scissors and needle are dropped into the tray with a loud clang disturbing the mild peace that had settled over the three of us. Alfred‚Äôs keen eyes had watched my handiwork every step of the way and I feel them upon me again when I stand to stretch.  ‚ÄúWhy don‚Äôt you head upstairs‚Äù he stands behind me with a gentle hand on my shoulder ‚ÄúAnd shower for the night Miss Chase. I‚Äôll see to Master Bruce and get him to bed.‚Äù  Autopilot has me nod in agreement or resignation. I don‚Äôt think I could tell which at this point after the last of the adrenaline left my system. All the same I head upstairs and shower until the rust in the runoff runs clean.     The past week had afforded me a courtesy while I worked nights for Batman: I‚Äôd been afforded a guest room at Alfred‚Äôs behest and Bruce‚Äôs grunted agreement. God it had the plushest mattress I‚Äôve ever slept on. Tonight though? It calls to me after I get out of the shower and I want nothing more than to collapse into it and wake up sometime after noon like Wayne tends to do. But my mind returns back to the tone of voice Bruce used and his adamant refusal for my assistance.   It continues to replay in my mind over and over until I find myself downstairs swiping my keys from the hook in the garage and then I‚Äôm leaving the property. The city lights streak over my windshield as the first tendrils of dawn creep at the horizon. The pedal to my car flattens out my car glinting through what remains of the city‚Äôs shadows; that‚Äôs when I find myself inside the living room of my apartment.  Pieces of the night are hazy while others maintain exceptional clarity. How I drove here is a little foggy: I don‚Äôt really remember the traffic or the actual driving nothing outside of the speed grounding me to reality.     It‚Äôs not that I owe him anything. I don‚Äôt. Telling myself that I don‚Äôt over and over is becoming a mantra I didn‚Äôt think I‚Äôd put into daily practice. A memory of that phrase being repeated the whole way home surfaced briefly before it dissolves into another where I am stitching his leg up with the same thing going through my head.  It shouldn‚Äôt bother me that he‚Äôs hurt or that he might be pissed at me. He‚Äôs the one that keeps galavanting out at night regardless of the risks regardless of how well versed he is in martial arts. Though he‚Äôs still around the age of a freshly graduated college kid. He‚Äôs young. He‚Äôs human.  It shouldn‚Äôt pull at my mind and heart.  But it does.        ‚ÄúYou will go down to that shop and apologize to her‚Äù the butler‚Äôs normally calm demeanor is far more bristly this afternoon.  Wayne pushes himself up in bed and winces the stitches pinching as he moves. ‚ÄúYou both said that I need to rest so that I can heal and now you want me to get out of bed and go down there? Mixed signals at best.‚Äù  ‚ÄúThat woman stitched you up better than I do‚Äù he snaps ‚Äúand she fled out of here after her shower before I could tell her as much. This is your fault.‚Äù  ‚ÄúMy fault?‚Äù his voice still rough with sleep. Alfred rips open the curtains and Bruce shirks from the afternoon light. ‚ÄúHow is this my fault?‚Äù  ‚ÄúMaster Bruce I‚Äôm saying this with all due respect but you need to figure out if you want her to be here or not.  ‚ÄúYou cannot keep changing your mind pending the situation deciding if you find utility in her participation here. Miss Chase is navigating your mood swings and indecisiveness as best she can.  ‚ÄúYou are already enough of a liability being a part of my life Alfred‚Äù Bruce growls and leans forward. ‚ÄúHow many times did people take shots at you to get to me growing up? You think having another person around is going to make that more manageable?  ‚ÄúI know how much you want this to work because it‚Äôs a means of keeping me safe. I can wholly understand that but‚Äù he looks around the room exasperated ‚Äúwhat I do isn‚Äôt safe. Protecting Gotham doesn‚Äôt put me into a line of safety.‚Äù  Alfred sighs ‚ÄúI understand that Master Bruce. But in this singular circumstance having that additional shroud and information would be of more benefit than your pessimistic foresight.  ‚ÄúFurthermore while I understand the delicacy of the matter and the circumstances of this operation rather acutely shouldn‚Äôt it be her decision?‚Äù        From the back room I hear how gravel tears into the fabric of Cujo‚Äôs voice and the sudden cease of work on the shop floor. There‚Äôs murmuring back and forth between men it‚Äôs all I can do to finish throwing towels into the dryer before going to investigate what‚Äôs going on.  ‚ÄúYou got a lotta nerve showing up here‚Äù Cujo gnashes out shoulders square to the intruder.  ‚ÄúLook‚Äù a pacifying baritone floats over amped up testosterone ‚ÄúI just need to talk to her.‚Äù  I round the corner and see all four guys creating a wall between me and the perceived threat who happens to sound a lot like Bruce.  ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know what the hell you did to her‚Äù Irish points a finger in Wayne‚Äôs direction. ‚ÄúThe past two days she‚Äôs be borderline silent without so much as a fucking sarcastic comment. And we know that she went to your place after work the other night.‚Äù  Jax crosses himself and I take quiet measured steps into the room. ‚ÄúYeah. And if you‚Äôre gonna come in here and tell us that your butler is the one that made her upset you got another thing comin‚Äô. That dude‚Äôs the sweetest to her outside of us.‚Äù  ‚ÄúI came down here to apologize to her‚Äù Bruce tries to placate.  Not that Batman couldn‚Äôt take all four of the shop guys Bruce Wayne is a bit of a pansy with a lot of the storytelling I‚Äôve been doing as of late. He doesn‚Äôt want to have to cross lines if he doesn‚Äôt have to.  While I do happen to get a little glee from this part of the song and dance routine and much to my better judgment I rest a hand on Cujo‚Äôs shoulder and wedge myself through.  A quirk of a brow and attitude settles into my voice ‚ÄúThen apologize.‚Äù  ‚ÄúLook can we go somewhere and talk?‚Äù  Irish takes a step forward ‚ÄúWhy you afraid to say what you wanna say in front of us?‚Äù  ‚ÄúYeah a little‚Äù Bruce allows and I chuckle to myself. He makes a point to shift from one leg to the other and looks across the room. ‚ÄúI should get friends like you have Chase. Jeez.‚Äù  When I take another step forward Jax puts a hand on my elbow. ‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt have to go with him girl. He can stay right here if you want; or we can throw his bitch-ass out.‚Äù  I laugh and pat his hand. ‚ÄúFunny as that would be I think he‚Äôd rather do his groveling without an audience. Or you four scaring the shit out of him. I‚Äôll humor him this time.  ‚ÄúI‚Äôll text you if he needs his ass beat. Chances are he wouldn‚Äôt be able to get to his car before you got to him.‚Äù  ‚ÄúDamn straight.‚Äù Dozer glares daggers at Wayne before begrudgingly turning to his client and going back to work.  There‚Äôs a wave of relief that cascades down Bruce‚Äôs body before he holds the front door open for me to pass through.  We walk for a few minutes in silence the humid June air is stifling in the Gotham heat. I can‚Äôt help but let my mind wander for a few minutes thinking about how nice it is that the shop is in the East End and only a block from the Sprang River; how there‚Äôs a really comforting cross breeze coming up from the water. The guys would probably prop the door open today to help with the heat.  ‚ÄúI‚Äôve been doing some thinking‚Äù Bruce‚Äôs voice drops into its more comfortable Batman range. ‚ÄúAnd I need you to listen.‚Äù  When I stop along the river walk he follows suit and I cross my arms in front of my chest. ‚ÄúI need to listen? I thought this was supposed to be an apology. Because if it is you suck at this.‚Äù  His eyes narrow and he bites back ‚ÄúAre you always this much of a pain in the ass?‚Äù  I feel something twist in my gut a vice that ignites a guilted rage at feeling sorry for him the other night. Why do I feel empathy for this asshole? He‚Äôs a privileged ass with more issues than I‚Äôm equipped to deal with. Why did I have to get stuck here of all places.  ‚ÄúYou know what Bruce? I can just walk back to that shop and those guys will never let you walk back in again.‚Äù  He smirks and stuffs his hands in his pockets. ‚ÄúThey could try. I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôll go the way they would think it should.‚Äù  ‚ÄúOh come off it‚Äù I groan. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre going to go after a bunch of innocent men trying to protect someone who‚Ä¶‚Äù  ‚ÄúNo you come off it‚Äù he growls back forcefully shedding his suit jacket and draping it over his arm. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt try and play games. This is real Chase. All of this; all that I do is my reality every single day. Don‚Äôt you dare stand there and try to pull some lofty stance on how I should conduct myself.‚Äù  Bruce leans his forearms on the stone wall and gazes across the water towards The Bowery.  ‚ÄúWhat I do isn‚Äôt safe Chase. I‚Äôm trying to get you to understand that.‚Äù  ‚ÄúAs the person who‚Äôs got some of the mythology in my skull pretty sure I know what you‚Äôre about.‚Äù  ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs different when it‚Äôs real. A veteran knows war differently than someone reading about it in a history book.‚Äù  Intrigued I move closer and lean on the wall with him lowering my voice ‚ÄúI can appreciate that statement.‚Äù  ‚ÄúIn your talks with Alfred has he brought up what happened when I was twelve?‚Äù I shake my head and he nods without looking at me eyes still focused across the river.  ‚ÄúAlfred had been waiting for me to finish school. I had French and Japanese lessons after school that semester‚Äù he ponders thoughtfully.   ‚ÄúThe French lesson was only three blocks away and we usually walked it for the sake of keeping up appearances as Bruce Wayne. He‚Äôd park out front of the building walk to the school collect me and walk me to my lesson. We‚Äôd done it for a few years and I didn‚Äôt think much of it. There‚Äôd always been some level of hesitancy or feeling as if I was always being watched. The Son of Gotham was always under a microscope; I still am to a degree.  ‚ÄúOne day in February‚Ä¶right before my birthday actually I came out to the courtyard and Alfred wasn‚Äôt there. He‚Äôd never not been where he was supposed to be. My teacher snatched me by my shoulder before I could take off to find him and dragged me inside. Guess Alfred and I owe her for that one.‚Äù  ‚ÄúGood‚Äù the word blurts out of me before I can catch myself turning to stare at him. ‚ÄúAt twelve? What would you have been able to do Bruce? Alfred wouldn‚Äôt have wanted you to do something so rash.‚Äù  Bruce looks over at me with a knowing expression. ‚ÄúHmpf. Sounds like a lecture I‚Äôve gotten from him once before. What makes you say that?‚Äù  ‚ÄúBecause I wouldn‚Äôt want Ayla to do something stupid like that.‚Äù I clear the lump in my throat and turn back to the water.  ‚ÄúWhat happened?‚Äù  ‚ÄúHe‚Äôd been jumped and taken hostage when the robbers realized I wasn‚Äôt with him. When he refused to give me up or act as bait they beat him. They‚Äôd had him for a few days before they cut him loose after GCPD had put out a bolo and done a press conference on it.  ‚ÄúAlfred had a broken rib a concussion a couple broken fingers‚Ä¶all because they wanted to get me.‚Äù  A heavy sigh escapes him bowing his head and closing his eyes. ‚ÄúSpeaking of our recent history anyone that gets close to a Wayne ends up beaten bloody or dead. What if that‚Äôs something that Alfred and I don‚Äôt want for you?‚Äù  I mean he‚Äôs got a point. Assuming that this isn‚Äôt psychosis and I‚Äôm not in a coma or hell and this genuinely is my reality now‚Ä¶is that something that I‚Äôm willing to risk? What if there‚Äôs a way to go home and I end up permanently getting stuck here or I can‚Äôt get back because I‚Äôm hurt or kidnapped?  But again what if this is the way life is going to be? I don‚Äôt owe him anything. But something keeps whispering to me that this is where I‚Äôm supposed to be I guess. That this is what I should be doing.  And that‚Äôs stupid.  ‚ÄúConsidering the sheer absurdity of it all I don‚Äôt really think that matters. Look if you want me to help fine. If not that‚Äôs also fine. I get it from the logic of it all. But you‚Äôve been an absolute jackass to me lately‚Ä¶‚Äù  ‚Äú‚Ä¶I know‚Ä¶‚Äù  ‚Äú‚Ä¶and all I‚Äôm trying to do is help out and do the things that you and Alfred ask of me but you just brood and grouch over it because ‚ÄòI like to jump around in my underoos in the dark and I am the night‚Äô. And God forbid anyone else come to help out‚Ä¶‚Äù  ‚ÄúChase‚Ä¶‚Äù  ‚Äú‚Ä¶because I have to do everything alone and I‚Äôm sad and broody. Newsflash mister everything you‚Äôve done or will do is because of family so‚Ä¶‚Äù  ‚Äú‚Ä¶I‚Äôm sorry.‚Äù  My mind shorts out mid-ramble and I blink a few times almost as if I‚Äôm resetting like a damn computer.  The organic smell of the river hits my senses like a truck and I do a sharp inhale before peering over to Bruce who is now turned toward me with one elbow on the wall.  ‚ÄúLook I am sorry. I know that you mean well and can be an asset to the team I can see that. But It‚Äôs just been Alfred and I for nearly two years working on this thing. How are you supposed to integrate into the team and be safe?‚Äù  ‚ÄúIt is what it is‚Äù I offer turning around to face the street and lean back as coolly as possible. ‚ÄúI can tell you that on paper I understand the risks that I‚Äôm getting myself into. I know how some of those stories end. I also fully understand that you aren‚Äôt going to always be able to bail me out of things simply because you are who you are.  ‚ÄúBut if you don‚Äôt want me working for you I won‚Äôt be broadcasting anything. I‚Äôm not that spiteful. Besides who‚Äôd believe me?‚Äù  ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre oddly patient with me about all of this.‚Äù  ‚ÄúI know‚Äù I laugh with a smile shaking my head. ‚ÄúNo idea why.‚Äù  ‚ÄúWant a job?‚Äù  ‚ÄúI already have one of those‚Äù my hands slip into my pockets and I motion with my head for him to follow me back to the shop. ‚ÄúUnless you‚Äôre offering a supplemental position.‚Äù  Bruce catches up. ‚ÄúSomething like that. Interested?‚Äù  ‚ÄúI might be. How‚Äôs the pay?‚Äù  ‚ÄúNegotiable considering.‚Äù  I shrug ‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs something I can pencil into my schedule.  ‚ÄúYou‚Äôll have to make sure you‚Äôre in my good graces in the future or I know four very protective barbers that‚Äôll try their best to kick your ass.‚Äù  ‚ÄúI have no doubt that they wouldn‚Äôt do their damndest‚Äù his tone much lighter than it had been at the start of the conversation.  When we reach the shop the guys leer out the window for any sign of distress on my part and I wave them all off. The smell of product Barbasol and Dozer‚Äôs burnt coffee swirl in the air but at least the cool breeze from the river is doing something for the heat.  Bruce apologizes again and shakes my hand rather officially in view of his jury.  An idea sparks in my mind when he turns to leave. ‚ÄúQuestion for you.‚Äù  ‚ÄúShoot.‚Äù  ‚ÄúWhen you were in Paris on your ‚Äòsojourn‚Äô‚Äù I add finger quotes in the air ‚ÄúDid you meet Lucius Fox?‚Äù  Bruce‚Äôs eyes shift from side to side and he takes a step back towards me. ‚ÄúI did. He‚Äôd worked for my father at one point I just happened to be in the right place at the right time and stopped a mugging. I try to be a good upstanding citizen when I can be. Why?‚Äù  ‚ÄúSomething for you to think about later I suppose.‚Äù  There is a small hum that rattles in his chest paired with a knowing nod before he turns on his heel and heads for his car. ‚ÄúAlfred expects you for dinner after work this evening. I‚Äôll inform him that you‚Äôre coming.‚Äù  ‚ÄúOf course.‚Äù  Cujo watches from the doorway as Bruce slides into his car and drives off. When I turn to look at him there‚Äôs an air of skepticism about him and I can‚Äôt help but wonder how his intuition must be going off like an alarm bell.  ‚ÄúHe apologize enough?‚Äù  Crossing the threshold and heading to the coffee pot I dump its burnt contents and begin making a new half pot to get us through the afternoon.  ‚ÄúYeah Cujo he did. He might be a pansy-ass bitch but he‚Äôs not heartless.‚Äù  Irish points his clippers at me and waves them in the air ‚ÄúHe messes with you like that again he has us to answer to. I‚Äôll burn his house down. On God.‚Äù  ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think it‚Äôll come to that‚Äù I try and pacify them with my charm and easy smile. ‚ÄúWe talked out our issue like adults and know where each other stands on it‚Ä¶not that we won‚Äôt potentially argue in the future but you know‚Ä¶‚Äù  Jax jabs an elbow into Dozer‚Äôs side and snickers ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs it like being one of us and a friend of Bruce Wayne‚Äôs?‚Äù  ‚ÄúWhat do you mean?‚Äù Cujo leans forward on the counter listening intently.  ‚ÄúAll I mean is that dude‚Äôs richer than God right? And I ain‚Äôt ever seen a single tabloid where he‚Äôs got a circle of friends around him like us ya know? But then Chase winds up in Gotham and now Wayne‚Äôs nearly a regular down at the shop checking in on her.  ‚ÄúEither that or he thinks she‚Äôs fine as hell.‚Äù  Dozer shoves Jax playfully across the room the shop erupting into a roar of laughter. I wipe tears from the corners of my eyes wheezing and sputtering while I try to regain some semblance of control over this conversation.  ‚ÄúWell God knows if I wasn‚Äôt going to go on a date with Dozer after he so valiantly saved my life Wayne‚Äôs not got a chance.  ‚ÄúBesides he‚Äôs not that bad honestly. Imagine growing up and having to second guess every single interaction and friendship you had because you had money status or the Wayne name. How many people tried to take advantage of that after his parents died you think? If anything he probably appreciates the fact I‚Äôm honest and call him out on his bullshit.‚Äù  ‚ÄúGirl where were you when we were growin‚Äô up‚Äù Irish hollers from his chair. ‚ÄúCan you imagine how much trouble we wouldn‚Äôt have gotten in to had she been around? Damn.‚Äù  ‚ÄúThat or we woulda just ignored her and done it anyway‚Äù Jax laughs and dabs up Irish.  Cujo shakes his head and pours himself a coffee. ‚ÄúNah. The way y‚Äôall wrapped around her finger now? You‚Äôda been done for when we were young. Woulda done anything she wanted. You woulda been a bunch of choir boys and I wouldn‚Äôt have had to bail your asses out of so much of that hood shit.  ‚ÄúI think there‚Äôs more than meets the eye with Chase boys. Probably always will be. A lady of mystery. Our lady of mystery.‚Äù  I pour my own cup of coffee and clink it off of Cujo‚Äôs with a smile ‚ÄúI‚Äôll drink to that.‚Äù

post_body: Dinner at the manor and everyone‚Äôs there but it‚Äôs so quiet that the only sounds are utensils against plates breathing and the occasional crunchy chewing sound. No one says a word. Bruce has not been this stressed in ages. Like at least a week.

*batman fanfic# I actually have this idea to Bruce Wayne.. what if?! Batman get hit by a weapon or a magic stone that can bring him back to being young before the biggest shock in his life. and The Justice League must remind him of the incident with his parents if they wants him to return to what he was‚Ä¶ although this took some time because they did not know how to deal with The problem from the beginning and they were really surprised first at how Bruce when he was young he was the most beautiful and kindest child in their lives despite his young age (10 before the accident). He was very polite smart and fun with everyone. Which made their hearts break when they knew what they had to do to bring him back.as the Batmanüòî.
