post_body: Like no ok.    We need to talk about the insane amount of autistic-coding in dracze‚Äôs half way across.   Its impossibly good. Detective bruce having Neurodivergent joker under his care even tho hes just as unable to take care of himself as joker is and has his own issues he should deal with. The detective (who lets face it is probably autistic in turn) constantly trying to read into the Neurodivergent‚Äôs behavior to make sense of it sometimes without even realizing it which both helps and doesn‚Äôt because the Neurodivergent obviously feels like hes just a puzzle trying to be figured out by who‚Äôs basically in charge of him and monitoring him no less. Joker retorting back hes not some damsel in distress having to fight in order to not be seen that way snapping when bruce picks his fights rightfully so‚Ä¶ while simultaneously refuses or isnt able to fucking communicate his most basic of needs because he doesn‚Äôt NEED any help!!! He can take care of himself!! and no ones helped him in his time of need afterall why else would he have ended up where he is?? Bruce further proving his point when he shows hes not qualified despite being the most qualified person there could possibly be AND-  And like dont even get me started on the meta aspects too like bruce reading into joker is probably what the reader does as well so when joker calls him out hes also targeting the reader‚Äì GAAAHH ITS TOO GOOD TO BE REAL  DRACZE THE THINGS YOU DO TO ME I SWEAR     Or at least thats how ive read things it might be wrong     Ive just always found interesting how autistic coding in these two is less talked about than queer coding when at least in my opinion they kinda go hand in hand‚Ä¶. i love how HWA deals with both      I feel so lucky this fic is real fr

DP x DC AU - Bodyswap by death  Saw this idea that I‚Äôd sorta forgotten about in my docs the other day. Basically Jason and Danny die at the same time or something. This could be when Jason y'know dies but Danny I believe was during a capture - I think my intention was that his parents had found out about Phantom and vivisected him however it killed him (like for real.) And they buried the body in secret out of ‚Äúrespect‚Äù.   Anyways when the punch to reality happens instead of Jay waking up in his grave.. He wakes up in Danny‚Äôs and vice-versa. The two of them switched bodies.  Danny-in-Jason‚Äôs body is confused and wanders around but is ultimately found. Maybe he‚Äôs a halfa-again (My Jason‚Äôs halfa design is very reminiscent of Ghost Rider tbh) and he ends up becoming a vigilante but ultimately he‚Äôs found by the bats and ‚Äúbrought home‚Äù - But Danny isn‚Äôt Jason.. However he was a scared and lonely kid. Who wanted a family. A family to love him and suddenly.. He can have that.   Meanwhile Jason is extremely confused and suspicious because like?? What.. The hell just happened? He‚Äôs in a different body (Although they look similar and based on what he was‚Ä¶ buried in he‚Äôs assuming they‚Äôre both transmasc as well which weird) and in a place he‚Äôs never been to much less heard of. But Jason‚Äôs a survivalist and he‚Äôs gonna figure out what‚Äôs going on and he‚Äôs going home.  (It gets messy when he finds out he‚Äôs not completely alive. It gets messier when he finds out this kid died unjustified and Jason wants to help he wants to let this kids ‚Äúmysterious‚Äù disappearance be uncovered but he‚Äôs still living with the fact he died. Living with the fact that he misses his family. He wants to go home)   I‚Äôm not sure where I was going with it but ultimately Danny pretends to be Jason and Jason is on his own trying to get home.  If this little idea inspires anyone to create something feel free to show me!!

post_body: Weekly Batman/DC Fic Recs (1) This week I‚Äôve read two delightful character studies one focused on Barbara Gordon and the other on Jason Todd. There‚Äôs also a hilarious SI/OC fic from the perspective of Tim Drake and two fantastic fics where Lonnie Machin/Anarky plays a major role. post_body: I was reminded of a Thing from the reblogs on the Mermay 03 Prompt Very similar vibes. But with platonic omegaverse and dragons. Gotham? Already cursed to hell and back. But then another curse was formed via the museum bringing in this strange statue. That of course got stolen because solid crystal and gold. Then got broken split in half. And oop.  New Curse.   Now before I get into the curse lemme explain the omegaverse side of things. Everyone is born a secondary gender labeled Alpha Omega or Beta. There‚Äôs also medical conditions where one is neither usually a mix of genetic and hormonal issues. Gotham however is Weird. They have no set scent according to Outsiders. Really? They can shift and switch (Yes there‚Äôs a large LGTBQ percentage in the population) at will. It can take months for someone new to the city but those that have been there for a few generations can do it in hours. For those like the Waynes or other founders who have been there since the beginning of the city? Minutes.  It‚Äôs more than a little unnerving to Outsiders who are used to things staying the same.   But that curse (or blessing as others call it) mixed with the new dragon one. See they can all change into draconic form and do their best to keep that secret. But they also have different forms depending on the secondary sex they are at that time.      <!-- more --> @f4nd0m-fun & @golden-buddle idk if u‚Äôd be interested in this but-

DP x DC AU - Bodyswap by death  Saw this idea that I‚Äôd sorta forgotten about in my docs the other day. Basically Jason and Danny die at the same time or something. This could be when Jason y'know dies but Danny I believe was during a capture - I think my intention was that his parents had found out about Phantom and vivisected him however it killed him (like for real.) And they buried the body in secret out of ‚Äúrespect‚Äù.   Anyways when the punch to reality happens instead of Jay waking up in his grave.. He wakes up in Danny‚Äôs and vice-versa. The two of them switched bodies.  Danny-in-Jason‚Äôs body is confused and wanders around but is ultimately found. Maybe he‚Äôs a halfa-again (My Jason‚Äôs halfa design is very reminiscent of Ghost Rider tbh) and he ends up becoming a vigilante but ultimately he‚Äôs found by the bats and ‚Äúbrought home‚Äù - But Danny isn‚Äôt Jason.. However he was a scared and lonely kid. Who wanted a family. A family to love him and suddenly.. He can have that.   Meanwhile Jason is extremely confused and suspicious because like?? What.. The hell just happened? He‚Äôs in a different body (Although they look similar and based on what he was‚Ä¶ buried in he‚Äôs assuming they‚Äôre both transmasc as well which weird) and in a place he‚Äôs never been to much less heard of. But Jason‚Äôs a survivalist and he‚Äôs gonna figure out what‚Äôs going on and he‚Äôs going home.  (It gets messy when he finds out he‚Äôs not completely alive. It gets messier when he finds out this kid died unjustified and Jason wants to help he wants to let this kids ‚Äúmysterious‚Äù disappearance be uncovered but he‚Äôs still living with the fact he died. Living with the fact that he misses his family. He wants to go home)   I‚Äôm not sure where I was going with it but ultimately Danny pretends to be Jason and Jason is on his own trying to get home.  If this little idea inspires anyone to create something feel free to show me!!

BATMAN: THE ANIMATED SERIES - On Sale INFO!  Andy Fairhurst takes us back to an art deco Gotham with his newest set of prints for Batman: The Animated Series!   With a brand new animated Batman series from Bruce Timm around the corner we wanted to look back at our favorite Bruce Timm (and Paul Dini) project of all time Batman: The Animated Series through Andy‚Äôs stellar set of prints for the classic cartoon. Using specific episodes Andy‚Äôs prints portray his intriguing interpretations of some of the more notorious B:TAS episodes including Almost Got ‚ÄòIm and Two-Face featuring so many iconic villains from Batman‚Äôs mythology.   Andy‚Äôs prints will be available for purchase on Friday (7/12) @ 12PM ET on our homepage Bottleneckgallery.com.! post_body: ‚ÄúBatman: Death of a Family‚Äù by Jim Starlin Would actually make a really good Splatterpunk book.   Spoiler and Trigger Warnings this book is intended for 18+ audiences only reader discretion is advised. Graphic depictions of violence gore self harm mental illness emotional abuse child abuse and adult situations are in this comic.  Not only is the artwork pure nightmare fuel.  If we take out the fact that the characters are the internationally beloved Batman and Joker it drops your expectations of what the story should be and conveys true horror. There‚Äôs this guy in an asylum who has stalked and harassed an orphaned billionaire for an over a decade now. The stalker is completely obsessed with the billionaire. His cell is filled with newspaper clippings magazine articles personal drawings and a weird shrine with a teddy bear covered in lipstick stains named after the billionaire that the stalker talks to and sleeps with at night. The stalker has concluded that the only reason his billionaire is ignoring him is because he is spending too much time with his family so the logical conclusion is to get rid of his family. The stalker decides he must prove that he knows the billionaire better than his family and that the billionaire doesn‚Äôt show his ‚Äúreal self‚Äù to the public and is really wearing a mask around everyone. The stalker wants to show the billionaire his ‚Äútrue self‚Äô in return so he has an unlicensed plastic surgeon cut his face off and fashion it into a mask for the stalker to wear. The stalker then escapes from the asylum and goes about his plan to make a ‚ÄúLove Letter‚Äù for the billionaire. He kidnaps the billionaire‚Äôs fianc√©e children friends and surrogate father one by one individually physically and psychologically torturing them. The stalker failed to have his severed face mask leathered or preserved in any way. During his sessions with each victim his face slowly begins to rot insects have infested his face and he has developed a horrid infection spraying bl**d puss spit and bits of decade flesh onto each victim while speaking to them. The stalker then proceeds to enact his love letter by setting an elaborate dinner for the billionaire. Each of the kidnaped victims are set as guest at the dinner table with bandaged faces a silver covered dish in front of them. The stalker now dressed in an expensive suit is busily applying lipstick to his severed face mask because he wants to look ‚Äúgood‚Äù for his billionaire. Once the billionaire arrives the stalker physically overpowers him even though the stalker is extremely thin with atrophied muscles and a sever staff infection while the billionaire is in good physical condition with the body of an athlete. The Stalker ties up the billionaire and sets him at the head of the table he calls the billionaire ‚ÄúDarling‚Äù and tells the billionaire that he is a king and the stalker is his humble jester. The stalker proceeds to explain how the billionaire doesn‚Äôt need his family just him and that he feels like the billionaire‚Äôs family if interfering with their one-on-one time. The billionaire tells the stalker he is insane and means nothing to him that he never wants to see him again to leave him and his family alone (the whole classic victim spell that everyone screams at their stalker)! When the billionaire‚Äôs family starts to wake up the stalker pulls back the silver platters to reveal all his family‚Äôs faces have been cut off and served on plates of ice‚Ä¶eventually the billionaire is able to overcome the extremely thin mentally ill gangrenous stalker with atrophied muscles.) I‚Äôm not sure why the billionaire couldn‚Äôt before honestly I guess because of plot development.) The billionaire then goes on to free his family and is relieved to see they all still have their faces. The bandages and faces were only FX effects. The stalker is carted off back to the Asylum and the story should end on a happy note but just like real life there is no happy ending. The billionaire‚Äôs family now acts distant towards him a wedge has been driven between him and the people he loves most ultimately giving the stalker exactly what he wanted in the end.

post_body: The Misteryous Visitor 5 Batfamily x batsis (platonic!)  Synopsis: The argument between Talia and Bruce is catastrophic from beginning to end and while the whole truth is revealed neither of them wants to let go of you. Strange was always a greater danger than he let on and was closer than he ever thought.  Warnings: Family discussion; meaningless kiss; aggression; blood; kidnapping; maternal possessiveness;   Word count:4.5k  Note: Talia has a slightly different relationship with Bruce in my story compared to the canon being more tense than the impression I got when I watched scenes between the two of them.  I forget to mention that English is not my first language forgive me for any mistakes.  Part 1 - Part 2 - Part 3 - Part 4 - Part 5 - Part 6  <!-- more -->   ‚ÄúIs it true?‚Äù Bruce asked quickly barely giving Talia time to dare say anything before him. The woman rolled her eyes still with her back to him and prepared to maintain her confident pose.  She turned to face him and took a few moments to admire the vision blatantly diverting her eyes to his lips and seeing how the messy shirt had given him a more fierce and attractive aura. Their relationship was complicated that‚Äôs a fact but she could never stop finding the man in front of her charmingly handsome.  ‚ÄúYou‚Äôll need to be more specific than that‚Äù Talia‚Äôs voice dripped with a sweet and wicked tone as she walked toward him. Bruce violently stood up from the chair when he saw her hand reach towards him and imposed his height over hers to intimidate.  ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt play the cynic.‚Äù There was a suppressed fury in his tone and she was sure he was using the last bit of self-control that still possessed.  ‚ÄúFor heaven‚Äôs sake Bruce.‚Äù Talia mocked picking up the coat she had intended to grab from the beginning from the chair having recognized it as yours. She grimaced as felt the damp fabric and dropped it in a corner of the room on the floor. The look she was receiving could burn her skin and when she turned her face back to his she realized how disturbed he was. ‚ÄúYou look horrible. Strange really got into your head didn‚Äôt he?‚Äù  Talia saw him narrow his eyes with impatient indignation as he snorted. She found seeing him like this very peculiar and thought it would be fun to try and provoke.  The woman brought her face close to his making her warm breath touch his chin provocatively while boldly wrapping her arms around the broad neck. She tested the waters seeing how he remained still and brushed her red lips along his jawline then moved up until their mouths shared the same breath.  She was going to try to persuade convince him that he was overthinking and smiled inwardly when she saw Bruce become disconcerted for a second completely unresponsive when she sealed their lips together. She managed to seduce him in that second to the point where unconsciously he moved his tongue with hers but tasting her saliva brought him back to rationality.  He left her in complete shock when abruptly pushed her away and grabbed her face in an aggressive manner squeezing the cheeks and making her squirm until eyes glazed over into his. ‚ÄúYou repulse me.‚Äù Bruce spat and was glad to see her bold expression disappear. ‚ÄúTell me once: she is mine?‚Äú  Talia tried to take his hand away with hers but he seemed implacable and didn‚Äôt even move a finger out of place. He might be stronger but she wasn‚Äôt weak and that was what made her let out an astonished sob.  "She is my daughter?!‚Äù He shouted shaking her no longer able to take the lack of response.  ‚ÄúYes it is true.‚Äù The confession made him let go of her finally and she almost stumbled back with how sudden it was.  She massaged her face seeking relief and it didn‚Äôt take long for her eyebrows to furrow in shock. Bruce felt no pity or regret she deserved much more than he would ever have the courage to do.  ‚ÄúHow?‚Äù By the way he looked she knew there was no more room for lies or evasion. She had never seen him like this; Bruce had always been the most balanced man she had ever known in her entire life.  ‚ÄúShe and Damian are twins‚Äù Talia responded immediately.  ‚ÄúTwins?‚Äù Bruce‚Äôs voice sounded incredulous. He felt that even all the time in the universe wouldn‚Äôt be enough to process that. It seemed simply unreal. ‚ÄúWhy did you hide this? Why did you tell me about Damian and not about her?‚Äù  ‚ÄúBecause you would have taken her from me!‚Äù She shouted running her fingers over her face to check if her makeup had smeared. ‚ÄúI handed Damian over to you willingly but if you had found out about him before you would have brought him here just the same. And with her it would be no different. You should be grateful to have had the boy.‚Äù  ‚ÄúHow dare you say such a thing?‚Äù Bruce threw the chair to the floor in a fit of rage making a loud noise that echoed even outside the hallway. ‚ÄúAnd ‚Äòhanded Damian over willingly‚Äô? You only did that because you felt pressured after your father died.‚Äù He threw it in her face and suddenly remembered something: ‚ÄúYou made that boy lie for you.‚Äù He accused her.  Talia was silent for a brief moment but her face showed nothing but contempt. ‚ÄúI did yes.‚Äù She admitted.  ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs the point of that? Was it just out of whim?‚Äù Bruce seemed fragile before her for the first time in so many years. For a moment she glimpsed an old argument from when they were still dating and didn‚Äôt hide feelings from each other as they do today. ‚ÄúDo you hold that much resentment? You know very well why I dismissed the League of Assassins.‚Äù  ‚ÄúOf course Bruce. Your morals are too valuable aren‚Äôt they?‚Äù Talia replied with her chin up not letting him affect her. ‚ÄúYou think you‚Äôre a good guy a pure superhero like Superman. But I know you and I know how rotten you are inside. You are not as different from us as you think.‚Äù She spewed the words in his face like venom.  ‚ÄúYou wanted her to come here didn‚Äôt you? You and he planned all this?‚Äù Comprehension seemed to have hit Bruce but that only left the woman confused.  ‚ÄúIf it were up to me you would never have discovered her existence. Why would I send her here?‚Äù The confession left him silent not because he wasn‚Äôt angry anymore but because he was tired of hearing her voice; he simply couldn‚Äôt believe anything Talia said. ‚ÄúShe is my daughter. And I don‚Äôt care what you‚Äôre going to do now but don‚Äôt think you‚Äôre going to drag her with you like you did with all those boys.‚Äù  "You think you can offer something better? You the same person who left her in the hands of that sicko consider yourself a better option?‚Äù Bruce insinuated this with a firmness that made it clear he had no doubt Talia was cooperating with Strange making her eyes turn red. She could hear many insults from him but insinuating that she had put you at risk was something entirely different. ‚ÄúYou can be sure you won‚Äôt lay another finger on her.‚Äù  She knew Bruce was serious and that he could actually prevent any future contact betwedn you and her. She wanted to kill him right now out of sheer hatred but she was smart and knew that acting impulsively wouldn‚Äôt solve anything. So reluctantly she tried to change the tone of the discussion to a neutral one. There was no way she could leave without giving him explanations and if she tried he would stop her.  ‚ÄúMaybe Strange had been threatening me for some time possibly before deciding to appear publicly again and attack you.‚Äù There was a slight irony of indignation in her words. Her gaze was firm and her green eyes shining with the intensity of someone defending their own honor. ‚ÄúLet it be clear: I didn‚Äôt help anyone; I was as much a victim of this as you were.‚Äù  ‚ÄúVictim?‚Äù Bruce retorted with disdain.  ‚ÄúThis threat wasn‚Äôt for you Bruce it was for me. Today you didn‚Äôt lose anything quite the opposite.‚Äù She ignored the acidic tone and continued. ‚ÄúMaybe this contributed to some kind of psychological game Strange is playing against you but it must be just a bonus.‚Äù  ‚ÄúWhy is he threatening you?‚Äù The question contained no compassion or empathy but it didn‚Äôt matter to her to receive that kind of consideration from him.  ‚ÄúWhat did he do to you?‚Äù Talia ignored the question and as a form of childish revenge he did the same. She sighed and tried a different approach: ‚ÄúIf you tell me I‚Äôll tell you too.‚Äù She needed to know to try to understand the depth of Strange‚Äôs current intentions or at least get some clue about the plan he was plotting because although she wouldn‚Äôt say it to Bruce she was also trying to catch him.  ‚ÄúA photo of my parents‚Äù he confessed trying to sound indifferent before continuing ‚ÄúPhotos of the boys of Alfred‚Ä¶‚Äù Bruce left the sentence hanging in the air and didn‚Äôt proceed. He would never say more than he deemed necessary to her.  ‚ÄúDamian too?‚Äù She asked worried about her son and saw Bruce nod affirmatively. Bruce calmly unwrinkled a card while handing it to her.  ‚ÄúHe asked her to deliver this to me today.‚Äù His tone was serious revealing a determination to deal with the situation pragmatically and directly.  Talia repeated those printed words several times and every hair on her body stood on end all at once. ‚ÄúDid she‚Ä¶?‚Äù  ‚ÄúShe didn‚Äôt read it.‚Äù He said curtly. ‚ÄúBut what I don‚Äôt understand is how all this seems so convenient and you claim to have nothing to do with it. He had this card perfectly prepared.‚Äù  ‚ÄúKnowing him well he must have been waiting for an opportunity for many days or he induced this to happen somehow.‚Äù She reflected scratching the fine texture with her nails right where the text was printed to the point of making it illegible. ‚ÄúThe letter that Damian said she picked up took longer to arrive than the others; it must have ended up with him at some point.‚Äù  ‚ÄúHow could he be so close and you didn‚Äôt notice?‚Äù His voice became aggressive again the same beastly rage returning.  ‚ÄúI did notice! I just didn‚Äôt imagine Strange interested in her; I thought it was about Damian. So I didn‚Äôt worry because he wasn‚Äôt with me; he was with you.‚Äù She raised her voice trying to match his volume. ‚ÄúStrange has been sending me coded messages. Threats that had nothing to do with my daughter. I thought he didn‚Äôt know she was yours and therefore wouldn‚Äôt care about her.‚Äù She finished and Bruce clenched his jaw observing how she increasingly emphasized the expression ‚Äúmy daughter‚Äù excluding him.  ‚ÄúThreats related to Damian?‚Äù He asked. His muscles were tense and sore but he endured the discomfort if it meant clarifying everything once and for all. ‚ÄúAnd of course you never considered telling me.‚Äù  ‚ÄúThis started long before I left him with you Bruce. They were still children.‚Äù Talia said growing increasingly frustrated with the conversation.  ‚ÄúWhat could Damian have done to him as a child?‚Äù  ‚ÄúDamian ended up leaving Strange with one less eye. He was already pursuing him because of you but after losing an eye all he wanted was revenge.‚Äù She walked to the bed leaning on the arms while crossing her legs. A very characteristic gesture of her behavior which was highlighted when she wore her extravagant dresses but the cold pants she wore made the movements relaxed. ‚ÄúHe was a child; he didn‚Äôt do it on purpose. He was just protecting his sister.‚Äù  ‚ÄúHow could Strange have known about Damian for so long and not about her? What you‚Äôre saying doesn‚Äôt make any sense Talia.‚Äù Bruce was frantic and after a brief moment of melancholy she sighed:   ‚ÄúI blame my father for this.‚Äù Her voice almost wavered in front of him but being the proud person she was she quickly composed herself.  ‚ÄúWhat did Ra‚Äôs do?‚Äù He threw the question into the air laden with apprehension.  The room plunged into a disturbing silence. Talia remained motionless while the sound of Bruce‚Äôs heavy breathing was the only thing breaking the void in the atmosphere. For a brief moment her eyes met his and captured the storm of emotions brewing there: betrayal despair expectation.  She did not fear him but rather how he might react to this. You were there nearby in the hallway and the last thing she wanted was for the primal figure Bruce was becoming to explode and expel her taking you to him. Moreover she needed to remind herself that she was at a disadvantage there. It wasn‚Äôt just Bruce she would face if things turned worse or physical but everyone else in the house.  ‚ÄúWhat did he do Talia?‚Äù Bruce growled repeating the question with intensity.  She stared at the floor fully aware that her next words would turn against her later but at this point he needed to know. Strange was out there and he was still as much of a psychopath obsessed with Batman as before meaning he wouldn‚Äôt rest until he managed to take Bruce‚Äôs place as a vigilante. So with a low but icy voice she moved her mouth to tell him the truth:  ‚ÄúYears ago Strange sought out the League of Assassins. That lunatic was always smart and somehow discovered the rift between you and my father.‚Äù The mention of such an old event took Bruce by surprise. He slightly recoiled and his eyebrows raised but he restrained himself from interrupting her. ‚ÄúHe wanted the League to help him defeat you and vice versa. My father was suspicious but he was so resentful that he agreed. Your betrayal was still fresh to us.‚Äù  ‚ÄúAnd of course it went wrong didn‚Äôt it?‚Äù He asked with implicit sarcasm.  ‚ÄúStrange was so cunning that he managed to manipulate him to his advantage. He provided us with precise and important information about you but after a while he wanted to advise my father on how to act. That‚Äôs when I started to hate him realizing how he was controlling.‚Äù She shook her head in denial recalling the memory with bitterness and continued:  ‚ÄúMy father trusted him so much that he allowed Strange to infiltrate us more and more until one day by chance he found damian in Nanda Parbat. Strange was nosy and curious; he tried to extract the information from me but discovered on his own that you were his father.‚Äù Talia blew a strand of hair that fell on her face and decided to add the next part with acidity: ‚ÄúStrange was so fascinated by this that he made an absurd request. We denied it and then he rebelled against us. Of course that incompetent couldn‚Äôt accomplish anything and then disappeared as he always does when things go wrong.‚Äù  ‚ÄúRa‚Äôs and Strange working together?‚Äù Bruce asked himself. He could never have imagined that two such distinct people could have had a relationship like that in the past. ‚ÄúAnd what did he ask for?‚Äù  ‚ÄúHe was obsessed with surpassing you but it wasn‚Äôt just that he wanted to be you and have everything that was yours. He asked to raise Damian as if he were his own son can you believe it? Luckily Y/n never set foot in Nanda Parbat so he didn‚Äôt discover her in that time.‚Äù She paused for a moment reliving the events. ‚ÄúHe wanted to prove that he could raise him and make a better Robin. Strange has known your identities much longer than you think; he knew the real Robin was your adopted son.‚Äù  Bruce‚Äôs face contorted in an expression of disbelief. His eyes narrowed slightly and his mouth opened as if about to say something but the words seemed stuck in his throat. He blinked a few times needing to assimilate what he had heard. ‚ÄúIf he never saw her before how did all this happen?‚Äù  ‚ÄúA few years later when my father hadn‚Äôt been dead for long I returned to live in Gotham City with Y/n and Strange found out Damian was here too and broke into the apartment where we were. He intended to kidnap Damian but he used to share a room with his sister and by mistake Strange went to her bed.‚Äù She spoke with a heavy voice the last sentence sending chills down her spine but she persisted:  ‚ÄúI woke up to her frightened scream and a loud noise. I ran and when I saw it was him I had no mercy. He is intelligent but sometimes he is blinded by his own obsession and do stupid things. He was already bleeding with a pencil piercing one of his eyes thanks to Damian then fled through the living room. I didn‚Äôt initially chase after him because I wanted to make sure Damian was okay; the problem was I hadn‚Äôt realized that Y/n wasn‚Äôt in the room. Damian had distracted Strange to let his sister escape and because of my delay he took her.‚Äù  Talia seemed to be in a trance. Each word weighed on her chest like lead yet she threw them out as if they were disposable. Her usually confident and determined eyes didn‚Äôt know where to look. Sitting rigidly on the bed her imposing posture didn‚Äôt waver as her pride didn‚Äôt allow her to show weakness.  ‚ÄúWhat did he do?‚Äù Bruce throat tightened as if the air was rarefied as he waited for the answer. Talia might think otherwise but he could see through her facade. And despite it being selfish to say this he couldn‚Äôt feel a shred of concern for her especially when someone more important to him was now involved.  After standing for so long Bruce sat on the bed next to her. He reflected on the sad incident deeply disturbed. He blamed her. He blamed her for her character for lying so much and for hiding from him that his children were in danger. He was grateful that she had fallen silent for a few seconds as he was mentally preparing himself for a grim scenario one he wasn‚Äôt yet ready to face.  ‚ÄúWhat happened to her?‚Äù He asked seeing that she wasn‚Äôt showing signs of speaking trying to prompt her to continue.  ‚ÄúStrange carried her through the city desperately fleeing from me until he ended up in an alley. He encountered a group of drunks who surrounded and wanted to rob him. He‚Äôs not a good fighter you already know that and like a damn coward he threw her into their midst as a distraction while he escaped again.‚Äù   ‚ÄúUnbelievable‚Ä¶‚Äù Bruce massaged his eyebrows with his eyes closed visibly upset. He pressed his temples hard as if trying to dispel the accumulated frustration. After a deep breath he suddenly exploded in a shout of frustration and anger just like at the beginning. ‚ÄúYou should have contacted me!‚Äù  ‚ÄúAre you trying to blame me?!‚Äù She asked indignantly.  ‚ÄúShe didn‚Äôt seem to recognize him when she spoke to me just now. It sounded like she was talking about a random stranger.‚Äù Bruce was confused.  ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know if she would recognize him again she never wanted to talk to me about that day. And I never mentioned Hugo Strange either everything she knows about him she sees on the news.‚Äù  ‚ÄúYou and your father are the worst kind of people I could have gotten involved with‚Äù Bruce said his voice dangerously low this time. ‚ÄúIf it weren‚Äôt for Ra‚Äôs Strange would never have gotten close to them. If it weren‚Äôt for your stupid lie nothing you just said would have happened. And I don‚Äôt even want to imagine what the hell happened after that!‚Äù  ‚ÄúYou would have made sure nothing like that happened wouldn‚Äôt you Bruce? You talk about it with such certainty but weren‚Äôt you the one who let the Joker do something similar to that kid‚Ä¶ Is Jason his name?‚Äù Her mention of something like that made Bruce‚Äôs ears go deaf. He could clearly hear the sound of his heart beating inside his chest until her disgusting voice sounded again: ‚ÄúYou would have put her in the same disgrace!‚Äù  Bruce lost the control he tried so hard to maintain from the beginning. He threw the lamp next to him into the headboard on the wall. The movement was so violent that the wire connecting the object to the socket broke in a strange way and the entire glass part broke into several pieces. The noise was thunderous and even when he stood up with a piercing look at her Talia continued with her laughing face enjoying watching him go crazy.  ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt try to compare the two things. You didn‚Äôt tell me about Strange before because you were embarrassed. It‚Äôs too hard for you to admit that you can fail. Besides you always liked having someone to control to manipulate at your pleasure. You did this to her didn‚Äôt you? And even then you‚Äôre not satisfied. You continued to torment Damian using him.‚Äù Bruce took a deep breath.‚ÄúI thought you cared about him.‚Äù  Talia got up too and lifted her chin her eyes shining with defiance. ‚ÄúYou understand nothing Bruce‚Äù she responded with a firm and cutting voice. ‚ÄúEverything I did was to protect them both. I explained my reasons to you. Do you think hiding them was just my decision? My father would never have allowed it and I won‚Äôt deny that I wasn‚Äôt against him but it didn‚Äôt depend solely on me. You with your inflexible morality and your rules would never understand.‚Äù  ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt give me that‚Äù Bruce growled his gaze fixed and penetrating. ‚ÄúYou branded the girl with your initials like she was cattle. It was never about protection; it‚Äôs possessiveness.‚Äù  Like him Talia stood up. ‚ÄúI may be a woman of whims as you like to say but I didn‚Äôt hide anything because I was embarrassed‚Äù  Talia paused her voice softening but not positively. ‚ÄúAnd as for tormenting him‚Ä¶ I trained him prepared him for the cruel world we live in. Do you think you could keep him safe with your mild methods? He needs to be strong needs to be able to survive and in those years I taught him to protect her because no one else would. My father didn‚Äôt care about a granddaughter; he finally had the male heir he wanted. I had to meet his demands to make Damian perfect and that allowed me the freedom to raise her away from all that. What I could do I did. And what I wanted to do I also did. And I‚Äôd do it all again.‚Äù  ‚ÄúYou always think you did everything right but everything you‚Äôve said only proves how misguided you are. I remember I gave you a choice Talia. I told you that you could abandon the League of Assassins and come with me. I told you that your father didn‚Äôt need to control your life forever‚Äù Bruce said his voice laden with disdain. ‚ÄúYou will never come near her again. You‚Äôll have to go over my dead body first.‚Äù  Talia narrowed her eyes in contempt. ‚ÄúDo you really think you can stop me?‚Äù Her voice was low and controlled but each word carried significant weight. ‚ÄúYou always saw the world in black and white. Do you really think it was so simple to abandon my entire life and devotion for you a mere fleeting romance? If you think it‚Äôs that easy to give up everything I challenge you to abandon Batman right now. After all it‚Äôs because of this secret identity of yours that all this started isn‚Äôt it? Isn‚Äôt it as easy as that Bruce?‚Äù  She took a step forward facing him without wavering. ‚ÄúI can repeat it as many times as you want: I am a criminal I am selfish and whatever else you want me to say but the only hypocrite in this room is you.‚Äù Her eyes shone with determination while his wavered before her.  Bruce hardened his expression sadness hitting him. He wanted to accuse her of being a low person but deep in his conscience he feared it was true. But he wouldn‚Äôt allow himself to be deceived; she was still the wrong one here. She was the one who completely distorted the situation making herself the victim and trying to justify everything she did turning him into the villain of the story.  ‚ÄúTalia I never wanted you to be any of these things‚Äù he began his voice laden with anguish. He felt bitterness looking at her face now as it painfully reminded him of the time when he had been deeply in love with this same woman. ‚ÄúI wanted to believe you could change that you would be different from your father. But every choice you made every lie you told‚Ä¶ Our relationship was unsustainable and now the only thing I feel for you is remorse.‚Äù  He closed the last distance between them imposing himself with a somber aura. ‚ÄúYour actions your alliances‚Ä¶ they put her at risk. My duty as a father is to protect her and I can‚Äôt ignore the danger you represent. I never wanted it to come to this Talia. But if keeping her safe means keeping her away from you then that‚Äôs what I‚Äôll do.‚Äù  Talia clenched her fists her expression hardening even more. ‚ÄúDo you think I didn‚Äôt want to protect her too?‚Äù Her voice became silky. There was a dark delight in how the words dragged a subtle poison hidden in each intonation. ‚ÄúYou talk about protecting her but she needs more than simple physical protection. She needs a mother someone who understands the complexity of her feelings.‚Äù  ‚ÄúLook at yourself for a moment Bruce‚Äù said Talia her voice icy and full of disdain. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre losing your composure. Do you really think she‚Äôll like finding out that her father is this weak and ridiculous man you‚Äôve become?‚Äù  The woman took a step forward fixing her eyes on his with a challenging gleam. ‚ÄúThe only thing she‚Äôll feel for you is shame.‚Äù  ‚ÄúDo you really think you can tell me who I‚Äôve become?‚Äù He paused swallowing hard. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt want it to come to this Talia but if you don‚Äôt leave voluntarily I‚Äôll be forced to tell that girl everything you‚Äôve done. And then we‚Äôll let her decide.‚Äù  He intensified the confrontation provoking her: ‚ÄúAre you sure she would still choose you after so many lies? After everything you‚Äôve hidden from her?‚Äù His eyes darkened pupils dilated by the dim light in the room. ‚ÄúValue the good image she still has of you.‚Äù  Talia was momentarily silent her eyes meeting Bruce‚Äôs with a genuine expression of concern. She took a deep breath before speaking her voice a bit more dangerous than before. ‚ÄúWould you really do that? Tell her everything?‚Äù  Bruce replied firmly maintaining his serious gaze on hers. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs what I must do regardless of everything. Continuing to hide things isn‚Äôt right. But if the only way for you to leave more easily is under this condition then go now.‚Äù  Talia took a few steps back her serious expression showing shock and worry. Her thoughts repeated Bruce‚Äôs ultimatum continuously knowing you would not react well to it.   You were a smart girl but emotionally very fragile. Your bonds of trust were limited to her and your brother and you two had been apart for so long that having your relationship with your mother destroyed in this way would leave a huge scar on your heart. This would be the best choice both for her and for you if Talia didn‚Äôt want everything to fall apart.  She turned towards the bedroom hallway as if seeking a moment to ponder the consequences. After a moment she turned her gaze back to Bruce her shoulders slightly lower. ‚ÄúYou are not going to involve her in your vigilante life.‚Äù It wasn‚Äôt a request it was a warning and Bruce didn‚Äôt contest it to avoid further conflict. Understanding that she had decided to leave was enough to reassure him.  ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt mean to.‚Äù He walked past her picking up your coat she had thrown on the floor earlier checking carefully that it hadn‚Äôt been damaged by the broken lampshade and lifting the chair to let the piece dry once more.  ‚ÄúYou know where the exit is; don‚Äôt take too long.‚Äù Without bothering to be polite he quickly opened the door leaving her standing there. He knew she would really leave after seeing how she reacted. She wouldn‚Äôt risk irritating him by taking longer than necessary.     Tag list:  @lafrone@sylum@mileskisser@belowbreadcrumbs@riddle-me-im-sirius @rafa-the-beautiful@shehrazadekey@fairuzwhat@bedeater@arianapjs @idonthaveanameforthisacc@azulawayne@nciolisa@lovelywritersgarden @spideybv28@faimmm@cherry-peach-flavored @godknows-shetried@randomrosie01@whatsupstark@paastaboi@m3ntally-unstable @masterradd-28@justanormalpersin@6000-fandoms@fennecspage @homan-oid@fluffy-strawberries@animegirlfromvietnam@tamsyien@ari-sama21 @kataraluvr@boatempollstriper@lokisgoodboy@enjisthings@thereeallink @lumalesa-kadichizho@fyodorssimp1@shintax-error@lara20aral@sulatsadark @notahappystan@nebuluma@thetiredtoad0-0@tmt-alexis@anuttellaa @strawberrymangoes@lorastone-000@starryhiraeth@worldussysblog @urminebutidontwantyou@herondale-lightworm@nyra-42@ohnoivefallen @an-introverted-nishinoyasimp@ellie-x0xo@blkmystery @formula-space @sparks0918@cosmicqueenieb@rukia-uchiha-98@leeleecats@camilo-uwu@phoenixgurl030@rosegardenpatsu@nickey-diano

I love Batman but some of the times I find it hard to get into the series because of the way some of his kids are incredibly similar. It‚Äôs a blessing and a curse. And by similar I don‚Äôt mean personality wise I mean their ways of thinking. For example in Robins the comic when they discuss being Robin a lot of them have a very similar opinion and idea with only Jason and Damian having a more drastic difference from the rest.  It doesn‚Äôt make the comic boring but it definitely makes it hard to get into when there‚Äôs not enough diversity to connect with the characters. I think all the Robins are fun but it‚Äôs definitely odd to me how they all think the same about the Robin mantel.   I don‚Äôt know if I explained this well but to summarize I want different thought processes on the Robin mantel rather than the same thing thought behind it. But it does make sense given how some of them were young when they became Robin. But I‚Äôll also argue that a lot of adults would still stick by the decisions younger them made as a lot of people are simply stubborn. But this would go into more of a self-centered rant so I won‚Äôt get into it.

The mid 2000‚Äôs saw an uptick in fascinating Batman media that all earn their place among the best incarnations of the character. Christopher Nolan‚Äôs groundbreaking Dark Knight trilogy redefined blockbuster cinema as we know it while Batman took the video game world by storm with the beginning of both the Arkham series as well as Lego DC. In the course of a decade Batman had not one but two wonderful animated series - The Batman and Brave and the Bold the ladder being a course on DC history. And of course Grant Morrison started his remarkable run on Batman comics starting in Batman and working his way through titles such as Batman & Robin and his epic Batman Inc. it truly was a great time to be a bat-fan!
Thank you to @reine-du-sourire for the amazing design of the outfit! It‚Äôs Edward as the White Queen Gotham City as the chessboard :D

post_body: Honestly every time I see this I am very surprised by the size difference.  And especially because my conclusion is how incredibly strong Joker is! Bruce talks about how fast he is but rarely is it talked about how much it takes to stand up to one of the most trained people on the planet.  We can put his size/strength into perspective by thinking that he can carry a giant solid wooden mallet by himself.  Have you ever seen a person irl doing log lifting carry a piece of wood the size of someone as big as Superman with this ease??  He can even drag Jason and Tim‚Äôs dead weight WITH A SINGLE ARM.  It‚Äôs obvious that he can also carry Batman he has to put him in traps or tie him up alone. But we actually see him do it and it seems like he has no trouble??? The guy who needs to be carried by two people??? As if he were carrying a kitten???      You‚Äôre right Bruce this clown is scary üò≠

post_body: i‚Äôm pretty sure there are similar hc to this but the headcanon i have about mr alfred pennyworth -one that you can pry from my dead cold hands- is that he‚Äôs some kind of eldritch creature that took interest in humanity a few centuries ago and decided to become part of human society.   he was intrigued and fascinated by them so he chose to live among them as one of them. he doesn‚Äôt wish to alter anything majorly; yeah he‚Äôs been part of wars and whatnot but he mainly enjoys watching and observing how humanity grows all on their own.  alfred pennyworth was not his first name but it‚Äôs the one he‚Äôs come to cherish the most because of the memories that come attached.  the batclan know yet not know. they CHOOSE not to know. cause alfred is alfred.  there have been huge uncanny valley-esque moments but it‚Äôs wtv cause alfred. is. alfred.  like when the lights always flicker when alfred is immensely displeased with someone. or how alfred always seems to understand the message no matter how vague or even non-verbal you are about it. or how alfred always seems fine no matter how many years have passed. or how strong and able bodied he seems to be. or how he‚Äôs always there just when you need assistance. or how he knows where everyone is at any time. or how you would think he‚Äôd be a bit forgetful in his old age but the man remembers every tiny detail from things like mentioning you liked art to things like what color were the socks he laid out for one of his charges. or how even the gotham rogues know to steer clear of that butler because last time one of them tried well they haven‚Äôt spoken on the subject but arkham staff say that they have been quiet ever since only occasionally scream for no apparent reason when left alone for too long.  alfred is alfred any bat would say. and that‚Äôs what it is really. alfred is alfred.     extra: when you go to the museum you can see small little depictions of him in old paintings and even writings about a creature who took to mankind and made it its mission to nurture and care those who were down on their luck and help them achieve a higher purpose. alfred was there for many others before the batclan but he will admit that the batclan is so far who he has become fondest of.

secondary_tags: ['cassandra cain'  'batgirl 2000'  'batgirl'  'bruce wayne'  'the father daughter duo of all time'  "she's his favourite but that's not necessarily a good thing"]
post_body: Bruce Wayne & Cassandra Cain in Batgirl (2000) My last post covered the top 10 moments overall but I had to skip a lot of my favourite moments involving specifically Batman and Batgirl. So here‚Äôs a non-comprehensive chronological list of great Bruce & Cass moments!!  Who Does She Remind You Of? One of the most interesting things about their relationship is that initially Cass doesn‚Äôt have a name and doesn‚Äôt know Bruce‚Äôs name; they are purely Batgirl and Batman. This lack of alter ego allows Bruce to identify very heavily with Cass and sets up the foundation for why Bruce acts the way he does later. He views Cass as a mirror of himself which has both positive and negative repercussions.   You Can‚Äôt Understand A Word I‚Äôm Saying EXTREMELY underrated Bruce and Cass moment from Issue #2. Though I believe they fundamentally understand each other there‚Äôs still a disconnect between them (a disconnect Cass shares with everyone). But this disconnect goes both ways - Bruce is the one having trouble communicating here saying ‚ÄòI don‚Äôt know how to say this‚Äô and pausing frequently (this speech pattern is very reminiscent of Cass‚Äô inner monologue towards the end of this run!). A great example of how neither of them are fully able to express the depth of their feelings towards each other.   Denial A pivotal moment in Bruce‚Äôs conception of Cass. When confronted with evidence that she killed a man Bruce goes into complete denial. She‚Äôs 'gentle‚Äô fully understanding his rejection of murder; how can she be a murderer? It‚Äôs indicative of just how much he‚Äôs projecting onto Cass but also how much he genuinely cares about her. The second panel is underrated too - like David Cain Bruce sees Cass as 'perfect‚Äô a word that will haunt Cass for arcs to come. This is where we start to see how Bruce‚Äôs belief in Cass‚Äô perfection and morals negatively impacts her self-conception (as a perfect tool/weapon).   Good Answer An incredible moment that‚Äôs classic for a reason. Perfectly encapsulates both Cass‚Äô instinctive desire to protect and Bruce‚Äôs recognition of how similar Cass is to him. Also how his belief in her however unintentionally feeds into her death wish.  Jason Todd Another underrated moment!!! This is the first major instance of conflict between death-wish Cass and no-more-dead-kids Bruce and it‚Äôs delicious. Bruce willingly opens up to her about Jason‚Äôs death and moreover by comparing Cass to Jason positions her as his child as well. It‚Äôs sweet and sad and explains some of Bruce‚Äôs more overprotective moments.  Denial 2 Not really denial but thematically it fits. When Bruce is framed for murder the Batfam try to figure out what really happened. Cass sees that Dick has doubts and helps him re-enact the murder so that he can believe in Bruce again. Not only is it a super sweet Dick-Cass moment but it also shows how Cass believes in Bruce just as much as Bruce believes in Cass.   Good A short and sweet moment that showcases how similar these two are. Bruce isn‚Äôt exactly being a good dad here but Cass genuinely DIDN‚ÄôT enjoy that vacation. They just get each other. This is one of many many times that Cass answers one of Bruce‚Äôs questions perfectly (and makes Bruce smile).   Overprotective Dad Mode In the second part of Batgirl (2000) Cass begins to explore her sexuality. This leads to issues of varying quality BUT we do get tons of overprotective Bruce. A nice showcase of Bruce doing typical dad stuff and Superman looking SO done. Also Cass in that first panel is hilarious.   Realisation After lots of (rightful) heckling from Babs Bruce finally realises that the way he‚Äôs been using and treating Cass isn‚Äôt right. Though this speech is couched in a lot of dismissive language ('disobedient‚Äô 'she was loyal‚Äô) I think that‚Äôs just Bruce‚Äôs inability to communicate. He cannot admit how much he cares for her. So he decides to fire her and tells her she jeopardises the MISSION (which obviously makes Cass feel terrible). Even when he‚Äôs trying to put her first his lack of communication skills only hurts her.  He Never Let Me Touch Him The Bruce and Cass scene to END all Bruce and Cass scenes. Each panel is loaded with meaning. The first shows that despite Bruce‚Äôs similarities to Cain he still IS different; he is willing to be vulnerable around her and allows her to do the same around him. The third panel is particularly interesting. Underneath all the ideological sniping between him and Babs Bruce is jealous - he wants to be the centre of Cass‚Äô life and loyalty. Cass however doesn‚Äôt fall into the trap. By pointing to the Bat she both affirms her loyalty to his mission but also refuses any box he can put her in. She is his daughter but she is not only his daughter and never will be.  Honourable mention: the only reason I didn‚Äôt put the Father‚Äôs Day panel here was because I‚Äôve already written about it. Also the scene where they mutually touch each other‚Äôs faces and turn away of course!

The mid 2000‚Äôs saw an uptick in fascinating Batman media that all earn their place among the best incarnations of the character. Christopher Nolan‚Äôs groundbreaking Dark Knight trilogy redefined blockbuster cinema as we know it while Batman took the video game world by storm with the beginning of both the Arkham series as well as Lego DC. In the course of a decade Batman had not one but two wonderful animated series - The Batman and Brave and the Bold the ladder being a course on DC history. And of course Grant Morrison started his remarkable run on Batman comics starting in Batman and working his way through titles such as Batman & Robin and his epic Batman Inc. it truly was a great time to be a bat-fan!

post_body: Quick My Little Pony Bruce as I continue toiling over Pokemon Steph.  He‚Äôs based off a shire (my favorite breed) and has the cropped tail to make him look youthful as Bruce (suggesting his is vane and because foals have those little baby tails) but to be practical as Batman (some working horses have their tails tied short or cut short).  His cutie mark is a spife‚Äî A silver spoon to denote privilege. A dual purpose utensil (because of his double life) that is tacky at first look but is still a KNIFE. It‚Äôs supposed to look a bit like a cheese knife so it‚Äôs viewed by the public as a tacky mark that is also undeniably upper class.
No but like once he‚Äôs back to using Bruce‚Äôs money he‚Äôs exactly the type to buy new clothes instead of washing them

post_body: i‚Äôm pretty sure there are similar hc to this but the headcanon i have about mr alfred pennyworth -one that you can pry from my dead cold hands- is that he‚Äôs some kind of eldritch creature that took interest in humanity a few centuries ago and decided to become part of human society.   he was intrigued and fascinated by them so he chose to live among them as one of them. he doesn‚Äôt wish to alter anything majorly; yeah he‚Äôs been part of wars and whatnot but he mainly enjoys watching and observing how humanity grows all on their own.  alfred pennyworth was not his first name but it‚Äôs the one he‚Äôs come to cherish the most because of the memories that come attached.  the batclan know yet not know. they CHOOSE not to know. cause alfred is alfred.  there have been huge uncanny valley-esque moments but it‚Äôs wtv cause alfred. is. alfred.  like when the lights always flicker when alfred is immensely displeased with someone. or how alfred always seems to understand the message no matter how vague or even non-verbal you are about it. or how alfred always seems fine no matter how many years have passed. or how strong and able bodied he seems to be. or how he‚Äôs always there just when you need assistance. or how he knows where everyone is at any time. or how you would think he‚Äôd be a bit forgetful in his old age but the man remembers every tiny detail from things like mentioning you liked art to things like what color were the socks he laid out for one of his charges. or how even the gotham rogues know to steer clear of that butler because last time one of them tried well they haven‚Äôt spoken on the subject but arkham staff say that they have been quiet ever since only occasionally scream for no apparent reason when left alone for too long.  alfred is alfred any bat would say. and that‚Äôs what it is really. alfred is alfred.     extra: when you go to the museum you can see small little depictions of him in old paintings and even writings about a creature who took to mankind and made it its mission to nurture and care those who were down on their luck and help them achieve a higher purpose. alfred was there for many others before the batclan but he will admit that the batclan is so far who he has become fondest of.

Been thinking a lot about The Batman and hearing how disappointed people are with Two-Face‚Äôs direction in Batman: Caped Crusader. Which gave me two specific ideas that I don‚Äôt think have been explored yet with Two-Face.  Let it be known that I have surface level two-face knowledge but just thinking about the world of The Batman and how Harvey can be incorporated into it:  1) his left side of the face‚Ä¶ is a birth defect. Cleft lip a blemish something in-universe to explain its scarred look. I think this would not only fit a modern day outlook (I know it‚Äôs mostly Harvey thinking he can no longer be an attorney thanks to the deformity but yknow) but give an external force to Harvey‚Äôs complex thoughts. The scarring isn‚Äôt the catalyst this time  2) in order to find a middle between ‚Äúgood lawyer who had one bad day/bad childhood‚Äù and ‚Äúcorrupt politician‚Äù - how about he‚Äôs an Aaron Burr. Too centrist for city council and the public too goody-two-shoes for the rogues. He secretly uses a coin flip as the final say cause he‚Äôs so indecisive. The public gave him the nickname Two-Face

post_body: Heatstroke ain‚Äôt the only stroke he getting bru

I feel like one of my many issues with ‚ÄúAngry Dick‚Äù is it feel out of character to how he was originally portrayed   Take this scene right after Jason‚Äôs death he comes in screaming and yelling at Bruce.  Meanwhile when it originally happened he was calm til Bruce started hinting that he low-key blamed Dick in part for Jason‚Äôs death.     It feels like many comics especially during the Dixon run make him far more angrier then he was portrayed in the past. During NTT which is what Dixon is taking from he was usually the calm level headed one who thought things through and processed them.  I‚Äôm not saying Dick can‚Äôt get angry because he does but I feel like starting with Dixon they made him get angrier much faster than he would before.  It feels like a bad recon to me but I admit that could be personal taste and that‚Äôs just my 2 cents.

post_body: Batman: Bloodstorm & Queerness READ: this has been posted on twitter aswell so if you find that it‚Äôs me lol! This will be an even longer version of that with more description as I don‚Äôt have the pesky world limit here! I wanted to start this out by saying I may get some things wrong and this was something I‚Äôd originally had posted on a Mastodon Server my friends are running so I wasn‚Äôt checking it over very much just wanted to get my thoughts out! There are probably a lot of different ways this comic can be read but I‚Äôm particularly enamored by queer readings of comics so that‚Äôs what I‚Äôll be focusing on today. This won‚Äôt be exhaustive on the queer metaphors in this comic and I‚Äôd be happy for people to add on to what I say! I‚Äôm not an expert on making analysis posts so forgive me if anything is unclear or out of place. I‚Äôm also getting used to Tumblr formatting but fans here tend to be more active so I really wanted to share here! With that let‚Äôs get into it  <!-- more --> Brief Summary Before getting into my reading I thought it best to give a (semi-) brief Summary of the comic itself. There‚Äôs also someone context from the previous comic (as this is part of a trilogy!) that I‚Äôll try to provide too but a lot of the material I‚Äôll talk about isn‚Äôt really dependent on the fact you have the experience of reading Red Rain.   In ‚ÄúBatman: Bloodstorm‚Äù Bruce has been turned into a vampire (the previous comic delves into how this happened but just know he‚Äôs sort of shed the identity of ‚ÄúBruce Wayne‚Äù and has given in to being Batman more ‚Äúfull time‚Äù). Batman finds out there are vampires he has not ‚Äúkilled‚Äù yet (as he had killed a large sum of them in Red Rain)(Because Vampires are undead he does not consider it murder to take them out). While he hunts these vamps down he is heavily resisting the urge to suck blood and because he has resisted it he is getting progressively weaker to the point it‚Äôs hard to do much of anything. In the first comic Tanya (a vampire woman he had become friends with) had synthesized this replacement for blood that would keep her alive and well without the need to kill. Bruce tries to recreate this but it‚Äôs not enough for him and he continues to become weaker the most he resists sucking blood.  While this is happening Joker has started working with the vampires LOL he‚Äôs just being Joker using his charm and stuff to get them to comply.   Cut to Selina who we see get attacked by a werewolf like creature and she becomes a werecat from this attack (I‚Äôd like to note the way this was framed it very much reads like sexual assault). She intends to get her male attacker back for what he did to her.  Selina attacks Batman believing him to be the man but they clear it up fast that he is not. She wants to help him but in Batman fashion he denies her help.   There‚Äôs this woman who Batman has been going to trying to gain information on these super natural occurrings. He asks her if it‚Äôs possible for him to survive when he doesn‚Äôt drink blood and asks what an alternative may be. She basically says GET A BITCH! (he needs the loving touch of a woman or something)   When he runs away from the woman Selina finds him and takes him to her apartment where they cuddle until morning and he DOES feel better after this. Like a considerable amount. He feels like his weakness is going away. So he lets her in on his scheme to catch the Joker and the rest of the vamps. They go to find them and take them down.  During the scuffle Joker shoots Selina with an arrow and she‚Äôs killed. Batman filled with rage finally gives in to his urge to suck blood and he sucks the Jokers blood. Making sure to take the necessary precautions afterwards to ensure Joker doesn‚Äôt come back to life as a vampire.   In this world if you suck blood you become impure and start to have reactions to stereotypical vampire deterrents. Batman believes himself to be unsafe now that he‚Äôs sucked blood and tasks Gordan and Alfred with killing him.  How is this queer? In this section we will operate under the assumption queerness and vampirism are inherently intertwined in this story. That is to say vampirism is just a stand in for queerness or queer experiences. Vampires and vampire media has been queercoded and littered with queer subtext for DECADES. I recommend reading up on it or if you‚Äôre into Video Essays I really enjoyed this video about the bisexualness of Dracula specifically!  In these next images Batman is talking to another vampire about his vampirism (or more like the Vampire is talking AT him and Batman tries to deny it).   Batman says that he does NOT drink blood and the way the vampire responds seems almost erotic lol? He tells Batman that he knows he WANTS to drink blood and that sooner or later he‚Äôll just have to give in to it. Again batman denies denies denies but it‚Äôs because he knows it to be TRUE the desire is only getting stronger.   The vampire calls him a ‚Äúfilthy blood junkie‚Äù (to me this seems akin to calling a queer person ‚Äúfaggot‚Äù perhaps). The way he says that the vampirism is just ‚Äútempting the natural predator in him.‚Äù struck me as a way of saying ‚Äúyou‚Äôve always been queer but the urge (to do something about it) is undeniable now so what are you going to do about it?‚Äù The vampire goes on to say he used to HATE the site of blood (perhaps that he used to hate his own queerness and hid from it) but now that he‚Äôs a vampire he craves it. It gives him satisfaction exactly what he needs he can‚Äôt get enough of it.   This whole interaction reads (to me) as this man describing his queer awakening to Batman connecting his own experience to Batmans recognizing the signs. But Batman doesn‚Äôt believe this. He doesn‚Äôt WANT to give in.   These next images I share focus on Batman denying himself blood.  He describes how he‚Äôs become addicted to the idea of something he‚Äôs never even had before. This resonated with me when you‚Äôre discovering your queerness it seems a lot bigger than it is (bc being queer would be something easy if there weren‚Äôt societal pressures) and craving to have this experience you‚Äôve never gotten. He seems afraid of himself. He sees himself as a predator as someone people should fear. He doesn‚Äôt want to be ‚Äútempted‚Äù by Alfred. I dont think he‚Äôd ever do anything to Alfred here in a queer reading I‚Äôd say this is the result of being told by people that you are predatory for who you love and it becoming so Ingrained in your sense of self you BELIEVE it.   Next I want to touch on WHY Bruce is so comforted by Selina. Why she literally makes him stronger I have two ways I think this could be taken in my reading.   After cuddling with Selina all night Batman feels MUCH better. He is getting his strength back just from being near her.  1) This is an interpretation I think is sweet above anything else that I was thinking about while reading. Selina is a werecat Batman is a vampire. They can relate to eachother. They‚Äôre both queer. They‚Äôre both feared for something they cannot control. The reason Batman finds comfort in Selina is because she is his community. Living in places where there aren‚Äôt a lot of openly queer people finding another queer person is a major comfort. You feel less alone. She is giving him something he‚Äôs desperately needed and that‚Äôs the hope that his future isn‚Äôt doomed because of who he loves.  2) The reason she comforts him is because she validated his heterosexuality. He is cuddling with her and doing things that are stereotypically romantic and that comforts him because it means he can still ‚Äúmask‚Äù (for lack of a better way to put that) his queerness. When he is with her he can pretend that he is not fighting this battle with himself. He can pretend he is what society deems ‚Äúnormal‚Äù.  When Selina is killed Batman refers to her as ‚Äúhis last hope.‚Äù   I think my second reading makes sense in this context she was literally his last hope at denying his queerness but with her gone he no longer feels he can hold back what he‚Äôs been dealing with.   Batman is shown resisting what would normally hurt a vampire because he is still ‚Äúpure‚Äù. He hasn‚Äôt tasted blood (had a queer experience). he brings up Selina having selfless love for him she made him stronger. (Side note: that‚Äôs really fucking sweet and I love batman and Selina sm)  This next image made my jaw drop because to me if you replace the word ‚Äúsane‚Äù with perhaps ‚Äúheterosexual‚Äù or ‚Äústraight‚Äù it would make A LOT of sense.   Batman has completely given up on hiding his queerness. There‚Äôs no point in resisting it anymore (was there ever when he knew how this would end eventually?).  I‚Äôll leave a transcription of the cursive in the alt text for these next pages. I feel the experience is a lot better when you read them yourself.  ALTALTALT So yeah Batman describes (very erotically might I add!) sucking the Jokers blood. Literally saying the Joker has WON. And like I feel like this is speaking for itself but I‚Äôll try to describe how I felt while reading.  Batman giving in to something he‚Äôs always wanted and immediately feeling Shame and guilt at what he‚Äôs done. Much like how when things stay in your mind you can deny them but when you act things out (like being queer with someone-) you can no longer deny what you desire. He becomes impure once he sucks Jokers blood so he runs away from all that can hurt him and asks Gordon and Alfred to end him. Because what is he supposed to do now? Live on knowing what he has done what he will become if he keeps going? If it‚Äôs just one person he can destroy the evidence of it ever happening continue to deny what he knows to be true but if there were more? he simply wouldn‚Äôt be able to stay in denial.   I think Joker being the character here too adds so much for me personally (as someone who likes batjokes) because in the literal sense it is Batman giving in to his urge to kill Joker but from a queer standpoint it seems like something entirely different. He hates the Joker but he cant help but give in to this hidden desire he has that has been taking over his mind. It makes so much sense it‚Äôs the Joker because he is his greatest temptation.
Mr.Freeze

Been thinking a lot about The Batman and hearing how disappointed people are with Two-Face‚Äôs direction in Batman: Caped Crusader. Which gave me two specific ideas that I don‚Äôt think have been explored yet with Two-Face.  Let it be known that I have surface level two-face knowledge but just thinking about the world of The Batman and how Harvey can be incorporated into it:  1) his left side of the face‚Ä¶ is a birth defect. Cleft lip a blemish something in-universe to explain its scarred look. I think this would not only fit a modern day outlook (I know it‚Äôs mostly Harvey thinking he can no longer be an attorney thanks to the deformity but yknow) but give an external force to Harvey‚Äôs complex thoughts. The scarring isn‚Äôt the catalyst this time  2) in order to find a middle between ‚Äúgood lawyer who had one bad day/bad childhood‚Äù and ‚Äúcorrupt politician‚Äù - how about he‚Äôs an Aaron Burr. Too centrist for city council and the public too goody-two-shoes for the rogues. He secretly uses a coin flip as the final say cause he‚Äôs so indecisive. The public gave him the nickname Two-Face

post_body: Day twelve of @whumperless-whump-event   Fandoms: The Flash and Nightwing   Tw for blood     Building collapse | trapped under rubble | ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt feel my legs‚Äù     The Flash ran through the rubble of the building searching frantically for his best friend. Nightwing couldn‚Äôt be dead. He couldn‚Äôt be.     The building had come down just moments before with Nightwing still inside and now he wasn‚Äôt answering his comm. It had only been a minute or so but to Wally it felt like hours.     He felt like his fingers were falling off as he dug and dug dragging civilians out with the rubble. He could feel his fear turning to panic as each person he found wasn‚Äôt Dick. He couldn‚Äôt be buried that far!     Suddenly he heard static through his comm followed by a quiet ‚Äú‚Ä¶Wally?‚Äù     Wally could‚Äôve cried with relief. Dick was alive. His boyfriend was still breathing. But that didn‚Äôt mean he was unharmed. In fact it was highly likely that he was injured seeing as he had forgotten to use Wally‚Äôs codename. Dick never forgot.     ‚ÄúNightwing? Where are you? Are you okay?‚Äù Wally said shooting out questions before he even knew what he was saying.      ‚ÄúI‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm stuck. I can‚Äôt move my legs!‚Äù Dick answered sounding panicked.     ‚ÄúNightwing status report‚Äù Wally barked remembering that was something Batman did when Dick was too out of it to answer.      ‚ÄúLegs are pinned definitely broken. I‚Äôm bleeding from‚Ä¶ somewhere I‚Äôm not sure where and definitely a concussion. I‚Ä¶ I don‚Äôt know where I am just that I‚Äôm buried. I‚Äôm sorry.‚Äù     Man that worked wonders. Wally wondered if there was some code word for every situation.      ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs okay I‚Äôm gonna get you out. Just hang on‚Äù Wally said continuing to dismantle the building. ‚ÄúHow bad are you bleeding?‚Äù     ‚ÄúBad‚Äù Dick answered. Wally‚Äôs heart sank. ‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs coming from my legs or stomach but it‚Äôs already soaked my back. I‚Äôm‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm starting to get really dizzy‚Ä¶‚Äù     ‚ÄúNightwing stay awake‚Äù Wally ordered. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm going to find you just keep talking.‚Äù     Wally sped up his movements becoming desperate and frantic. He couldn‚Äôt lose Dick. He‚Äôd lost so many people but losing Dick would break him.      ‚ÄúWalls‚Ä¶ I don‚Äôt‚Ä¶ I don‚Äôt think I can stay awake much longer‚Ä¶‚Äù Dick said his voice growing weaker.     ‚ÄúPlease Dick just try!‚Äù Wally shouted dropping the codename to see if Dick would listen better.     ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt p-panic but I think ‚Äôm going into shock‚Ä¶‚Äù     Wally panicked. He couldn‚Äôt help it. He had stayed calm as long as possible but Dick‚Äôs voice fading out and the fact that he hadn‚Äôt found him yet was making that impossible. And now that Dick was going into shock he didn‚Äôt have much longer.      What if he couldn‚Äôt get Dick help in time? What if he was too late? What if Dick was already gone when he found him?     After he‚Äôd broken each finger probably six times he saw a flash of familiar black hair. It was Dick.      ‚ÄúDick? I‚Äôm here baby I‚Äôm here‚Äù he said lifting the rubble off of him. What he saw nearly made him freeze up.     Dick‚Äôs face was pale as death too pale to blame on the dust and the blood was just‚Ä¶ everywhere. He had been right though. The blood was coming from a deep puncture wound in his abdomen. He was conscious but only barely.      Wally picked up his boyfriend‚Äôs upper half holding him close and feeling for a heartbeat. When he felt it he let out a breath that he hadn‚Äôt known he was holding. It was weak and way too fast but it was there.      ‚ÄúI‚Äôm here now Dickiebird. You‚Äôre gonna be okay‚Äù he said softly through the tears he hadn‚Äôt realized were there.      ‚ÄúHngh‚Äù was all Dick managed to say in response his eyes glazing over.     Wally removed the rubble from Dick‚Äôs legs preparing for the possible bleeding. They were badly broken but thankfully there was no more blood.     ‚ÄúI‚Äôll be right back babe. Just stay right here‚Äù he said before running off freeing any remaining citizens.      When he returned Dick almost looked worse than when he left.      ‚ÄúDickie? Can you hear me?‚Äù Wally asked. Dick paused for a moment before nodding slowly. ‚ÄúGood. I‚Äôm gonna get you to the cave. You‚Äôre gonna be okay.‚Äù     He planted a kiss on his forehead before speeding off into the night.     //////     Hours later Wally found himself sitting outside the med bay in the bat cave. This was always his least favorite part. Sitting still and waiting. Not knowing if his boyfriend was okay. Not knowing if he would even make it.      Of course he trusted Alfred and Leslie but it was bad this time. Dick‚Äôs body had started to decompensate when Wally had picked him up and he hadn‚Äôt been breathing when he got to the cave. He knew that no news was good news but that didn‚Äôt make the wait any easier.      ‚ÄúMaster Wallace?‚Äù He heard Alfred say startling him out of his thoughts.      ‚ÄúYeah?‚Äù He asked eagerly.      ‚ÄúMy apologies. I did not mean to startle you. Anyways Master Dick is now stable and is asking for you‚Äù Alfred said.      Wally‚Äôs body visibly sagged with relief. Dick was alive. Alive and awake enough to ask for him. He wasted no time in following Alfred.      When he saw Dick he could‚Äôve cried. His big blue eyes were open focused and looking right at him. Although he had a mask on he was in fact breathing.      Wally rushed over to him kissing him deeply before Dick could even react.     ‚ÄúI‚Äôm glad you‚Äôre not dead‚Äù Wally said crying silently yet laughing with relief.      ‚ÄúHm. Me too‚Äù Dick said tiredly.      ‚ÄúI told you you‚Äôd be okay. Hey he‚Äôs gonna be okay right?‚Äù He Wally asked Alfred.      ‚ÄúIndeed‚Äù Alfred answered. ‚ÄúIt was a close shave but as soon as we got him blood he perked right up.‚Äù     ‚ÄúGood. That‚Äôs good‚Äù he said before burying his face in Dick‚Äôs shoulder.      ‚ÄúI‚Äôm gonna be okay Wally‚Ä¶‚Äù Dick said reassuringly. Wally still wasn‚Äôt sure he believed it.     ‚ÄúYou‚Äôd better be.‚Äù     He held Dick tightly and this time Dick squeezed him back.

Batman: Shadows Of Laughter (part 1) A fan fiction by Ecky     **Disclaimer:**    ‚ÄúShadows of Laughter‚Äù is a non-commercial fan fiction story created by and for fans of the Batman franchise. This work is not affiliated with endorsed or approved by DC Comics Warner Bros. Entertainment or any other official entities associated with Batman and related characters. All characters such as Batman Joker Harley Quinn and other original creations appearing in this story are the property of their respective trademark and copyright holders.    The original characters of Ms. Racey Rhymes Revan Hannah Sarah and Maxwell Pride are creations of the author and any resemblance to actual persons living or dead or other fictional characters is purely coincidental.    This story is intended solely for entertainment purposes and is not for commercial use. No infringement of copyright or trademark is intended.    The Characters:    Batman as himself        Comissioner Gordan as himself        @raceyrhymes as Ms Rhymes        @samcrosfaith as Revan (might come across as a man but is a woman under the mask and costume a goth chick)       @solesofwonder as Hannah and Sarah        @horrorseventhree as Maxwell Pride        The night air in Gotham City carried a chill that seemed to seep into the very bones of its inhabitants. High above the bustling streets perched on a gargoyle adorning one of the city‚Äôs countless Gothic spires a dark figure surveyed the urban sprawl below. Batman the city‚Äôs vigilant guardian scanned the horizon with eyes that missed nothing.
