A moment later emergency generators kicked in bathing everything in an eerie red glow.    ‚ÄúWhat the hell?‚Äù Gordon muttered reaching for his gun.    The answer came in the form of a melodic laugh that seemed to emanate from everywhere at once. ‚ÄúOh Commissioner‚Äù Ms. Racey Rhymes‚Äô voice purred over the station‚Äôs PA system. ‚ÄúDid you really think your little fortress could keep me out?‚Äù    Before anyone could react the windows exploded inward showering the room with glass. Smoke grenades rolled across the floor filling the air with thick purplish smoke. As officers coughed and stumbled shadowy figures moved through the haze ‚Äì Ms. Rhymes‚Äô goons their painted smiles visible even through the smoke.    ‚ÄúLadies and gentlemen of Gotham‚Äôs finest‚Äù Ms. Rhymes‚Äô voice rang out again tinged with manic glee. ‚ÄúWelcome to the next act of our little drama. I do hope you‚Äôre ready for a show-stopping performance!‚Äù    Outside the police station Hannah and Sarah arrived just in time to see the chaos unfolding. They exchanged a determined look before pulling on their own masks ‚Äì simple domino masks that concealed their identities without hampering their vision.    ‚ÄúReady?‚Äù Hannah asked her voice tight with tension.    Sarah nodded pulling out a pair of escrima sticks. ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs show these clowns what real justice looks like.‚Äù    Back across town Batman and Revan‚Äôs battle had reached a fever pitch. Both combatants were showing signs of fatigue but neither was willing to give an inch. They stood on opposite ends of a rooftop each assessing the other with newfound respect.    ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre good‚Äù Batman admitted his breath coming in ragged gasps. ‚ÄúBut this ends now. I won‚Äôt let Gotham fall to madness.‚Äù    Revan tilted his head his mask betraying no emotion. ‚ÄúWho said anything about letting Gotham fall? This isn‚Äôt about destruction Batman. It‚Äôs about transformation.‚Äù    Before Batman could respond a new voice cut through the night. ‚ÄúWell done Revan darling. You‚Äôve played your part beautifully.‚Äù    Both men turned to see Ms. Racey Rhymes standing on a nearby rooftop flanked by her grinning goons. She held a sleek high-tech rifle in her hands aimed squarely at Batman.    ‚ÄúWhat is this?‚Äù Revan demanded a note of anger creeping into his voice.    Ms. Rhymes laughed the sound sending chills down Batman‚Äôs spine. ‚ÄúOh my dear Revan. Did you really think I‚Äôd entrust the capture of the Bat to anyone but myself? You were the distraction darling. The opening act to my grand finale.‚Äù    With that she fired. Batman still reeling from his battle with Revan couldn‚Äôt dodge in time. The dart struck him in the shoulder and almost immediately he felt his limbs growing heavy.    ‚ÄúNo!‚Äù Revan shouted moving to intercept but it was too late. Batman stumbled fighting against the potent tranquilizer coursing through his system.    As darkness closed in around him the last thing Batman saw was Ms. Rhymes‚Äô triumphant smile and Revan‚Äôs clenched fists.    At the police station the battle was in full swing. Hannah and Sarah had managed to fight their way inside their skills a match for Ms. Rhymes‚Äô thugs. They moved in perfect sync covering each other‚Äôs blind spots and taking down goon after goon.    ‚ÄúWe need to find Gordon!‚Äù Sarah shouted over the chaos.    Hannah nodded ducking under a wild swing from one of the attackers. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôll be in the thick of it. Come on!‚Äù    They fought their way deeper into the station the air thick with smoke and the sound of combat. Finally they spotted Commissioner Gordon back-to-back with a handful of officers holding off a group of Ms. Rhymes‚Äô more heavily armed thugs.    ‚ÄúCommissioner!‚Äù Hannah called out. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre here to help!‚Äù    Gordon‚Äôs eyes widened as he saw the masked women cutting through the chaos. ‚ÄúWho the hell are you?‚Äù    ‚ÄúFriends‚Äù Sarah replied simply her escrima sticks a blur as she took down two attackers in quick succession.    With Hannah and Sarah‚Äôs help the tide began to turn. Ms. Rhymes‚Äô goons facing unexpected resistance began to fall back.    Suddenly Ms. Rhymes‚Äô voice crackled over the PA system once more. ‚ÄúWell well well. It seems our little party has some uninvited guests. How delightfully chaotic! But I‚Äôm afraid I must cut this performance short. I have a very important date with a certain Bat you see.‚Äù    The remaining thugs began a coordinated retreat covering their exit with more smoke grenades. As the air cleared Gordon Hannah and Sarah found themselves standing in the wreckage of the police station.    ‚ÄúThey‚Äôre getting away!‚Äù Sarah growled moving towards the exit.    But Hannah grabbed her arm holding her back. ‚ÄúWait. Listen.‚Äù    In the distance they could hear the wail of approaching sirens. ‚ÄúBackup‚Äù Gordon said a note of relief in his voice. ‚ÄúAbout damn time.‚Äù    Hannah turned to the Commissioner. ‚ÄúWe need to go after Ms. Rhymes. She said something about Batman ‚Äì I think he might be in trouble.‚Äù    Gordon hesitated for a moment then nodded. ‚ÄúGo. I‚Äôll coordinate things here and join you as soon as I can. But be careful ‚Äì this woman is more dangerous than anyone we‚Äôve faced before.‚Äù    As Hannah and Sarah raced out into the night following the trail of Ms. Rhymes‚Äô retreat a new player entered the scene. Revan his posture radiating barely contained fury landed on a nearby rooftop.    ‚ÄúYou‚Äù he growled spotting Hannah and Sarah. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre after Rhymes.‚Äù    The two women tensed ready for another fight but Revan held up a hand. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not here to stop you. Rhymes‚Ä¶ she betrayed the code. Used me as a pawn in her game. That cannot stand.‚Äù    Sarah‚Äôs eyes narrowed behind her mask. ‚ÄúWhy should we trust you?‚Äù    ‚ÄúBecause right now I‚Äôm your best chance at finding Batman before it‚Äôs too late‚Äù Revan replied. ‚ÄúRhymes has him and whatever she‚Äôs planning it won‚Äôt be pleasant.‚Äù    Hannah and Sarah exchanged a look years of partnership allowing them to communicate without words. Finally Hannah nodded. ‚ÄúAlright. But one wrong move and you‚Äôll regret it.‚Äù    Revan inclined his head in acknowledgment. ‚ÄúUnderstood. Now come ‚Äì we have a Bat to save and a poet to silence.‚Äù    As the unlikely trio set off in pursuit of Ms. Racey Rhymes the Gotham night seemed to hold its breath. The game had changed alliances shifted and the fate of the city hung in the balance.    In a hidden location deep in the bowels of Gotham Batman slowly regained consciousness. He found himself strapped to a chair his utility belt gone surrounded by an array of strange machinery. And there perched on a ornate throne-like chair sat Ms. Racey Rhymes her eyes gleaming with manic glee.    ‚ÄúWelcome back to the land of the living my dear Dark Knight‚Äù she purred. ‚ÄúOh the poem we‚Äôre going to write together‚Ä¶ it will be a masterpiece that will reshape Gotham forever.‚Äù    As Batman struggled against his bonds he realized with growing dread that this was only the beginning of Ms. Racey Rhymes‚Äô twisted performance. The real show it seemed was about to begin.

post_body: Batman: Bloodstorm & Queerness READ: this has been posted on twitter aswell so if you find that it‚Äôs me lol! This will be an even longer version of that with more description as I don‚Äôt have the pesky world limit here! I wanted to start this out by saying I may get some things wrong and this was something I‚Äôd originally had posted on a Mastodon Server my friends are running so I wasn‚Äôt checking it over very much just wanted to get my thoughts out! There are probably a lot of different ways this comic can be read but I‚Äôm particularly enamored by queer readings of comics so that‚Äôs what I‚Äôll be focusing on today. This won‚Äôt be exhaustive on the queer metaphors in this comic and I‚Äôd be happy for people to add on to what I say! I‚Äôm not an expert on making analysis posts so forgive me if anything is unclear or out of place. I‚Äôm also getting used to Tumblr formatting but fans here tend to be more active so I really wanted to share here! With that let‚Äôs get into it  <!-- more --> Brief Summary Before getting into my reading I thought it best to give a (semi-) brief Summary of the comic itself. There‚Äôs also someone context from the previous comic (as this is part of a trilogy!) that I‚Äôll try to provide too but a lot of the material I‚Äôll talk about isn‚Äôt really dependent on the fact you have the experience of reading Red Rain.   In ‚ÄúBatman: Bloodstorm‚Äù Bruce has been turned into a vampire (the previous comic delves into how this happened but just know he‚Äôs sort of shed the identity of ‚ÄúBruce Wayne‚Äù and has given in to being Batman more ‚Äúfull time‚Äù). Batman finds out there are vampires he has not ‚Äúkilled‚Äù yet (as he had killed a large sum of them in Red Rain)(Because Vampires are undead he does not consider it murder to take them out). While he hunts these vamps down he is heavily resisting the urge to suck blood and because he has resisted it he is getting progressively weaker to the point it‚Äôs hard to do much of anything. In the first comic Tanya (a vampire woman he had become friends with) had synthesized this replacement for blood that would keep her alive and well without the need to kill. Bruce tries to recreate this but it‚Äôs not enough for him and he continues to become weaker the most he resists sucking blood.  While this is happening Joker has started working with the vampires LOL he‚Äôs just being Joker using his charm and stuff to get them to comply.   Cut to Selina who we see get attacked by a werewolf like creature and she becomes a werecat from this attack (I‚Äôd like to note the way this was framed it very much reads like sexual assault). She intends to get her male attacker back for what he did to her.  Selina attacks Batman believing him to be the man but they clear it up fast that he is not. She wants to help him but in Batman fashion he denies her help.   There‚Äôs this woman who Batman has been going to trying to gain information on these super natural occurrings. He asks her if it‚Äôs possible for him to survive when he doesn‚Äôt drink blood and asks what an alternative may be. She basically says GET A BITCH! (he needs the loving touch of a woman or something)   When he runs away from the woman Selina finds him and takes him to her apartment where they cuddle until morning and he DOES feel better after this. Like a considerable amount. He feels like his weakness is going away. So he lets her in on his scheme to catch the Joker and the rest of the vamps. They go to find them and take them down.  During the scuffle Joker shoots Selina with an arrow and she‚Äôs killed. Batman filled with rage finally gives in to his urge to suck blood and he sucks the Jokers blood. Making sure to take the necessary precautions afterwards to ensure Joker doesn‚Äôt come back to life as a vampire.   In this world if you suck blood you become impure and start to have reactions to stereotypical vampire deterrents. Batman believes himself to be unsafe now that he‚Äôs sucked blood and tasks Gordan and Alfred with killing him.  How is this queer? In this section we will operate under the assumption queerness and vampirism are inherently intertwined in this story. That is to say vampirism is just a stand in for queerness or queer experiences. Vampires and vampire media has been queercoded and littered with queer subtext for DECADES. I recommend reading up on it or if you‚Äôre into Video Essays I really enjoyed this video about the bisexualness of Dracula specifically!  In these next images Batman is talking to another vampire about his vampirism (or more like the Vampire is talking AT him and Batman tries to deny it).   Batman says that he does NOT drink blood and the way the vampire responds seems almost erotic lol? He tells Batman that he knows he WANTS to drink blood and that sooner or later he‚Äôll just have to give in to it. Again batman denies denies denies but it‚Äôs because he knows it to be TRUE the desire is only getting stronger.   The vampire calls him a ‚Äúfilthy blood junkie‚Äù (to me this seems akin to calling a queer person ‚Äúfaggot‚Äù perhaps). The way he says that the vampirism is just ‚Äútempting the natural predator in him.‚Äù struck me as a way of saying ‚Äúyou‚Äôve always been queer but the urge (to do something about it) is undeniable now so what are you going to do about it?‚Äù The vampire goes on to say he used to HATE the site of blood (perhaps that he used to hate his own queerness and hid from it) but now that he‚Äôs a vampire he craves it. It gives him satisfaction exactly what he needs he can‚Äôt get enough of it.   This whole interaction reads (to me) as this man describing his queer awakening to Batman connecting his own experience to Batmans recognizing the signs. But Batman doesn‚Äôt believe this. He doesn‚Äôt WANT to give in.   These next images I share focus on Batman denying himself blood.  He describes how he‚Äôs become addicted to the idea of something he‚Äôs never even had before. This resonated with me when you‚Äôre discovering your queerness it seems a lot bigger than it is (bc being queer would be something easy if there weren‚Äôt societal pressures) and craving to have this experience you‚Äôve never gotten. He seems afraid of himself. He sees himself as a predator as someone people should fear. He doesn‚Äôt want to be ‚Äútempted‚Äù by Alfred. I dont think he‚Äôd ever do anything to Alfred here in a queer reading I‚Äôd say this is the result of being told by people that you are predatory for who you love and it becoming so Ingrained in your sense of self you BELIEVE it.   Next I want to touch on WHY Bruce is so comforted by Selina. Why she literally makes him stronger I have two ways I think this could be taken in my reading.   After cuddling with Selina all night Batman feels MUCH better. He is getting his strength back just from being near her.  1) This is an interpretation I think is sweet above anything else that I was thinking about while reading. Selina is a werecat Batman is a vampire. They can relate to eachother. They‚Äôre both queer. They‚Äôre both feared for something they cannot control. The reason Batman finds comfort in Selina is because she is his community. Living in places where there aren‚Äôt a lot of openly queer people finding another queer person is a major comfort. You feel less alone. She is giving him something he‚Äôs desperately needed and that‚Äôs the hope that his future isn‚Äôt doomed because of who he loves.  2) The reason she comforts him is because she validated his heterosexuality. He is cuddling with her and doing things that are stereotypically romantic and that comforts him because it means he can still ‚Äúmask‚Äù (for lack of a better way to put that) his queerness. When he is with her he can pretend that he is not fighting this battle with himself. He can pretend he is what society deems ‚Äúnormal‚Äù.  When Selina is killed Batman refers to her as ‚Äúhis last hope.‚Äù   I think my second reading makes sense in this context she was literally his last hope at denying his queerness but with her gone he no longer feels he can hold back what he‚Äôs been dealing with.   Batman is shown resisting what would normally hurt a vampire because he is still ‚Äúpure‚Äù. He hasn‚Äôt tasted blood (had a queer experience). he brings up Selina having selfless love for him she made him stronger. (Side note: that‚Äôs really fucking sweet and I love batman and Selina sm)  This next image made my jaw drop because to me if you replace the word ‚Äúsane‚Äù with perhaps ‚Äúheterosexual‚Äù or ‚Äústraight‚Äù it would make A LOT of sense.   Batman has completely given up on hiding his queerness. There‚Äôs no point in resisting it anymore (was there ever when he knew how this would end eventually?).  I‚Äôll leave a transcription of the cursive in the alt text for these next pages. I feel the experience is a lot better when you read them yourself.  ALTALTALT So yeah Batman describes (very erotically might I add!) sucking the Jokers blood. Literally saying the Joker has WON. And like I feel like this is speaking for itself but I‚Äôll try to describe how I felt while reading.  Batman giving in to something he‚Äôs always wanted and immediately feeling Shame and guilt at what he‚Äôs done. Much like how when things stay in your mind you can deny them but when you act things out (like being queer with someone-) you can no longer deny what you desire. He becomes impure once he sucks Jokers blood so he runs away from all that can hurt him and asks Gordon and Alfred to end him. Because what is he supposed to do now? Live on knowing what he has done what he will become if he keeps going? If it‚Äôs just one person he can destroy the evidence of it ever happening continue to deny what he knows to be true but if there were more? he simply wouldn‚Äôt be able to stay in denial.   I think Joker being the character here too adds so much for me personally (as someone who likes batjokes) because in the literal sense it is Batman giving in to his urge to kill Joker but from a queer standpoint it seems like something entirely different. He hates the Joker but he cant help but give in to this hidden desire he has that has been taking over his mind. It makes so much sense it‚Äôs the Joker because he is his greatest temptation.
Mr.Freeze

I‚Äôm usually not one to recommend fics but this one deserves it.   my heart (it digs its own grave) - Excalis - DCU Archive of Our Own      I am enamored with any writing that characterizes bruce and clark accurately and this fic accomplishes that. Bruce getting into trouble for being devastatingly selfless is a detail I will always appreciate.  Please give it a shot as someone who has been reading these things for almost a decade this one is a stand out.

post_body: Day twelve of @whumperless-whump-event   Fandoms: The Flash and Nightwing   Tw for blood     Building collapse | trapped under rubble | ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt feel my legs‚Äù     The Flash ran through the rubble of the building searching frantically for his best friend. Nightwing couldn‚Äôt be dead. He couldn‚Äôt be.     The building had come down just moments before with Nightwing still inside and now he wasn‚Äôt answering his comm. It had only been a minute or so but to Wally it felt like hours.     He felt like his fingers were falling off as he dug and dug dragging civilians out with the rubble. He could feel his fear turning to panic as each person he found wasn‚Äôt Dick. He couldn‚Äôt be buried that far!     Suddenly he heard static through his comm followed by a quiet ‚Äú‚Ä¶Wally?‚Äù     Wally could‚Äôve cried with relief. Dick was alive. His boyfriend was still breathing. But that didn‚Äôt mean he was unharmed. In fact it was highly likely that he was injured seeing as he had forgotten to use Wally‚Äôs codename. Dick never forgot.     ‚ÄúNightwing? Where are you? Are you okay?‚Äù Wally said shooting out questions before he even knew what he was saying.      ‚ÄúI‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm stuck. I can‚Äôt move my legs!‚Äù Dick answered sounding panicked.     ‚ÄúNightwing status report‚Äù Wally barked remembering that was something Batman did when Dick was too out of it to answer.      ‚ÄúLegs are pinned definitely broken. I‚Äôm bleeding from‚Ä¶ somewhere I‚Äôm not sure where and definitely a concussion. I‚Ä¶ I don‚Äôt know where I am just that I‚Äôm buried. I‚Äôm sorry.‚Äù     Man that worked wonders. Wally wondered if there was some code word for every situation.      ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs okay I‚Äôm gonna get you out. Just hang on‚Äù Wally said continuing to dismantle the building. ‚ÄúHow bad are you bleeding?‚Äù     ‚ÄúBad‚Äù Dick answered. Wally‚Äôs heart sank. ‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs coming from my legs or stomach but it‚Äôs already soaked my back. I‚Äôm‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm starting to get really dizzy‚Ä¶‚Äù     ‚ÄúNightwing stay awake‚Äù Wally ordered. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm going to find you just keep talking.‚Äù     Wally sped up his movements becoming desperate and frantic. He couldn‚Äôt lose Dick. He‚Äôd lost so many people but losing Dick would break him.      ‚ÄúWalls‚Ä¶ I don‚Äôt‚Ä¶ I don‚Äôt think I can stay awake much longer‚Ä¶‚Äù Dick said his voice growing weaker.     ‚ÄúPlease Dick just try!‚Äù Wally shouted dropping the codename to see if Dick would listen better.     ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt p-panic but I think ‚Äôm going into shock‚Ä¶‚Äù     Wally panicked. He couldn‚Äôt help it. He had stayed calm as long as possible but Dick‚Äôs voice fading out and the fact that he hadn‚Äôt found him yet was making that impossible. And now that Dick was going into shock he didn‚Äôt have much longer.      What if he couldn‚Äôt get Dick help in time? What if he was too late? What if Dick was already gone when he found him?     After he‚Äôd broken each finger probably six times he saw a flash of familiar black hair. It was Dick.      ‚ÄúDick? I‚Äôm here baby I‚Äôm here‚Äù he said lifting the rubble off of him. What he saw nearly made him freeze up.     Dick‚Äôs face was pale as death too pale to blame on the dust and the blood was just‚Ä¶ everywhere. He had been right though. The blood was coming from a deep puncture wound in his abdomen. He was conscious but only barely.      Wally picked up his boyfriend‚Äôs upper half holding him close and feeling for a heartbeat. When he felt it he let out a breath that he hadn‚Äôt known he was holding. It was weak and way too fast but it was there.      ‚ÄúI‚Äôm here now Dickiebird. You‚Äôre gonna be okay‚Äù he said softly through the tears he hadn‚Äôt realized were there.      ‚ÄúHngh‚Äù was all Dick managed to say in response his eyes glazing over.     Wally removed the rubble from Dick‚Äôs legs preparing for the possible bleeding. They were badly broken but thankfully there was no more blood.     ‚ÄúI‚Äôll be right back babe. Just stay right here‚Äù he said before running off freeing any remaining citizens.      When he returned Dick almost looked worse than when he left.      ‚ÄúDickie? Can you hear me?‚Äù Wally asked. Dick paused for a moment before nodding slowly. ‚ÄúGood. I‚Äôm gonna get you to the cave. You‚Äôre gonna be okay.‚Äù     He planted a kiss on his forehead before speeding off into the night.     //////     Hours later Wally found himself sitting outside the med bay in the bat cave. This was always his least favorite part. Sitting still and waiting. Not knowing if his boyfriend was okay. Not knowing if he would even make it.      Of course he trusted Alfred and Leslie but it was bad this time. Dick‚Äôs body had started to decompensate when Wally had picked him up and he hadn‚Äôt been breathing when he got to the cave. He knew that no news was good news but that didn‚Äôt make the wait any easier.      ‚ÄúMaster Wallace?‚Äù He heard Alfred say startling him out of his thoughts.      ‚ÄúYeah?‚Äù He asked eagerly.      ‚ÄúMy apologies. I did not mean to startle you. Anyways Master Dick is now stable and is asking for you‚Äù Alfred said.      Wally‚Äôs body visibly sagged with relief. Dick was alive. Alive and awake enough to ask for him. He wasted no time in following Alfred.      When he saw Dick he could‚Äôve cried. His big blue eyes were open focused and looking right at him. Although he had a mask on he was in fact breathing.      Wally rushed over to him kissing him deeply before Dick could even react.     ‚ÄúI‚Äôm glad you‚Äôre not dead‚Äù Wally said crying silently yet laughing with relief.      ‚ÄúHm. Me too‚Äù Dick said tiredly.      ‚ÄúI told you you‚Äôd be okay. Hey he‚Äôs gonna be okay right?‚Äù He Wally asked Alfred.      ‚ÄúIndeed‚Äù Alfred answered. ‚ÄúIt was a close shave but as soon as we got him blood he perked right up.‚Äù     ‚ÄúGood. That‚Äôs good‚Äù he said before burying his face in Dick‚Äôs shoulder.      ‚ÄúI‚Äôm gonna be okay Wally‚Ä¶‚Äù Dick said reassuringly. Wally still wasn‚Äôt sure he believed it.     ‚ÄúYou‚Äôd better be.‚Äù     He held Dick tightly and this time Dick squeezed him back.

Batman: Shadows Of Laughter (part 1) A fan fiction by Ecky     **Disclaimer:**    ‚ÄúShadows of Laughter‚Äù is a non-commercial fan fiction story created by and for fans of the Batman franchise. This work is not affiliated with endorsed or approved by DC Comics Warner Bros. Entertainment or any other official entities associated with Batman and related characters. All characters such as Batman Joker Harley Quinn and other original creations appearing in this story are the property of their respective trademark and copyright holders.    The original characters of Ms. Racey Rhymes Revan Hannah Sarah and Maxwell Pride are creations of the author and any resemblance to actual persons living or dead or other fictional characters is purely coincidental.    This story is intended solely for entertainment purposes and is not for commercial use. No infringement of copyright or trademark is intended.    The Characters:    Batman as himself        Comissioner Gordan as himself        @raceyrhymes as Ms Rhymes        @samcrosfaith as Revan (might come across as a man but is a woman under the mask and costume a goth chick)       @solesofwonder as Hannah and Sarah        @horrorseventhree as Maxwell Pride        The night air in Gotham City carried a chill that seemed to seep into the very bones of its inhabitants. High above the bustling streets perched on a gargoyle adorning one of the city‚Äôs countless Gothic spires a dark figure surveyed the urban sprawl below. Batman the city‚Äôs vigilant guardian scanned the horizon with eyes that missed nothing.    His comm unit crackled to life. ‚ÄúBatman we‚Äôve got another one‚Äù came the gruff voice of Commissioner Gordon. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre gonna want to see this.‚Äù    Without a word Batman leapt from his perch his cape billowing out behind him as he glided towards the source of the disturbance. The night was young but already it promised to be a long one.    Minutes later he touched down in front of Gotham National Bank where a scene of controlled chaos awaited him. Police cruisers formed a perimeter around the building their lights painting the street in alternating flashes of red and blue. Officers milled about their faces a mix of confusion and grim determination.    Commissioner Gordon stood near the entrance his trench coat pulled tight against the chill. As Batman approached Gordon‚Äôs mustache twitched in a mirthless smile. ‚ÄúGlad you could make it‚Äù he said his voice low. ‚ÄúThis one‚Äôs‚Ä¶ different.‚Äù    Batman‚Äôs eyes narrowed behind his cowl. ‚ÄúDifferent how?‚Äù    Gordon gestured towards the bank‚Äôs entrance. ‚ÄúSee for yourself.‚Äù    As they stepped inside the acrid smell of gunpowder mingled with something sweeter almost cloying. The bank‚Äôs marble floor was littered with playing cards each one bearing the unmistakable grinning visage of the Joker. But it was the walls that commanded attention.    Written in what appeared to be purple spray paint a message sprawled across the pristine surface:    ‚ÄúIn this den of greed and gold A jester‚Äôs tale begins to unfold. With laughter and chaos I‚Äôll make my mark Gotham‚Äôs new nightmare in the dark.‚Äù    Batman‚Äôs jaw clenched. ‚ÄúThe Joker?‚Äù    Gordon shook his head. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs the thing. We know for a fact that the Joker‚Äôs locked up tight in Arkham. This is someone new.‚Äù    As they moved deeper into the bank the extent of the carnage became clear. Bodies lay strewn about their faces frozen in grotesque smiles. But there was something off about them.    Batman knelt beside one of the victims examining the rictus grin. ‚ÄúThese aren‚Äôt the Joker‚Äôs usual toxins‚Äù he muttered. ‚ÄúThe chemical composition is different. More refined.‚Äù    ‚ÄúGreat‚Äù Gordon sighed. ‚ÄúSo we‚Äôve got a Joker copycat with an upgraded formula. Any other good news?‚Äù    Batman stood his cape settling around him like a shroud. ‚ÄúThe vault‚Äù he said simply striding towards the massive steel door at the back of the bank.    The vault stood open its contents emptied. But on the inside of the door another message awaited:    ‚ÄúWith rhyme and reason I‚Äôll steal your wealth While Gotham‚Äôs protector grasps at stealth. Can you catch a shadow Dark Knight so brave? Or will my laughter be this city‚Äôs grave?‚Äù    Gordon ran a hand through his graying hair. ‚ÄúPoetry? Since when does the Joker write poetry?‚Äù    ‚ÄúHe doesn‚Äôt‚Äù Batman replied his voice grim. ‚ÄúThis is someone new. Someone who wants us to think it‚Äôs the Joker but is leaving deliberate clues that it isn‚Äôt.‚Äù    As if on cue a bank teller who had been huddling in the corner suddenly sprang to his feet his eyes wild and unfocused. ‚ÄúThe laughter!‚Äù he cried out. ‚ÄúCan‚Äôt you hear it? It‚Äôs everywhere!‚Äù    Before anyone could react the man began to convulse his body twisting in unnatural angles. And then to the horror of all present he began to laugh. It started as a low chuckle but quickly grew into a full-throated cackle that echoed off the marble walls.    Batman moved swiftly catching the man as he collapsed. But it was too late. The laughter died away leaving only the eerie silence of the crime scene.    ‚ÄúWe need to get these bodies to the lab‚Äù Batman said his voice tight with controlled anger. ‚ÄúAnd I want a full analysis of every chemical trace in this building.‚Äù    Gordon nodded already barking orders to his officers. As the scene buzzed with activity Batman slipped away melting into the shadows of the night.    * * *     In the Batcave the soft hum of computers and the occasional screech of bats provided a backdrop to Bruce Wayne‚Äôs intense concentration. He stood before a large screen cowl pulled back brow furrowed as he pored over the data from the bank heist.    ‚ÄúMaster Bruce‚Äù Alfred‚Äôs cultured tones cut through the silence. ‚ÄúPerhaps a spot of tea might help clear the cobwebs?‚Äù    Bruce turned a ghost of a smile touching his lips. ‚ÄúThanks Alfred but I don‚Äôt think tea is going to solve this one.‚Äù    Alfred set the tray down regardless. ‚ÄúPerhaps not sir but it certainly can‚Äôt hurt. Have you made any progress in identifying our poetic miscreant?‚Äù    Bruce shook his head frustration evident in every line of his body. ‚ÄúThe chemical analysis came back inconclusive. It‚Äôs similar to Joker toxin but with key differences. Whoever created this is brilliant possibly on par with the Joker himself.‚Äù    ‚ÄúA disturbing thought‚Äù Alfred mused. ‚ÄúAnd what of the victims?‚Äù    ‚ÄúAll dead‚Äù Bruce said grimly. ‚ÄúThe new toxin works faster than the Joker‚Äôs and it‚Äôs more potent. But that‚Äôs not the strangest part.‚Äù He pulled up an image on the screen showing a close-up of one of the victim‚Äôs faces. ‚ÄúLook at the musculature around the mouth.‚Äù    Alfred leaned in his eyes widening slightly. ‚ÄúGood heavens. It almost appears as if‚Ä¶‚Äù    ‚ÄúAs if they were trying not to smile‚Äù Bruce finished. ‚ÄúThis toxin doesn‚Äôt just force the victims to laugh. It‚Äôs almost as if it‚Äôs fighting against their will forcing the body to betray itself.‚Äù    The computer beeped signaling an incoming transmission. Bruce pulled his cowl back on as Commissioner Gordon‚Äôs face appeared on the screen.    ‚ÄúBatman we‚Äôve got another one‚Äù Gordon said without preamble. ‚ÄúGotham Museum of Modern Art. You‚Äôre not going to believe this.‚Äù    ‚ÄúI‚Äôm on my way‚Äù Batman replied already moving towards the Batmobile.    As the sleek vehicle roared out of the cave Bruce‚Äôs mind raced. Two heists in one night both bearing the hallmarks of the Joker yet undeniably different. Something big was brewing in Gotham and he had a sinking feeling that this was only the beginning.    * * *     The Gotham Museum of Modern Art stood as a beacon of culture amidst the city‚Äôs often grim landscape. Tonight however it was a crime scene that defied explanation.    As Batman approached he immediately noticed something was off. The police lights seemed dimmer than usual and there was an eerie quiet surrounding the building. Commissioner Gordon met him at the entrance his face pale.    ‚ÄúI‚Äôve never seen anything like this‚Äù Gordon said his voice barely above a whisper. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs‚Ä¶ you have to see it for yourself.‚Äù    They stepped inside and Batman felt a chill that had nothing to do with the night air. The entire museum had been transformed. Every painting every sculpture had been altered to include a twisted grinning face. But it wasn‚Äôt the Joker‚Äôs face ‚Äì it was softer more feminine yet no less terrifying.    And everywhere there was poetry. Lines of verse scrawled across walls floors even across the faces of the altered artworks:    ‚ÄúIn halls of beauty I leave my mark A canvas of chaos a masterpiece dark. Can you solve my riddle oh Dark Knight so grim? Or will Gotham fall to her not to him?‚Äù    Batman‚Äôs eyes narrowed. ‚ÄúHer?‚Äù    Gordon nodded grimly. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs not all. Follow me.‚Äù    They made their way to the center of the museum where a macabre scene awaited them. The security guards and night staff had been arranged in a grotesque tableau their bodies contorted into unnatural poses faces frozen in those horrible forced smiles. But at the center of it all was something that made even Batman‚Äôs blood run cold.    A woman sat in a chair her body relaxed as if merely resting. But her face ‚Äì her face was a mask of pure terror eyes wide and mouth open in a silent scream. And carved into her forehead were two words: ‚ÄúPoetic Justice.‚Äù    ‚ÄúShe‚Äôs alive‚Äù Gordon said softly. ‚ÄúCatatonic but alive. The only survivor we‚Äôve found so far.‚Äù    Batman knelt beside the woman examining her closely. ‚ÄúThis isn‚Äôt random‚Äù he muttered. ‚ÄúShe was chosen specifically. But why?‚Äù    As if in answer a nearby screen flickered to life. The face that appeared was hidden behind a mask ‚Äì white with delicate purple lines tracing a feminine face. Red lips curved into a smile that sent chills down the spines of all who saw it.    ‚ÄúHello Gotham‚Äù the figure purred her voice a melodic contralto. ‚ÄúDid you miss me? Oh wait you didn‚Äôt even know I existed did you? Allow me to introduce myself. You can call me‚Ä¶ Ms. Racey Rhymes.‚Äù    She giggled the sound eerily reminiscent of the Joker‚Äôs infamous laugh yet distinctly her own. ‚ÄúI hope you‚Äôve enjoyed my little exhibitions so far. Consider them my audition for the role of Gotham‚Äôs new maestro of mayhem. The Joker? Oh he‚Äôs so last season. It‚Äôs time for a new act don‚Äôt you think?‚Äù    Her eyes seemed to lock onto the camera and by extension onto Batman himself. ‚ÄúI know you‚Äôre watching Dark Knight. Are you intrigued? Puzzled? Oh I do hope so. Because this is just the overture my dear. The real performance is yet to come.‚Äù    She leaned in close her masked face filling the screen. ‚ÄúCan you hear it Batman? The rhythm of chaos the melody of madness? It‚Äôs coming for Gotham and not even you can stop it. So put on your dancing shoes darling. Because when the music starts we‚Äôre all going to dance.‚Äù    The screen went dark leaving the museum in eerie silence.    Batman stood his mind racing. This was unlike anything he had faced before. A new player had entered the game one who combined the Joker‚Äôs flair for the theatrical with a poetic sensibility that was both beautiful and terrifying.    ‚ÄúCommissioner‚Äù he said his voice low and intense ‚ÄúI need everything you have on this woman. Bank records security footage witness statements ‚Äì anything that might give us a clue to her identity or her next move.‚Äù    Gordon nodded already pulling out his phone to make the necessary calls. ‚ÄúWhat are you thinking Batman? Who is she?‚Äù    Batman‚Äôs gaze swept the room taking in the altered artworks the grotesque tableau of bodies the lone survivor with her terrifying message. ‚ÄúSomeone who‚Äôs been watching Gotham for a long time‚Äù he said grimly. ‚ÄúSomeone with resources intelligence and a deep-seated grudge. This isn‚Äôt just about chaos or money. This is personal.‚Äù    As he turned to leave Batman‚Äôs eyes fell on a small card that had fluttered to the ground. He picked it up turning it over in his gloved hand. It was a business card for Maxwell Pride one of Gotham‚Äôs most prominent ‚Äì and controversial ‚Äì business moguls.    ‚ÄúGet me everything you can on Maxwell Pride‚Äù Batman said tucking the card away. ‚ÄúI have a feeling he‚Äôs connected to this somehow.‚Äù    As he stepped out into the night Batman couldn‚Äôt shake the feeling that Gotham was standing on the precipice of something truly terrifying. Ms. Racey Rhymes was out there plotting her next move and he had a sinking feeling that this was only the beginning of her twisted poem.    The game was afoot and the stakes had never been higher. As he grappled to the rooftops Batman‚Äôs determination solidified into iron resolve. He would solve this riddle unravel this rhyme and bring Ms. Racey Rhymes to justice ‚Äì before Gotham descended into a chaos from which it might never recover.    *****    The warehouse was a study in contrasts. Outside it blended seamlessly into Gotham‚Äôs industrial district a nondescript building among many. Inside however it was a riot of color and chaos that would have made the Joker himself green with envy.    At the center of this maelstrom sat Ms. Racey Rhymes her feet propped up on an antique desk that looked wildly out of place in the warehouse setting. Her toes painted a vivid purple wiggled slightly as she regarded the man standing before her. To her left and right a pair of muscular goons stood at attention their faces painted with grotesque smiles that didn‚Äôt quite reach their eyes.    Ms. Rhymes herself was a vision of calculated madness. Her hair dyed in alternating streaks of green and purple cascaded over her shoulders. She wore a tailored suit that seemed to shift between deep purple and midnight blue depending on how the light hit it. But it was her face that commanded attention ‚Äì pale as moonlight with lips painted a vivid red and eyes that sparkled with equal parts intelligence and insanity.    ‚ÄúSo‚Äù she purred her voice a melody that danced on the edge of reason ‚Äúyou‚Äôre the infamous Revan. I must say you cut quite the imposing figure.‚Äù    The man before her stood silent his face hidden behind a mask that was featureless save for a pair of narrow eye slits. He wore a long dark trench coat that seemed to absorb the light around it. In his hand he held a baseball bat its surface marred by scratches and what looked suspiciously like bloodstains.    Ms. Rhymes leaned forward her eyes glittering. ‚ÄúNot much for conversation are you? That‚Äôs quite alright. I prefer my hired help to be more‚Ä¶ action-oriented.‚Äù    She snapped her fingers and one of her goons stepped forward placing a thick envelope on the desk. ‚ÄúYour advance‚Äù she explained. ‚ÄúHalf now half upon completion. Assuming of course that you‚Äôre up to the task.‚Äù    Revan remained motionless for a moment then reached out and took the envelope. His voice when he finally spoke was a low growl that seemed to emanate from the depths of his mask. ‚ÄúThe task?‚Äù    Ms. Rhymes‚Äô smile widened becoming something feral and dangerous. ‚ÄúWhy bringing me the Batman of course. Alive mind you. I have‚Ä¶ plans for our dear Dark Knight.‚Äù    She stood moving around the desk with a grace that belied the madness in her eyes. ‚ÄúYou see Revan I‚Äôm writing an epic. A poem that will shake Gotham to its very foundations. And Batman? He‚Äôs to be my unwitting co-author.‚Äù    Revan‚Äôs grip tightened on his bat. ‚ÄúBatman has bested many. What makes you think I can succeed where others have failed?‚Äù    Ms. Rhymes laughed the sound echoing off the warehouse walls like broken glass. ‚ÄúOh my dear Revan. That‚Äôs precisely why I chose you. You‚Äôre not like the others are you? No you‚Äôre something‚Ä¶ special.‚Äù    She circled him her bare feet silent on the concrete floor. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve heard the whispers you know. They say you‚Äôre more than just a man. That you‚Äôre something‚Ä¶ darker. A force of nature barely contained in human form.‚Äù    Revan remained still but there was a tension in his posture that suggested coiled power ready to be unleashed. ‚ÄúAnd if the whispers are true?‚Äù    ‚ÄúThen you‚Äôre exactly what I need‚Äù Ms. Rhymes said clapping her hands together in delight. ‚ÄúYou see Batman thinks he understands chaos. He believes he‚Äôs seen the depths of madness in his rogues‚Äô gallery. But you and I? We‚Äôre going to show him what true chaos looks like.‚Äù    She returned to her desk pulling out a folder and tossing it to Revan. ‚ÄúEverything we know about the Bat. His patterns his weaknesses the places he frequents. Use it ignore it it matters not to me. All that matters is the result.‚Äù    Revan flipped through the folder his masked face revealing nothing. ‚ÄúAnd when I bring him to you?‚Äù    Ms. Rhymes‚Äô smile was all teeth. ‚ÄúThen my dear Revan the real fun begins. You see I have a little‚Ä¶ gift for our caped crusader. A concoction of my own design that‚Äôs going to open his eyes to a whole new world of possibility.‚Äù    She leaned in close her voice dropping to a conspiratorial whisper. ‚ÄúImagine it. Batman the stoic defender of Gotham reduced to a laughing giggling mess. And then just when he thinks he‚Äôs lost everything we‚Äôll rebuild him. In our image.‚Äù    Revan closed the folder. ‚ÄúYou seek to break Batman.‚Äù    ‚ÄúBreak him?‚Äù Ms. Rhymes laughed. ‚ÄúOh no my dear. I seek to remake him. To show Gotham that even its greatest hero can fall. And in doing so to prove that chaos is the only true constant in this mad mad world.‚Äù    She extended her hand. ‚ÄúSo do we have a deal?‚Äù    Revan regarded her for a long moment then grasped her hand in his gloved one. ‚ÄúWe have a deal.‚Äù    As Revan turned to leave Ms. Rhymes called out ‚ÄúOh and Revan? Do try to have fun with it. After all what‚Äôs the point of chaos if you can‚Äôt enjoy the show?‚Äù    The door closed behind Revan leaving Ms. Rhymes alone with her goons. She turned to them her smile never wavering. ‚ÄúBoys I think it‚Äôs time we prepared for our guest. After all we want Batman to feel right at home when he arrives.‚Äù    * * *     Across town in a penthouse apartment that screamed of old money and refined taste two women stood before a wall covered in newspaper clippings photographs and handwritten notes. Hannah Pride her blonde hair pulled back in a severe bun traced a line between two photos with a manicured finger.    ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs a pattern here Sarah‚Äù she murmured. ‚ÄúThese aren‚Äôt random attacks. She‚Äôs building to something.‚Äù    Sarah Lawson her dark skin a stark contrast to Hannah‚Äôs paleness leaned in close her breath warm on Hannah‚Äôs neck. ‚ÄúYour father‚Äôs company. It‚Äôs at the center of all this.‚Äù    Hannah turned her blue eyes meeting Sarah‚Äôs brown ones. ‚ÄúI know. And that‚Äôs what worries me. If she‚Äôs targeting Pride Enterprises‚Ä¶‚Äù    ‚ÄúThen your father is in danger‚Äù Sarah finished. She placed a comforting hand on Hannah‚Äôs shoulder. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôll stop her Han. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre here.‚Äù    Hannah‚Äôs lips quirked in a small smile. ‚ÄúRemind me again why we‚Äôre doing this ourselves instead of letting the police handle it?‚Äù    Sarah‚Äôs expression darkened. ‚ÄúBecause the police in this city are either corrupt or incompetent. And because‚Ä¶‚Äù She hesitated.    ‚ÄúBecause it‚Äôs personal‚Äù Hannah said softly. She reached up cupping Sarah‚Äôs face in her hand. ‚ÄúI know love. I haven‚Äôt forgotten what she did to your sister.‚Äù    Sarah leaned into the touch her eyes closing briefly. ‚ÄúSometimes I think you‚Äôre the only thing keeping me sane through all this.‚Äù    Hannah leaned in pressing a gentle kiss to Sarah‚Äôs lips. ‚ÄúThen I‚Äôll just have to stick around won‚Äôt I?‚Äù    Their moment was interrupted by the sound of Hannah‚Äôs phone ringing. She pulled away reluctantly fishing the device out of her pocket. Her eyes widened as she saw the caller ID.    ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs my father‚Äù she said a note of surprise in her voice. She answered the call putting it on speaker. ‚ÄúDad? Is everything alright?‚Äù    Maxwell Pride‚Äôs voice crackled through the speaker tense and strained. ‚ÄúHannah where are you? Are you safe?‚Äù    Hannah and Sarah exchanged worried glances. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre at the apartment Dad. What‚Äôs going on?‚Äù    ‚ÄúListen to me very carefully‚Äù Maxwell said his words coming in a rush. ‚ÄúYou need to leave Gotham. Now. Take Sarah and go somewhere safe. Don‚Äôt tell anyone where you‚Äôre going not even me.‚Äù    ‚ÄúDad you‚Äôre scaring me‚Äù Hannah said her voice rising. ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs happening?‚Äù    There was a pause filled only with the sound of Maxwell‚Äôs heavy breathing. ‚ÄúShe‚Äôs coming for me Hannah. Ms. Racey Rhymes. I‚Ä¶ I think I know who she is. And if I‚Äôm right then none of us are safe.‚Äù    Sarah leaned in close to the phone. ‚ÄúMr. Pride we can help. Hannah and I we‚Äôve been investigating‚Äî‚Äù    ‚ÄúNo!‚Äù Maxwell‚Äôs shout was sharp enough to make both women flinch. ‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt get involved in this. It‚Äôs too dangerous. Please just‚Ä¶ just go. I‚Äôll contact you when it‚Äôs safe.‚Äù    The line went dead leaving Hannah and Sarah staring at each other in stunned silence.    ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre not leaving‚Äù Sarah said after a moment her jaw set in determination.    Hannah nodded already moving towards their equipment. ‚ÄúNo we‚Äôre not. But we are going to find out what the hell is going on.‚Äù    As they prepared to head out into the Gotham night neither woman noticed the small drone hovering outside their window its camera lens glinting in the moonlight.    * * *     In the Batcave Bruce Wayne stood before his computer array cowl pushed back as he pored over the information displayed on the screens. Alfred approached a tray of coffee in his hands.    ‚ÄúAny progress Master Bruce?‚Äù the butler asked setting the tray down.    Bruce ran a hand through his hair frustration evident in every line of his body. ‚ÄúSome but not enough. I‚Äôve managed to trace the chemical components of Ms. Rhymes‚Äô new toxin to a few possible sources but nothing concrete yet.‚Äù    He pulled up an image on the main screen ‚Äì a molecular diagram of the toxin. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs brilliant in a terrifying way. She‚Äôs somehow managed to combine elements of Joker venom with a cocktail of other psychoactive compounds. The result is a toxin that doesn‚Äôt just force its victims to laugh ‚Äì it rewires their entire neural pathways.‚Äù    Alfred leaned in his brow furrowed. ‚ÄúGood heavens. You mean to say this toxin actually changes the way the brain functions?‚Äù    Bruce nodded grimly. ‚ÄúExactly. It‚Äôs not just about inducing euphoria or causing muscle spasms. This toxin fundamentally alters the victim‚Äôs perception of reality. In essence it forces them to see the world through the lens of Ms. Rhymes‚Äô particular brand of madness.‚Äù    ‚ÄúA frightening prospect indeed‚Äù Alfred murmured. ‚ÄúAnd what of the connection to Maxwell Pride?‚Äù    Bruce pulled up another screen this one showing a complex web of financial transactions. ‚ÄúPride Enterprises has its fingers in a lot of pies Alfred. Pharmaceuticals chemical research even some experimental psychology studies. Any one of these could be the link we‚Äôre looking for.‚Äù    He zoomed in on one particular node in the web. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs something else. About five years ago Pride Enterprises funded a series of poetry workshops for ‚Äòat-risk youth‚Äô. It was a pet project of Maxwell‚Äôs wife Elizabeth.‚Äù    Alfred raised an eyebrow. ‚ÄúYou suspect our Ms. Rhymes might have been a participant in these workshops?‚Äù    ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a possibility‚Äù Bruce said. ‚ÄúBut there‚Äôs more. Three years ago Elizabeth Pride died under mysterious circumstances. The official report says it was an accident but‚Ä¶‚Äù    ‚ÄúBut you suspect foul play‚Äù Alfred finished.    Bruce nodded. ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt shake the feeling that Elizabeth‚Äôs death is somehow connected to all this. The timing the way Ms. Rhymes seems to have a personal vendetta against Pride Enterprises ‚Äì it all fits.‚Äù    The computer beeped signaling an incoming transmission. Bruce quickly pulled his cowl back on as Commissioner Gordon‚Äôs face appeared on the screen.    ‚ÄúBatman we‚Äôve got a situation‚Äù Gordon said without preamble. ‚ÄúMaxwell Pride just reached out to us. Says he‚Äôs got information on our mysterious Ms. Rhymes. He‚Äôs requesting protection.‚Äù    Batman‚Äôs eyes narrowed. ‚ÄúWhere is he now?‚Äù    ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs the thing‚Äù Gordon said his voice tight with concern. ‚ÄúHe was supposed to meet us at GCPD headquarters twenty minutes ago. He never showed.‚Äù    Batman was already moving towards the Batmobile. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm on it Commissioner. Send me everything you have on Pride‚Äôs last known whereabouts.‚Äù    As the vehicle roared to life Bruce couldn‚Äôt shake the feeling that they were rapidly approaching a tipping point. Ms. Racey Rhymes had made her opening moves and now the game was escalating. And somewhere out there Maxwell Pride held pieces of the puzzle that could blow this whole case wide open.    The Batmobile tore out of the cave and into the Gotham night. The hunt was on and Batman knew that every second counted. Because in this deadly game of poetry and madness the next rhyme could very well be Gotham‚Äôs last.    ****    The Gotham night was thick with tension as Batman raced through the streets his mind working overtime to piece together the puzzle of Ms. Racey Rhymes and her connection to Maxwell Pride. The Batmobile‚Äôs engine roared a counterpoint to the eerie silence that had fallen over the city.    Suddenly a dark figure stepped out into the street directly in the Batmobile‚Äôs path. Batman slammed on the brakes the vehicle screeching to a halt mere inches from the imposing silhouette.    As Batman emerged from the Batmobile he found himself face to face with Revan. The masked hitman stood motionless his baseball bat held loosely at his side.    ‚ÄúSo‚Äù Batman growled ‚Äúyou‚Äôre the new player in town.‚Äù    Revan‚Äôs voice was a low rumble. ‚ÄúAnd you‚Äôre the one they call the Dark Knight. I‚Äôve been waiting for you.‚Äù    Without warning Revan lunged forward his bat whistling through the air. Batman barely had time to dodge the weapon grazing his cowl as he rolled to the side.    ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt have time for this‚Äù Batman snarled rising to his feet. ‚ÄúWhere‚Äôs Maxwell Pride?‚Äù    Revan chuckled a sound devoid of humor. ‚ÄúAlways so focused on the mission aren‚Äôt you? But tell me Batman when was the last time you faced a true challenge?‚Äù    The two circled each other tension crackling in the air between them. Batman‚Äôs eyes narrowed behind his cowl. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre working for Ms. Rhymes. Why?‚Äù    ‚ÄúWhy does anyone do anything in this city?‚Äù Revan replied twirling his bat with deadly grace. ‚ÄúFor the thrill of the game.‚Äù    With that he attacked again his movements a blur of speed and precision. Batman found himself on the defensive blocking and parrying blows that came with frightening force. It quickly became clear that Revan was no ordinary thug ‚Äì his fighting style was a mix of various martial arts executed with a samurai-like discipline.    As they fought the battle moved through the streets of Gotham each combatant using the urban landscape to their advantage. Batman grappled to a nearby rooftop hoping to gain the high ground but Revan was right behind him scaling the building with inhuman agility.    ‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt run from chaos Batman‚Äù Revan called out his voice carrying over the sound of their combat. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs coming for Gotham whether you‚Äôre ready or not.‚Äù    Batman gritted his teeth launching a flurry of batarangs that Revan deflected with ease. ‚ÄúChaos is just another word for fear‚Äù he retorted. ‚ÄúAnd I don‚Äôt scare easily.‚Äù    Their battle continued across the Gotham skyline a deadly dance of shadows and skill. For every move Batman made Revan seemed to have a counter. It was like fighting a dark mirror of himself and for the first time in a long while Batman felt a flicker of doubt.    Meanwhile across town the Gotham City Police Department headquarters was a hive of activity. Commissioner Gordon stood in the center of the chaos barking orders and trying to coordinate the search for Maxwell Pride.    ‚ÄúI want every available unit out there!‚Äù he shouted. ‚ÄúPride is our key to unraveling this whole mess and I‚Äôll be damned if we lose him now!‚Äù    Suddenly the lights in the station flickered and died plunging the building into darkness. A moment later emergency generators kicked in bathing everything in an eerie red glow.    ‚ÄúWhat the hell?‚Äù Gordon muttered reaching for his gun.    The answer came in the form of a melodic laugh that seemed to emanate from everywhere at once. ‚ÄúOh Commissioner‚Äù Ms. Racey Rhymes‚Äô voice purred over the station‚Äôs PA system. ‚ÄúDid you really think your little fortress could keep me out?‚Äù    Before anyone could react the windows exploded inward showering the room with glass. Smoke grenades rolled across the floor filling the air with thick purplish smoke. As officers coughed and stumbled shadowy figures moved through the haze ‚Äì Ms. Rhymes‚Äô goons their painted smiles visible even through the smoke.    ‚ÄúLadies and gentlemen of Gotham‚Äôs finest‚Äù Ms. Rhymes‚Äô voice rang out again tinged with manic glee. ‚ÄúWelcome to the next act of our little drama. I do hope you‚Äôre ready for a show-stopping performance!‚Äù    Outside the police station Hannah and Sarah arrived just in time to see the chaos unfolding. They exchanged a determined look before pulling on their own masks ‚Äì simple domino masks that concealed their identities without hampering their vision.    ‚ÄúReady?‚Äù Hannah asked her voice tight with tension.    Sarah nodded pulling out a pair of escrima sticks. ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs show these clowns what real justice looks like.‚Äù    Back across town Batman and Revan‚Äôs battle had reached a fever pitch. Both combatants were showing signs of fatigue but neither was willing to give an inch. They stood on opposite ends of a rooftop each assessing the other with newfound respect.    ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre good‚Äù Batman admitted his breath coming in ragged gasps. ‚ÄúBut this ends now. I won‚Äôt let Gotham fall to madness.‚Äù    Revan tilted his head his mask betraying no emotion. ‚ÄúWho said anything about letting Gotham fall? This isn‚Äôt about destruction Batman. It‚Äôs about transformation.‚Äù    Before Batman could respond a new voice cut through the night. ‚ÄúWell done Revan darling. You‚Äôve played your part beautifully.‚Äù    Both men turned to see Ms. Racey Rhymes standing on a nearby rooftop flanked by her grinning goons. She held a sleek high-tech rifle in her hands aimed squarely at Batman.    ‚ÄúWhat is this?‚Äù Revan demanded a note of anger creeping into his voice.    Ms. Rhymes laughed the sound sending chills down Batman‚Äôs spine. ‚ÄúOh my dear Revan. Did you really think I‚Äôd entrust the capture of the Bat to anyone but myself? You were the distraction darling. The opening act to my grand finale.‚Äù    With that she fired. Batman still reeling from his battle with Revan couldn‚Äôt dodge in time. The dart struck him in the shoulder and almost immediately he felt his limbs growing heavy.    ‚ÄúNo!‚Äù Revan shouted moving to intercept but it was too late. Batman stumbled fighting against the potent tranquilizer coursing through his system.    As darkness closed in around him the last thing Batman saw was Ms. Rhymes‚Äô triumphant smile and Revan‚Äôs clenched fists.    At the police station the battle was in full swing. Hannah and Sarah had managed to fight their way inside their skills a match for Ms. Rhymes‚Äô thugs. They moved in perfect sync covering each other‚Äôs blind spots and taking down goon after goon.    ‚ÄúWe need to find Gordon!‚Äù Sarah shouted over the chaos.    Hannah nodded ducking under a wild swing from one of the attackers. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôll be in the thick of it. Come on!‚Äù    They fought their way deeper into the station the air thick with smoke and the sound of combat. Finally they spotted Commissioner Gordon back-to-back with a handful of officers holding off a group of Ms. Rhymes‚Äô more heavily armed thugs.    ‚ÄúCommissioner!‚Äù Hannah called out. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre here to help!‚Äù    Gordon‚Äôs eyes widened as he saw the masked women cutting through the chaos. ‚ÄúWho the hell are you?‚Äù    ‚ÄúFriends‚Äù Sarah replied simply her escrima sticks a blur as she took down two attackers in quick succession.    With Hannah and Sarah‚Äôs help the tide began to turn. Ms. Rhymes‚Äô goons facing unexpected resistance began to fall back.    Suddenly Ms. Rhymes‚Äô voice crackled over the PA system once more. ‚ÄúWell well well. It seems our little party has some uninvited guests. How delightfully chaotic! But I‚Äôm afraid I must cut this performance short. I have a very important date with a certain Bat you see.‚Äù    The remaining thugs began a coordinated retreat covering their exit with more smoke grenades. As the air cleared Gordon Hannah and Sarah found themselves standing in the wreckage of the police station.    ‚ÄúThey‚Äôre getting away!‚Äù Sarah growled moving towards the exit.    But Hannah grabbed her arm holding her back. ‚ÄúWait. Listen.‚Äù    In the distance they could hear the wail of approaching sirens. ‚ÄúBackup‚Äù Gordon said a note of relief in his voice. ‚ÄúAbout damn time.‚Äù    Hannah turned to the Commissioner. ‚ÄúWe need to go after Ms. Rhymes. She said something about Batman ‚Äì I think he might be in trouble.‚Äù    Gordon hesitated for a moment then nodded. ‚ÄúGo. I‚Äôll coordinate things here and join you as soon as I can. But be careful ‚Äì this woman is more dangerous than anyone we‚Äôve faced before.‚Äù    As Hannah and Sarah raced out into the night following the trail of Ms. Rhymes‚Äô retreat a new player entered the scene. Revan his posture radiating barely contained fury landed on a nearby rooftop.    ‚ÄúYou‚Äù he growled spotting Hannah and Sarah. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre after Rhymes.‚Äù    The two women tensed ready for another fight but Revan held up a hand. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not here to stop you. Rhymes‚Ä¶ she betrayed the code. Used me as a pawn in her game. That cannot stand.‚Äù    Sarah‚Äôs eyes narrowed behind her mask. ‚ÄúWhy should we trust you?‚Äù    ‚ÄúBecause right now I‚Äôm your best chance at finding Batman before it‚Äôs too late‚Äù Revan replied. ‚ÄúRhymes has him and whatever she‚Äôs planning it won‚Äôt be pleasant.‚Äù    Hannah and Sarah exchanged a look years of partnership allowing them to communicate without words. Finally Hannah nodded. ‚ÄúAlright. But one wrong move and you‚Äôll regret it.‚Äù    Revan inclined his head in acknowledgment. ‚ÄúUnderstood. Now come ‚Äì we have a Bat to save and a poet to silence.‚Äù    As the unlikely trio set off in pursuit of Ms. Racey Rhymes the Gotham night seemed to hold its breath. The game had changed alliances shifted and the fate of the city hung in the balance.    In a hidden location deep in the bowels of Gotham Batman slowly regained consciousness. He found himself strapped to a chair his utility belt gone surrounded by an array of strange machinery. And there perched on a ornate throne-like chair sat Ms. Racey Rhymes her eyes gleaming with manic glee.    ‚ÄúWelcome back to the land of the living my dear Dark Knight‚Äù she purred. ‚ÄúOh the poem we‚Äôre going to write together‚Ä¶ it will be a masterpiece that will reshape Gotham forever.‚Äù    As Batman struggled against his bonds he realized with growing dread that this was only the beginning of Ms. Racey Rhymes‚Äô twisted performance. The real show it seemed was about to begin.

Extra easy to wake her up : Just breathe in her vicinity even if it‚Äôs in the other room.  Damian - Falls asleep with his eyes open. However long he‚Äôd slept - be it six hours or 50 minutes - he‚Äôd be awake at dawn.  Duke - Moves a lot in his sleep. He fell from the bed so many times Alfred had to add extra cushions on the floor. It takes one tap on the shoulder to wake him up.  Tim - Takes power naps throughout the day. Secretly needs to get tucked in and kissed on the forehead to really fall asleep but he‚Äôd rather die than admit it.  Steph - Has a whole nighttime routine before falling asleep. Use of water necessary to wake her up.  Dick - Always wakes up in a contorted position. You‚Äôd think he moved a lot during his sleep but nah he fell asleep like that. Looks flawless when waking up it‚Äôs blinding.  Jason - Counts Joker‚Äôs decapitated heads jumping up fences to help him sleep. When he‚Äôs deep asleep it‚Äôd take a bomb going off right next to his ear to wake him up.  Bruce - To really fall asleep he needs his satin pajamas otherwise be sure that his eyes are just closed. When actually asleep he does this mom thing where when you try to wake him up he suddenly jumps up ‚ÄúHm ?! Whazz that ?! Whazz going on ?!‚Äù  Alfred - Doesn‚Äôt do sleep.

post_body: I‚Äôve seen a lot of posts about the Waynes being the dc equivalent of the Kardashians and while I can see that I think it‚Äôs very important to remember the reason we all know so much about the kardashians is because they have a reality tv show about them that‚Äôs been running for like ten years or something.   I feel like with the lack of a reality show most of America and maybe beyond would know Brucie Wayne and that he has a lot of kids. Maybe some people would call them the Gotham Version of the Kardashians but maybe most people wouldn‚Äôt know a lot about the kids (names faces how many of them there are etc.) because other than maybe Dick and Tim I don‚Äôt see any of them doing something that anyone outside of Gotham would care to report on (they don‚Äôt leave Gotham publicly often and people outside Gotham don‚Äôt want to think about what goes on in that hellhole).  Inside of Gotham however is an entirely different story. Inside Gotham everyone can name the Waynes and point them out on sight even Steph gets recognized sometimes though less than the officially adopted kids. Inside Gotham there‚Äôs an article for literally everything they do even if some of them try so incredibly hard to be private people (and they kinda succeed but Gotham thinks they don‚Äôt). Every paper in Gotham has some mention of them even if it‚Äôs just a name drop because they are just so involved in the city and there are just so many of them. Most people have seen a Wayne in person if not personally interacted with them. Unlike other cities with their rich people Gotham loves them. They defend their rich people and they Gatekeep the hell out of them.  Thank you for coming to my dc talk

post_body: I‚Äôm seeing a lot of cryptid!batman/assumed to be cryptid!batman lately but now I‚Äôm just thinking about someone other than Batman being a cryptid and he thinks They‚Äôre Just Like That TM for one reason of another.  Like the al Ghuls are actually ghouls just to the left of human. (I headcanon the Adams family as ghouls so if you see Adams family themes its because they‚Äôre who I base my idea of ghouls on) Also I head canon that ghouls can‚Äôt physically hurt or be hurt by the people they love that‚Äôs why they feel so comfortable with things like throwing knives at loved ones and adding poison to one another‚Äôs food. It can even be seen as an act of love and affection.  Ras and Talia have a good relationship in their own way but from an outside perspective it looks like they‚Äôre actively trying to kill each other. Bruce knows that they ‚Äòfight‚Äô constantly throwing knives at each other in greeting and when they‚Äôre back is turned sneaking poison into each other‚Äôs food calling each other monstrous names. He just assumes that Ras and Talia are testing each other‚Äôs vigilance in a thinly veiled attempt to kill each other. They are assassins after all.  Any time it Bruce questions why she does the things she does she answers something along the lines: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm a ghoul this is what we do.‚Äù but what Bruce hears is ‚ÄúI‚Äôm al Ghul this is what we do.‚Äù and it reinforces his assumptions that this is a raised-as-an-assassins thing.  ‚Äî‚Äì  Talia: *info-dumping about where major arteries are located and sharing her 'studies‚Äô of all the ways she can paralyze someone*  Bruce to himself: Either she‚Äôs threatening me or this is the only way she know how to make conversation because of the way she was raised‚Ä¶Hmm.  He is seduced either way.  ‚Äî‚Äì  Eventually Bruce leaves to Gotham and becomes Batman and Talia doesn‚Äôt tell him about Damian.  Bruce was never really able to understand her ghoulish needs always insisting that she could leave the League and ‚Äúdo better.‚Äù That‚Äôs how their relationship inevitably came to an end with him trying to humanize her (ugh). She knew that Bruce wouldn‚Äôt change just because she was pregnant and she knew her son would have ghoulish needs that couldn‚Äôt be compromised just because Bruce was uncomfortable.  So she decided to keep Damian to her herself until he‚Äôs old enough to know what it means to be a ghoul and shows that he wants to meet his father.

Has anybody written the fic of Jason getting his throat cut by Bruce in ‚ÄúUtRH‚Äù then having a moment of true clarity in his second(?) death(?) and deciding ‚Äúfuck this‚Äù?  He tells Talia that Bruce isn‚Äôt the person they thought he was and if either of them are going to be saved they have to do it for themselves. He takes off for the West Coast.   I‚Äôm gonna be selfish and say he settles in Portland with the intent of going back to school. This is the Batman-ified version of Portland though or maybe just the Portland envisioned in conservative media: lawless violent on fire all the time. (Reality check: lol.) The guy can‚Äôt help himself and pretty soon he‚Äôs beating the shit out of Proud Boys downtown. No reason he can‚Äôt smash some fash AND get his GED.   Flash forward a few years and by day he‚Äôs attending Reed College with its rolling lawns nature trails and liberal arts; by night he‚Äôs gotten involved with the local mutual aid network. He‚Äôs got a ponytail and an undercut one full sleeve tattoo and the start of another multiple facial piercings and a Subaru. He‚Äôs joined a polycule ‚Äî nothing serious just some people who are kind with their bodies and have taught him to be the same. He buys secondhand and recycles. He works in the community garden. And if a few Proud Boys have gone missing then no one misses them right? Portland is small enough to be overlooked but big enough to disappear into. He‚Äôs in his lane moisturized thriving.  Then Talia shows up with Damian in tow. Because it makes absolutely no sense for her to send Damian to Bruce in the first place unless she somehow didn‚Äôt know that Bruce slit Jason‚Äôs throat OR she somehow didn‚Äôt give a shit. Why on Earth would she trust Bruce to care for Damian after he‚Äôs already killed one son? No. She gives Damian to Jason.  Has anyone written a fic like this very specific one? Lolol

post_body: batfam in random situations part 1 (?): airport i‚Äôm so deep into batfam brainrot its kind of terrifying. so. uh. yeah. here is what i think they‚Äôre all like on a vacation that requires flight. for all intents and purposes this is a commercial airline lets pretend the private jet that bruce so totally owns is out of commission. apologies if these are not accurate to their characters i‚Äôm just having fun lol  for starters i definitely think bruce is that parent who‚Äôs super anal about getting to the airport on time like the flight leaves at 8:30 bruce wants to get up at 2:30 and wake everyone else up with him he‚Äôs got checklists for every kid cause every kid is different i think this house looks like chaos - like think home alone when the mcallisters‚Äô power goes out and they wake up late except the fam is just like that i‚Äôd like to think duke is the most prepared out of all of them - he‚Äôs got his suitcase his carryon and the comfiest yet cutest airport clothes (cause you know the hot airport people you‚Äôre only ever gonna see once? duke dresses to be one of those people) duke is getting dragged into the chaos though - one minute he‚Äôs sitting watching some avatar: the last airbender next he‚Äôs being bombarded by dick asking if he‚Äôs gonna ge arrested for bringing shampoo thats only a little over 8 ounces (its like 8.00001)  ‚Äúno damian. you can‚Äôt bring alfred with you to france. ESPECIALLY not batcow!‚Äù  tim was supposed to pack last night. and he was going to honest! but then the drug case he‚Äôd been tracking picked up some heat again and the time got away from him. so he ropes cass into helping him pack efficiently. she only agrees if he lets her have the window seat.  i feel like out of all of them jason is not a flying kind of guy? like a part of me is really getting the vibe that jason hates to fly so he‚Äôs always gotta have some dramamine on him. that and some noise-canceling headphones.  window seat fans: dick tim cass steph aisle seaters: bruce jason duke damian middle seaters (not by choice): tim and on occasion bruce tim has never ONCE gotten a window seat when they fly steph‚Äôs carryon is JAMPACKED with everything you could ever need. first aid secret snacks etc. she‚Äôs surprised it even fit with her.  dick always brings a double headphone adapter so he forces whatever sibling he‚Äôs seated besides (usually tim) to watch his airplane movie of choice: crazy rich asians unrelated but do you think to keep up appearances bruce joined the mile high club? i think so but anyway back to our regularly scheduled program there are more pictures of damian watching a movie on his green-cased tablet with big headphones than he would like there to be. most of these pictures exist on dick‚Äôs phone.  it‚Äôs a struggle to get tim to sleep at home but on flights? he sleeps like a mf‚Äôin baby. especially when it‚Äôs a night flight so the cabin is dark and comfortable with those pretty lights. yeah goodnight tim drake.  steph is not afraid to get up in an annoying kid‚Äôs face if he‚Äôs kicking her seat. she‚Äôll fight.  one thing about duke? he‚Äôs gonna fuck up some in-flight snacks. sometimes he won‚Äôt even eat them on the flight he‚Äôll just buy a few bags of the peanuts and collect them as a snack for vacation. they work well for him if they go on walking tours that last all day  more pictures on dick‚Äôs phone that said subject wish didn‚Äôt exist: photos of jason conked out on bruce‚Äôs shoulder and he is most definitely drooling dick HATES airplane bathrooms. he‚Äôd rather piss himself than relieve himself in one of those.  cass‚Äôs airplane playlist is fire. she even looks cool listening to it.  damian CANNOT be seated behind tim; thats just a recipe for a no-no. he WILL kick the seat and there WILL be blood. no exceptions.  i skipped ahead to the actual flight and not the airport whoopsies let‚Äôs go over that below dick always gets nervous going through bag check - he‚Äôs always FINE but he worries that somehow he‚Äôs got something he shouldn‚Äôt in his bag (this is something i do i KNOW i don‚Äôt have anything i shouldnt but what if 20 kilos of cocaine suddenly just appeared in my suitcase?)  tim has definitely had airport sushi like that snl skit. didn‚Äôt end well.  remember how i said duke was one of those hot people you see at the airport that you never see again? cass is also one of those people. they are just a cool duo and the paparazzi pictures are lowkey an aesthetic bruce does a roll call at least seven times. it‚Äôs necessary since they have left a kid at home before (it was tim. he was salty about it for at least a month and guilt tripped everyone into doing what he pleased because of it) to pass the time before they board steph and jason play cards. their favorites are war and speed.  jason plays wait for me (reprise) in his headphones everytime he walks on one of those horizontal escalator thingys dick and steph like to impersonate the flight attendants when they do that safety walkthrough the kids all race each other down that long hallway before they board  unless he goes with them alfred‚Äôs vacation usually begins when bruce texts him that they‚Äôve landed and are on the way to the hotel (which opens the door for other shenanigans i might do a part 2 after all)  okay i think thats all i have i think other scenarios i‚Äôd like to do are these:  batfam at a hotel batfam going grocery shopping batfam at a wayne gala batfam on vacation there are probably more but who knows. for all i know i‚Äôll never do another one of these again.

He‚Äôs joined a polycule ‚Äî nothing serious just some people who are kind with their bodies and have taught him to be the same. He buys secondhand and recycles. He works in the community garden. And if a few Proud Boys have gone missing then no one misses them right? Portland is small enough to be overlooked but big enough to disappear into. He‚Äôs in his lane moisturized thriving.  Then Talia shows up with Damian in tow. Because it makes absolutely no sense for her to send Damian to Bruce in the first place unless she somehow didn‚Äôt know that Bruce slit Jason‚Äôs throat OR she somehow didn‚Äôt give a shit. Why on Earth would she trust Bruce to care for Damian after he‚Äôs already killed one son? No. She gives Damian to Jason.  Has anyone written a fic like this very specific one? Lolol

Batman strikes back!
Bane breaks the Bat

He‚Äôs a big guy‚Ä¶ for you. It‚Äôs finally here. At long last. For years I‚Äôve waited for that ideal Bane. My favorite Batman villain favorite Batman character favorite DC character period. Everything before this has been based on designs I hate too damn big or really outdated. Or broken in the case of the last MAFEX Bane I owned based on his appearance in The Dark Knight Rises. Still that‚Äôs movie based. I wanted something that was based on the comics or close enough. Unfortunately most Bane designs outside the comics deviate in ways I can‚Äôt stand like giving him an open mouth/nose mask. I was left without many options.  All that preamble to say: I‚Äôve been waiting for this one. I love Bane a lot and I love this figure a lot. It‚Äôs not perfect. The paint is sloppy in some areas especially the hands. Mine actually came with two right open hands! That stings. Still he comes with so many options that I don‚Äôt find myself missing that so much. Also HLJ had my back there and I‚Äôll be getting a replacement woooo.  Everything else though? Golden. Scale sculpt and articulation are all there. He even came with two face options. Both are good but gimme that angular eyed ANGRY look anytime. Pure Knightfall-based goodness. Osito not included btw I stole that from a FvJ Jason figure.  Now that I have a great Bane I‚Äôm more open to really getting a solid Batman collection going. I‚Äôm not the biggest DC fan so I‚Äôm not out to build a whole universe but I do like Batman. Also for any companies listening I‚Äôd be totally down for some good Teen Titans figures too. Those are my two corners of the DCU.

post_body: Weird things I‚Äôm thinking about at 3am again  You know I‚Äôm aware that Batman and at least some of the Batfam have the mental fortitude to shake off types of brainwashing/drug induced hallucinations.  -> off the top of my head I know both Bruce and Jason have overcome fear toxin and I know Dick basically made a telepath cry cuz mental training  But with all the crap that happens in Gotham and the fact it is canonically cursed it does surprise me they don‚Äôt have wards against supernatural possession (at least to my knowledge). While we don‚Äôt tend to see too much in the way of the supernatural in the main Batman comics we do know Gotham is a city who has a spirit from one of the Hellblazer comics.  Like my brain is telling me that it wouldn‚Äôt be surprising for Gotham to try to manipulate her heroes. Or stronger ghosts trying to possess or at least influence the vigilantes in hopes of getting avenged. Or evil spirits/demons openly trying to possess those in the city.  And it as a result I could see the vigilantes of the cities carrying a ward with them or painting it on their skin for protection.  Look I know Bruce seems to naturally intimidate a lot of supernatural things but they do exist in DC. And with Gotham being Gotham it honestly surprises me the heroes of the city don‚Äôt encounter it more.

While we don‚Äôt tend to see too much in the way of the supernatural in the main Batman comics we do know Gotham is a city who has a spirit from one of the Hellblazer comics.  Like my brain is telling me that it wouldn‚Äôt be surprising for Gotham to try to manipulate her heroes. Or stronger ghosts trying to possess or at least influence the vigilantes in hopes of getting avenged. Or evil spirits/demons openly trying to possess those in the city.  And it as a result I could see the vigilantes of the cities carrying a ward with them or painting it on their skin for protection.  Look I know Bruce seems to naturally intimidate a lot of supernatural things but they do exist in DC. And with Gotham being Gotham it honestly surprises me the heroes of the city don‚Äôt encounter it more.
