post_body: DPxDC More Shit Fae!Danny Has Said While Living With WaynesDick opening his arms wide and going for a hug: hey Danny!  Danny looking him in the eyes without blinking: did you know that centuries ago fae really liked to crawl inside human bodies and use them as nests? I heard human insides are really warm and squishy.  Dick sweating frozen in place: ‚Ä¶no?..   Danny smiling and cheerfully jumping to hug Dick: I didn‚Äôt either!      Jason because he is feeling adventurous today: I have a question. Where do Fae come from?  Danny: Ah so B hadn‚Äôt had the Talk with you yet what a shame. So when a woman and a man love each other very much-  Damian: Enough of your foolish jokes I do not wish to hear the sex talk from you. To answer your question Todd Fae come from the dreams.   Jason deadpan: ‚Ä¶really?  Danny very awkwardly: Um. Dami. Brother to my soul. I‚Äôm so sorry.   Damian: What?  Danny: I told you we come from dreams only because you were four. That‚Äôs not actually how it works. We just fuck.     Duke narrowing his eyes at Danny suspiciously: So for the past week and a half I‚Äôve been having this recurring dream about you eating my brain with a fork like spaghetti. I was wondering is it like a you thing or a me thing?  Danny very offended: Duke! Not every weird thing that happens in this house is my fault! That is very rude of you!   Cass after Duke had apologized profusely and left: You.  Danny rolling his eyes: Yeah okay I did do that. In my defense his fear tastes like the perfect greasy cheeseburger and I have to get my fair share of junk food somehow.  Cass: >:(  Danny: Okay I‚Äôll stop. Eventually.     Bruce in his nth attempt at gaining information from Danny: How do you know if someone is a Fae or not?  Danny: Throw a fish at them.  Bruce: ????  Danny not even looking up from his phone: Fish are scared of the Fae. So if you throw a fish at someone and the fish gets scared they are Fae.  Gotham Rogues a week later: We have no idea why Batman keeps throwing guppies at us but we collectively suspect his new child is to blame.     Danny: Oh I‚Äôm forbidden to enjoy caraoke nights.  Steph who suggested he join: What? Why? Is it some kind of punishment for the pizza incident?  Tim: No it‚Äôs because if he starts singing we all lose our grip on reality.  Damian: And our dignity.  Danny: They mean they start dancing whether they want it or not and I have videos to prove it. Wanna see Jason twerking? Or I have one with Tim and Bruce waltzing through the manor.  Steph as everyone else bemoans their fate: With great pleasure.  |

post_body: DPxDC More Shit Fae!Danny Has Said While Living With WaynesDick opening his arms wide and going for a hug: hey Danny!  Danny looking him in the eyes without blinking: did you know that centuries ago fae really liked to crawl inside human bodies and use them as nests? I heard human insides are really warm and squishy.  Dick sweating frozen in place: ‚Ä¶no?..   Danny smiling and cheerfully jumping to hug Dick: I didn‚Äôt either!      Jason because he is feeling adventurous today: I have a question. Where do Fae come from?  Danny: Ah so B hadn‚Äôt had the Talk with you yet what a shame. So when a woman and a man love each other very much-  Damian: Enough of your foolish jokes I do not wish to hear the sex talk from you. To answer your question Todd Fae come from the dreams.   Jason deadpan: ‚Ä¶really?  Danny very awkwardly: Um. Dami. Brother to my soul. I‚Äôm so sorry.   Damian: What?  Danny: I told you we come from dreams only because you were four. That‚Äôs not actually how it works. We just fuck.     Duke narrowing his eyes at Danny suspiciously: So for the past week and a half I‚Äôve been having this recurring dream about you eating my brain with a fork like spaghetti. I was wondering is it like a you thing or a me thing?  Danny very offended: Duke! Not every weird thing that happens in this house is my fault! That is very rude of you!   Cass after Duke had apologized profusely and left: You.  Danny rolling his eyes: Yeah okay I did do that. In my defense his fear tastes like the perfect greasy cheeseburger and I have to get my fair share of junk food somehow.  Cass: >:(  Danny: Okay I‚Äôll stop. Eventually.     Bruce in his nth attempt at gaining information from Danny: How do you know if someone is a Fae or not?  Danny: Throw a fish at them.  Bruce: ????  Danny not even looking up from his phone: Fish are scared of the Fae. So if you throw a fish at someone and the fish gets scared they are Fae.  Gotham Rogues a week later: We have no idea why Batman keeps throwing guppies at us but we collectively suspect his new child is to blame.     Danny: Oh I‚Äôm forbidden to enjoy caraoke nights.  Steph who suggested he join: What? Why? Is it some kind of punishment for the pizza incident?  Tim: No it‚Äôs because if he starts singing we all lose our grip on reality.  Damian: And our dignity.  Danny: They mean they start dancing whether they want it or not and I have videos to prove it. Wanna see Jason twerking? Or I have one with Tim and Bruce waltzing through the manor.  Steph as everyone else bemoans their fate: With great pleasure.  |

Batman: Shadows Of Madness (Part 2 of the shadows saga) A fan fiction by Ecky **Disclaimer:**     ‚ÄúShadows of Madness‚Äù is a non-commercial fan fiction story created by and for fans of the Batman franchise. This work is not affiliated with endorsed or approved by DC Comics Warner Bros. Entertainment or any other official entities associated with Batman and related characters. All characters such as Batman Joker Penguin Riddler and others from the Batman universe are the property of their respective trademark and copyright holders.     The original characters of Ms. Racey Rhymes The Chimera Revan (Samantha Faith) Hannah and Sarah are creations of the author and any resemblance to actual persons living or dead or other fictional characters is purely coincidental.     This story is intended solely for entertainment purposes and is not for commercial use. No infringement of copyright or trademark is intended.     The Characters:    Batman as himself       The Joker as himself       @raceyrhymes as Ms Rhyme‚Äôs       @solesofwonder as Hannah and Sarah       @samcrosfaith as Samantha Faith aka Revan      And introducing @smallzster as Chimera      The cold sterile room buzzed with an undercurrent of malevolent energy. Batman the Dark Knight of Gotham found himself strapped to a chair his utility belt gone surrounded by an array of ominous machinery. Before him stood Ms. Racey Rhymes her eyes gleaming with a manic intensity that sent chills down his spine.     ‚ÄúWelcome to the grand stage my caped muse‚Äù Ms. Rhymes purred her voice a discordant melody. ‚ÄúAre you ready for your starring role?‚Äù     Batman‚Äôs jaw clenched his eyes narrowing behind his cowl. ‚ÄúWhatever you‚Äôre planning Rhymes it won‚Äôt work. Gotham has faced worse than you.‚Äù     A giggle escaped Ms. Rhymes‚Äô painted lips. ‚ÄúOh my dear Dark Knight you misunderstand. I‚Äôm not here to face Gotham. I‚Äôm here to remake it. And you my brooding bat will be my masterpiece.‚Äù     She snapped her fingers and a figure emerged from the shadows. Tall and lithe with features that seemed to shift between masculine and feminine the newcomer exuded an aura of calculated menace.     ‚ÄúAllow me to introduce my collaborator‚Äù Ms. Rhymes said her voice dripping with false sweetness. ‚ÄúThe Chimera. A true artist of the mind.‚Äù     The Chimera stepped forward their face hidden behind a mask that seemed to morph and change with each passing moment. When they spoke their voice was a disorienting blend of tones and pitches.     ‚ÄúHello Batman. I‚Äôve been looking forward to our session.‚Äù     Batman‚Äôs mind raced trying to place this new threat. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre one of Crane‚Äôs students‚Äù he growled. ‚ÄúI remember the files. You disappeared years ago.‚Äù     The Chimera tilted their head the gesture unnervingly birdlike. ‚ÄúVery good Detective. But Dr. Crane was merely the beginning of my journey. Now I‚Äôm something‚Ä¶ more.‚Äù     Ms. Rhymes clapped her hands together in delight. ‚ÄúEnough chitchat! Let the performance begin!‚Äù     The Chimera moved to a control panel their fingers dancing across the keys. Suddenly a fine mist began to fill the room and Batman felt his senses beginning to blur.     ‚ÄúWhat‚Ä¶ what is this?‚Äù he gasped fighting against the rising tide of disorientation.     ‚ÄúConsider it a cocktail of my own design‚Äù The Chimera replied their voice seeming to come from everywhere at once. ‚ÄúFear toxin mixed with a dash of hallucinogens and a sprinkle of my own special additions. We‚Äôre going to peel back those layers of sanity Batman. One by one.‚Äù     As the mist thickened Batman‚Äôs vision began to swim. The room around him warped and twisted melting away into a nightmarish landscape. The last thing he heard before succumbing to the hallucinations was Ms. Rhymes‚Äô singsong voice:     ‚ÄúIn shadows deep and madness vast  Gotham‚Äôs hero breathes his last.  A mind once strong now torn apart  Welcome Batman to your new start.‚Äù     * * *     Across town in an abandoned warehouse that served as their temporary base Hannah Sarah and their unlikely ally Revan ‚Äì now revealed as Samantha Faith ‚Äì pored over maps and documents.     ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve checked every known hideout‚Äù Hannah said frustration evident in her voice. ‚ÄúWhere could Rhymes be keeping him?‚Äù     Sarah placed a comforting hand on her partner‚Äôs shoulder. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôll find him Han. We have to.‚Äù     Samantha her mask off but still cutting an imposing figure studied the map intently. ‚ÄúRhymes is theatrical. She‚Äôll want a stage for her ‚Äòperformance.‚Äô Somewhere significant.‚Äù     ‚ÄúLike what?‚Äù Sarah asked her brow furrowed.     ‚ÄúWait‚Äù Hannah said her eyes widening. ‚ÄúWhat about Arkham not the new one? The old asylum‚Äôs been abandoned for years. It‚Äôs perfect ‚Äì isolated symbolic‚Ä¶‚Äù     Samantha nodded slowly. ‚ÄúAnd with a history of madness. It fits Rhymes‚Äô MO.‚Äù     As they began to plan their assault on Arkham Sarah couldn‚Äôt help but voice the question that had been nagging at her. ‚ÄúSamantha‚Ä¶ why are you helping us? You were working for Rhymes.‚Äù     Samantha‚Äôs eyes hardened. ‚ÄúI was hired to do a job. To test Batman to challenge him. Not‚Ä¶ this. There‚Äôs no honor in breaking a warrior‚Äôs mind.‚Äù     Hannah studied the woman before her. ‚ÄúAnd the whole Revan persona? The baseball bat?‚Äù     A small smile tugged at Samantha‚Äôs lips. ‚ÄúEvery warrior needs their weapon. And sometimes the best disguise is one that plays into people‚Äôs expectations.‚Äù     As the trio finalized their plans the air was thick with tension. They all knew that time was running out for Batman ‚Äì and for Gotham.     * * *     In the depths of his toxin-induced nightmare Batman found himself in a twisted version of Gotham. The sky above was a sickly green and the buildings seemed to breathe and pulse with malevolent life.     ‚ÄúWell well well‚Äù a familiar voice cackled. ‚ÄúLook who‚Äôs come to play!‚Äù     Batman spun around to find himself face to face with the Joker his grin wider and more manic than ever.     ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre not real‚Äù Batman growled his fists clenching. ‚ÄúThis is all in my head.‚Äù     The Joker‚Äôs laughter echoed off the writhing buildings. ‚ÄúOh Batsy! Don‚Äôt you know? The stuff in our heads is the realest thing there is! Now come on let‚Äôs have some fun!‚Äù     Suddenly Batman was surrounded by a horde of grinning laughing maniacs all wearing the Joker‚Äôs face. As he fought them off each punch seemed to make two more appear.     ‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt win this one Batman‚Äù the Joker taunted. ‚ÄúWhy not join us? Think of the laughs we could have together!‚Äù     Batman gritted his teeth fighting against the rising tide of chaos. ‚ÄúNever‚Äù he snarled. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll never become like you.‚Äù     But even as he said it a small voice in the back of his mind whispered ‚ÄúAre you so sure?‚Äù     * * *     Back in the real world The Chimera monitored Batman‚Äôs vital signs with clinical detachment. ‚ÄúFascinating‚Äù they murmured. ‚ÄúHis mental resilience is truly remarkable.‚Äù     Ms. Rhymes peered at the screens her eyes glittering with malicious glee. ‚ÄúBut he‚Äôs cracking isn‚Äôt he? I can almost hear the fissures forming in that rigid psyche of his.‚Äù     The Chimera nodded slowly. ‚ÄúYes but we must be cautious. Push too hard too fast and his mind might shatter completely. We want to remake him not destroy him utterly.‚Äù     Ms. Rhymes waved a dismissive hand. ‚ÄúDetails details. Just keep pushing my dear Chimera. I want to see what lurks in the deepest darkest corners of the Bat‚Äôs mind.‚Äù     As they spoke neither noticed the small drone hovering outside the window its camera capturing every moment of their sinister collaboration.     * * *     Hannah Sarah and Samantha crouched in the shadows outside the old Arkham Asylum their eyes fixed on the crumbling structure before them.     ‚ÄúI‚Äôm picking up heat signatures on the top floor‚Äù Hannah whispered consulting a handheld device. ‚ÄúLooks like that‚Äôs where they‚Äôre keeping him.‚Äù     Sarah nodded her grip tightening on her escrima sticks. ‚ÄúSo what‚Äôs the plan? We can‚Äôt just burst in there. Who knows what they‚Äôve done to Batman‚Äôs mind by now.‚Äù     Samantha‚Äôs eyes narrowed behind her mask. ‚ÄúWe need a distraction. Something to draw their attention while we extract Batman.‚Äù     Hannah‚Äôs lips curled into a grim smile. ‚ÄúI think I have just the thing. But you‚Äôre not going to like it.‚Äù     As she outlined her plan Sarah and Samantha exchanged worried glances. It was risky borderline insane. But then again in a city like Gotham sometimes insanity was the only sane response.     * * *     Deep in the labyrinth of his own mind Batman stumbled through a nightmare version of Crime Alley. The walls seemed to weep blood and every shadow held a pair of gleaming malevolent eyes.     ‚ÄúWhy do you keep fighting Bruce?‚Äù a voice whispered on the wind. Batman turned to see his parents standing before him their forms flickering like old film.     ‚ÄúMom? Dad?‚Äù he croaked his voice breaking.     Thomas Wayne‚Äôs face twisted into a sneer. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôve failed us son. Failed Gotham. Look around you ‚Äì the city is as dark and corrupt as ever.‚Äù     ‚ÄúNo‚Äù Batman protested shaking his head. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve made a difference. I‚Äôve saved lives.‚Äù     Martha Wayne‚Äôs laugh was cold and cruel. ‚ÄúSaved lives? Oh Bruce. How many have died because of your crusade? How many have suffered because you refuse to do what‚Äôs necessary?‚Äù     As his parents‚Äô accusations rained down upon him Batman felt something inside him begin to crack. A small part of his mind screamed that this wasn‚Äôt real that it was all a toxin-induced nightmare. But the doubt the guilt the fear ‚Äì it all felt so terribly painfully real.     * * *     In the control room The Chimera‚Äôs eyes widened as they studied the readouts. ‚ÄúRemarkable‚Äù they breathed. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs accessing trauma so deeply buried I doubt even he was fully aware of it.‚Äù     Ms. Rhymes leaned in close her breath hot on The Chimera‚Äôs neck. ‚ÄúAnd what do we do with all this delicious trauma my dear?‚Äù     The Chimera‚Äôs fingers danced across the controls. ‚ÄúWe amplify it. We twist it. And then when he‚Äôs at his most vulnerable we offer him a way out. A new identity free from all that pain and guilt.‚Äù     Ms. Rhymes‚Äô grin was positively feral. ‚ÄúA new Clown Prince of Crime. Oh I do love poetry in motion.‚Äù     Suddenly alarms began to blare throughout the asylum. The Chimera‚Äôs head snapped up their eyes narrowing. ‚ÄúWe have intruders.‚Äù     Ms. Rhymes‚Äô face darkened. ‚ÄúDeal with them. I don‚Äôt care how. Just make sure our performance isn‚Äôt interrupted.‚Äù     As The Chimera hurried from the room Ms. Rhymes turned back to the monitors her eyes fixed on Batman‚Äôs twisting form. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs just you and me now my dark muse. Let‚Äôs see what other horrors we can conjure up shall we?‚Äù     * * *     Outside Arkham chaos reigned. Hannah‚Äôs ‚Äúdistraction‚Äù had taken the form of a series of explosions around the perimeter of the asylum each one timed to draw attention away from their true goal.     As Rhymes‚Äô goons scrambled to respond to the perceived attack Samantha Sarah and Hannah slipped inside through a service entrance.     ‚ÄúRemember‚Äù Samantha whispered as they made their way through the asylum‚Äôs twisted corridors ‚Äúwe don‚Äôt know what state Batman will be in when we find him. Be prepared for anything.‚Äù     Sarah nodded grimly. ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs just hope we‚Äôre not too late.‚Äù     As they ascended to the upper floors the sounds of conflict echoed through the building. Hannah‚Äôs lips curved into a small smile. ‚ÄúSounds like our diversion is working.‚Äù     Suddenly a figure stepped out of the shadows before them. The Chimera their mask seeming to ripple in the dim light.     ‚ÄúWell‚Äù The Chimera said their voice a disorienting blend of tones ‚Äúit seems we have some uninvited guests. How‚Ä¶ intriguing.‚Äù     Samantha stepped forward her baseball bat held at the ready. ‚ÄúStand aside. We‚Äôre here for Batman.‚Äù     The Chimera tilted their head the gesture unnervingly birdlike. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm afraid I can‚Äôt allow that. You see we‚Äôre in the middle of a very delicate procedure. Any interruption could be‚Ä¶ catastrophic.‚Äù     Without warning The Chimera lashed out a spray of some unknown substance erupting from their sleeve. Samantha managed to dodge but Hannah and Sarah weren‚Äôt as lucky. As the mist enveloped them their eyes widened in horror.     ‚ÄúRun!‚Äù Samantha shouted charging at The Chimera. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll hold them off! Find Batman!‚Äù     As Samantha engaged The Chimera in a fierce battle Hannah and Sarah stumbled away their minds already beginning to cloud with hallucinations.     ‚ÄúWe have to‚Ä¶ have to keep going‚Äù Hannah gasped her vision swimming. ‚ÄúBatman‚Ä¶ we need to‚Ä¶‚Äù     Sarah gripped her partner‚Äôs hand tightly. ‚ÄúTogether‚Äù she said firmly. ‚ÄúWhatever happens we face it together.‚Äù     As they staggered down the corridor the walls seemed to breathe and pulse around them The Chimera‚Äôs toxin taking full effect. But still they pressed on driven by a determination that ran deeper than any fear.     * * *     In the depths of his fractured psyche Batman found himself standing atop Wayne Tower the city spread out before him like a diseased corpse. The sky above was a roiling mass of green and purple punctuated by flashes of sickly lightning.     ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs quite a view isn‚Äôt it?‚Äù a voice said from behind him. Batman turned to see the Joker standing there but this time the clown‚Äôs face was a perfect mirror of his own.     ‚ÄúWhat‚Ä¶ what is this?‚Äù Batman growled his voice hoarse.     The Joker-Batman grinned the expression grotesque on the familiar features. ‚ÄúThis is liberation Brucie! This is what happens when you finally let go of all that guilt all that responsibility. When you embrace the joke that is existence!‚Äù     Batman shook his head trying to clear the fog from his mind. ‚ÄúNo. This isn‚Äôt real. I would never‚Ä¶‚Äù     ‚ÄúOh but you would‚Äù the Joker-Batman cackled. ‚ÄúYou will! Think about it ‚Äì how many times have you been one bad day away from becoming just like the monsters you fight? How thin is that line you walk?‚Äù     As the Joker-Batman‚Äôs words washed over him Batman felt something deep inside beginning to give way. The weight of his mission the endless parade of tragedy and horror he‚Äôd witnessed ‚Äì it all came crashing down at once.     And for the first time in as long as he could remember Batman began to laugh.     * * *     In the control room Ms. Rhymes watched the monitors with growing excitement. ‚ÄúYes!‚Äù she crowed. ‚ÄúYes that‚Äôs it! Laugh my dark knight! Embrace the madness!‚Äù     She was so engrossed in the spectacle before her that she didn‚Äôt notice the door opening behind her. Hannah and Sarah their minds still reeling from The Chimera‚Äôs toxin stumbled into the room.     ‚ÄúStop‚Ä¶ stop this‚Äù Hannah gasped her voice barely above a whisper.     Ms. Rhymes spun around her eyes widening in surprise before narrowing in anger. ‚ÄúYou! How did you get past The Chimera?‚Äù     Sarah raised her escrima sticks though her hands shook with the effort. ‚ÄúIt doesn‚Äôt matter. We‚Äôre here to stop you.‚Äù     A cruel smile spread across Ms. Rhymes‚Äô face. ‚ÄúOh my dears. You‚Äôre far too late for that. Batman is already falling. Soon he‚Äôll be reborn as Gotham‚Äôs new agent of chaos. And there‚Äôs nothing you can do to stop it.‚Äù     As if to punctuate her words Batman‚Äôs laughter echoed through the room growing louder and more unhinged with each passing moment.     Hannah and Sarah exchanged a desperate look. They were running out of time.     * * *     In the corridor outside Samantha and The Chimera continued their fierce battle. The Chimera‚Äôs fighting style was a disorienting blend of techniques their body seeming to flow like water around Samantha‚Äôs attacks.     ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre good‚Äù The Chimera said their voice a mix of admiration and malice. ‚ÄúBut you‚Äôre fighting for the wrong side. Can‚Äôt you see the beauty in what we‚Äôre creating?‚Äù     Samantha‚Äôs eyes narrowed behind her mask. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs no beauty in breaking a warrior‚Äôs mind. Only cowardice.‚Äù     The Chimera laughed the sound echoing off the asylum‚Äôs walls. ‚ÄúOh my dear. We‚Äôre not breaking his mind. We‚Äôre setting it free!‚Äù     As they fought the sounds of Batman‚Äôs laughter grew louder more manic. Samantha felt a chill run down her spine. They were running out of time.     * * *     In the twisted landscape of his mind Batman stood on the edge of Wayne Tower teetering between sanity and madness. The Joker-Batman stood beside him arm draped over his shoulders like an old friend.     ‚ÄúCome on Brucie‚Äù the Joker-Batman cajoled. ‚ÄúOne little step. That‚Äôs all it takes. One step and all the pain all the responsibility ‚Äì it all goes away. Isn‚Äôt that what you‚Äôve always wanted?‚Äù     Batman looked out over the nightmare version of Gotham his mind a whirlwind of conflicting thoughts and emotions. Part of him knew this wasn‚Äôt real that it was all a toxin-induced hallucination. But another part a part that had been buried deep for so long whispered that maybe just maybe this was the answer he‚Äôd been looking for all along.     *****     Batman stood on the precipice both literally and figuratively. The Joker-Batman‚Äôs words echoed in his mind a siren song of chaos and release. For a moment that seemed to stretch into eternity he teetered on the edge.     Then with a laugh that started low and grew into a manic cackle Batman stepped off the ledge.     As he fell through the nightmare cityscape his laughter echoed off the twisted buildings. The world around him began to blur and shift colors swirling together in a dizzying kaleidoscope of madness.     * * *     In the control room Ms. Rhymes watched the monitors with growing excitement. ‚ÄúYes!‚Äù she crowed. ‚ÄúYes that‚Äôs it! Fall my dark knight! Fall into the abyss of chaos!‚Äù     Hannah and Sarah still fighting against the effects of The Chimera‚Äôs toxin struggled to make sense of what they were seeing.     ‚ÄúWe have to‚Ä¶ have to stop this‚Äù Hannah gasped her vision swimming.     Sarah reached out gripping her partner‚Äôs hand tightly. ‚ÄúHow? We can barely stand‚Ä¶‚Äù     Ms. Rhymes turned to them her eyes glittering with malicious glee. ‚ÄúOh my dears. You can‚Äôt stop this. You‚Äôre witnessing the birth of a new era for Gotham. The fall of its greatest hero‚Ä¶ and the rise of its most terrifying villain!‚Äù     * * *     Outside in the corridor Samantha and The Chimera‚Äôs battle had reached a fever pitch. Both combatants were showing signs of fatigue but neither was willing to give an inch.     ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre fighting a losing battle‚Äù The Chimera panted their mask seeming to ripple with each breath. ‚ÄúEven if you defeat me you can‚Äôt undo what‚Äôs been done to Batman‚Äôs mind.‚Äù     Samantha‚Äôs eyes narrowed behind her mask. ‚ÄúMaybe not. But I can make sure you pay for what you‚Äôve done.‚Äù     With a burst of speed Samantha feinted left then brought her baseball bat around in a vicious arc. The Chimera caught off guard couldn‚Äôt dodge in time. The bat connected with their mask with a sickening crunch.     The Chimera stumbled back their mask cracking and falling away in pieces. As it did Samantha‚Äôs eyes widened in shock.     ‚ÄúYou‚Ä¶ you‚Äôre‚Ä¶‚Äù     But before she could finish The Chimera lashed out with a hidden blade forcing Samantha back. Taking advantage of her momentary surprise they turned and fled down the corridor.     Samantha hesitated for a moment torn between pursuit and the need to help Batman. With a growl of frustration she turned towards the control room. Batman had to be the priority.     * * *     In the swirling vortex of his mind Batman continued to fall. As he did he felt his very identity begin to unravel. Memories flashed before his eyes ‚Äì his parents‚Äô murder his years of training his countless battles to protect Gotham. But now each memory was tinged with a manic hilarity as if every tragedy in his life had suddenly become the punchline to some cosmic joke.     ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs it Brucie!‚Äù the Joker-Batman‚Äôs voice echoed around him. ‚ÄúLet it all go! Embrace the madness!‚Äù     As he fell deeper into the abyss of his own psyche Batman felt something fundamental shifting within him. The rigid moral code that had defined him for so long began to crack and splinter.     And still he laughed.     * * *     In the control room the tension had reached a breaking point. Ms. Rhymes stood before the monitors her arms spread wide as if conducting some twisted symphony. Hannah and Sarah still reeling from The Chimera‚Äôs toxin struggled to formulate a plan.     Suddenly the door burst open and Samantha charged in her baseball bat at the ready.     ‚ÄúStep away from the controls‚Äù she growled.     Ms. Rhymes spun around her eyes widening in surprise before narrowing in anger. ‚ÄúRevan‚Ä¶ or should I say Samantha? I must admit I‚Äôm disappointed. I thought you understood the beauty of what we‚Äôre creating here.‚Äù     Samantha‚Äôs grip tightened on her bat. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs no beauty in this. Only madness and pain.‚Äù     As they faced off the room filled with the sound of Batman‚Äôs laughter growing louder and more unhinged with each passing moment.     Hannah fighting through the haze of the toxin stumbled towards the controls. ‚ÄúWe have to‚Ä¶ have to shut it down‚Ä¶‚Äù     But before she could reach them Ms. Rhymes pulled out a small remote. ‚ÄúI wouldn‚Äôt do that if I were you‚Äù she said her voice dripping with malice. ‚ÄúOne push of this button and Batman‚Äôs mind is wiped clean. Everything he was everything he believed in ‚Äì gone in an instant.‚Äù     The room froze the tension palpable. Samantha‚Äôs eyes darted between Ms. Rhymes and the monitors showing Batman‚Äôs writhing form. Sarah supporting a still-woozy Hannah glared at the madwoman before them.     ‚ÄúWhat do you want?‚Äù Samantha asked her voice tight.     Ms. Rhymes‚Äô smile was all teeth. ‚ÄúWant? My dear I want what I‚Äôve always wanted. To show Gotham ‚Äì to show the world ‚Äì the true face of chaos. And what better way to do that than to turn its greatest protector into its worst nightmare?‚Äù     As she spoke the monitors behind her flickered. Batman‚Äôs laughter had reached a fever pitch and suddenly it cut off. The silence that followed was deafening.     All eyes turned to the screens. Batman‚Äôs body had gone still his face hidden in shadow.     ‚ÄúNo‚Äù Sarah whispered her eyes wide with horror.     Ms. Rhymes‚Äô grin widened. ‚ÄúYes. Watch closely my dears. You‚Äôre about to witness the rebirth of a legend.‚Äù     * * *     In the depths of his fractured psyche Batman stood in a void. The swirling chaos around him had stilled leaving him in a space of perfect empty blackness.     ‚ÄúSo‚Äù he said his voice echoing in the emptiness ‚Äúthis is madness.‚Äù     The Joker-Batman appeared before him but now instead of a mirror image it was a swirling ever-changing figure ‚Äì sometimes the Joker sometimes Batman sometimes a nightmarish blend of the two.     ‚ÄúNot madness Brucie‚Äù it said its voice a cacophony of laughter and growls. ‚ÄúClarity. You‚Äôve finally seen the joke that is existence. The futility of your crusade. The utter absurdity of it all.‚Äù     Batman looked down at his hands watching as his costume began to shift and change colors bleeding and swirling.     ‚ÄúAnd now?‚Äù he asked his voice utterly calm.     The figure before him grinned the expression stretching beyond the limits of a human face. ‚ÄúNow you become what you were always meant to be. Gotham‚Äôs darkest knight. Its clown prince of crime. Its harbinger of beautiful perfect chaos.‚Äù     As the words washed over him Batman felt the last vestiges of his old self falling away. In its place rose something new. Something terrifying. Something‚Ä¶ free.     He threw back his head and laughed the sound echoing through the void and beyond into the world of the waking.     * * *     In the control room all eyes were fixed on the monitors as Batman‚Äôs body began to stir. Slowly he sat up his movements fluid and unnaturally graceful.     ‚ÄúNo‚Äù Samantha breathed her bat slipping from nerveless fingers. ‚ÄúWhat have you done?‚Äù     Ms. Rhymes‚Äô eyes gleamed with triumph. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve given Gotham its new god of chaos. Behold the birth of a legend!‚Äù     On the screen Batman turned towards the camera. As his face came into view a collective gasp filled the room. His cowl had split and peeled back revealing a face that was a nightmarish blend of Batman and the Joker. His skin was pale almost white with streaks of black that mimicked the design of his cowl. His lips were stretched in a grin that was too wide too full of teeth to be natural.     But it was his eyes that truly chilled the blood. They burned with a manic intensity swirling with colors that shouldn‚Äôt exist in nature.     When he spoke his voice was a blend of Batman‚Äôs gravelly growl and the Joker‚Äôs high-pitched cackle. ‚ÄúGotham‚Äù he said his grin widening impossibly further ‚Äúyour Dark Knight has fallen. But fear not ‚Äì a new protector rises. One who understands that the only way to save this city‚Ä¶ is to embrace the madness.‚Äù     He stood his costume rippling and changing. The blacks and greys bled into purples and greens while still maintaining the silhouette of the Bat. The result was a terrifying fusion of Batman and the Joker a creature of nightmare made flesh.     ‚ÄúThe joke‚Äôs on you Gotham‚Äù he continued spreading his arms wide. ‚ÄúYou thought you needed a hero. But what you really need‚Ä¶ is a little chaos.‚Äù     With that he threw back his head and laughed. It was a sound that contained multitudes ‚Äì the deep restrained chuckle of Bruce Wayne the gravelly growl of Batman the manic cackle of the Joker and something else. Something new and terrifying.     In the control room Ms. Rhymes drank in the sight with undisguised glee. ‚ÄúBeautiful‚Äù she breathed. ‚ÄúAbsolutely beautiful.‚Äù     Samantha Hannah and Sarah watched in horror the full weight of their failure crashing down upon them. They had come to save Batman to stop Ms. Rhymes‚Äô plan. Instead they had witnessed the fall of Gotham‚Äôs greatest hero and the birth of its most terrifying villain.     As the newly reborn Batman-Joker hybrid continued to laugh his voice echoing through the asylum and beyond a chill ran down the spines of all who heard it. For in that laugh was a promise ‚Äì a promise of chaos of madness of a Gotham reshaped in the image of its fallen hero.     The Dark Knight had fallen. And in his place rose something far deadlier ‚Äì a creature of shadow and laughter of justice twisted into madness. Gotham‚Äôs new Clown Prince of Crime had arrived.     And the city would never be the same again.     As the screens went dark plunging the control room into shadows broken only by the eerie glow of emergency lights Ms. Rhymes turned to her stunned audience her eyes gleaming with triumphant madness.     ‚ÄúAnd so‚Äù she said her voice dripping with malicious glee ‚Äúthe curtain falls on this act of our grand performance. But fear not my dears. The show is far from over. In fact‚Ä¶‚Äù Her grin widened becoming something feral and terrifying. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs only just beginning.‚Äù     The asylum echoed with the sound of mad laughter ‚Äì Ms. Rhymes‚Äô the newly reborn Batman‚Äôs and perhaps most chillingly of all the laughter of a city teetering on the brink of total chaos.     In the growing darkness as the weight of their failure pressed down upon them Samantha Hannah and Sarah exchanged grim looks. They had lost this battle but the war for Gotham‚Äôs soul was far from over.     The question now was: in a city without its Dark Knight who would rise to face the coming storm?

Danny looking him in the eyes without blinking: did you know that centuries ago fae really liked to crawl inside human bodies and use them as nests? I heard human insides are really warm and squishy.  Dick sweating frozen in place: ‚Ä¶no?..   Danny smiling and cheerfully jumping to hug Dick: I didn‚Äôt either!      Jason because he is feeling adventurous today: I have a question. Where do Fae come from?  Danny: Ah so B hadn‚Äôt had the Talk with you yet what a shame. So when a woman and a man love each other very much-  Damian: Enough of your foolish jokes I do not wish to hear the sex talk from you. To answer your question Todd Fae come from the dreams.   Jason deadpan: ‚Ä¶really?  Danny very awkwardly: Um. Dami. Brother to my soul. I‚Äôm so sorry.   Damian: What?  Danny: I told you we come from dreams only because you were four. That‚Äôs not actually how it works. We just fuck.     Duke narrowing his eyes at Danny suspiciously: So for the past week and a half I‚Äôve been having this recurring dream about you eating my brain with a fork like spaghetti. I was wondering is it like a you thing or a me thing?  Danny very offended: Duke! Not every weird thing that happens in this house is my fault! That is very rude of you!   Cass after Duke had apologized profusely and left: You.  Danny rolling his eyes: Yeah okay I did do that. In my defense his fear tastes like the perfect greasy cheeseburger and I have to get my fair share of junk food somehow.  Cass: >:(  Danny: Okay I‚Äôll stop. Eventually.     Bruce in his nth attempt at gaining information from Danny: How do you know if someone is a Fae or not?  Danny: Throw a fish at them.  Bruce: ????  Danny not even looking up from his phone: Fish are scared of the Fae. So if you throw a fish at someone and the fish gets scared they are Fae.  Gotham Rogues a week later: We have no idea why Batman keeps throwing guppies at us but we collectively suspect his new child is to blame.     Danny: Oh I‚Äôm forbidden to enjoy caraoke nights.  Steph who suggested he join: What? Why? Is it some kind of punishment for the pizza incident?  Tim: No it‚Äôs because if he starts singing we all lose our grip on reality.  Damian: And our dignity.  Danny: They mean they start dancing whether they want it or not and I have videos to prove it. Wanna see Jason twerking? Or I have one with Tim and Bruce waltzing through the manor.  Steph as everyone else bemoans their fate: With great pleasure.  |

Batman: Shadows Of Madness (Part 2 of the shadows saga) A fan fiction by Ecky **Disclaimer:**     ‚ÄúShadows of Madness‚Äù is a non-commercial fan fiction story created by and for fans of the Batman franchise. This work is not affiliated with endorsed or approved by DC Comics Warner Bros. Entertainment or any other official entities associated with Batman and related characters. All characters such as Batman Joker Penguin Riddler and others from the Batman universe are the property of their respective trademark and copyright holders.     The original characters of Ms. Racey Rhymes The Chimera Revan (Samantha Faith) Hannah and Sarah are creations of the author and any resemblance to actual persons living or dead or other fictional characters is purely coincidental.     This story is intended solely for entertainment purposes and is not for commercial use. No infringement of copyright or trademark is intended.     The Characters:    Batman as himself       The Joker as himself       @raceyrhymes as Ms Rhyme‚Äôs       @solesofwonder as Hannah and Sarah       @samcrosfaith as Samantha Faith aka Revan      And introducing @smallzster as Chimera      The cold sterile room buzzed with an undercurrent of malevolent energy. Batman the Dark Knight of Gotham found himself strapped to a chair his utility belt gone surrounded by an array of ominous machinery. Before him stood Ms. Racey Rhymes her eyes gleaming with a manic intensity that sent chills down his spine.     ‚ÄúWelcome to the grand stage my caped muse‚Äù Ms. Rhymes purred her voice a discordant melody. ‚ÄúAre you ready for your starring role?‚Äù     Batman‚Äôs jaw clenched his eyes narrowing behind his cowl. ‚ÄúWhatever you‚Äôre planning Rhymes it won‚Äôt work. Gotham has faced worse than you.‚Äù     A giggle escaped Ms. Rhymes‚Äô painted lips. ‚ÄúOh my dear Dark Knight you misunderstand. I‚Äôm not here to face Gotham. I‚Äôm here to remake it. And you my brooding bat will be my masterpiece.‚Äù     She snapped her fingers and a figure emerged from the shadows. Tall and lithe with features that seemed to shift between masculine and feminine the newcomer exuded an aura of calculated menace.     ‚ÄúAllow me to introduce my collaborator‚Äù Ms. Rhymes said her voice dripping with false sweetness. ‚ÄúThe Chimera. A true artist of the mind.‚Äù     The Chimera stepped forward their face hidden behind a mask that seemed to morph and change with each passing moment. When they spoke their voice was a disorienting blend of tones and pitches.     ‚ÄúHello Batman. I‚Äôve been looking forward to our session.‚Äù     Batman‚Äôs mind raced trying to place this new threat. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre one of Crane‚Äôs students‚Äù he growled. ‚ÄúI remember the files. You disappeared years ago.‚Äù     The Chimera tilted their head the gesture unnervingly birdlike. ‚ÄúVery good Detective. But Dr. Crane was merely the beginning of my journey. Now I‚Äôm something‚Ä¶ more.‚Äù     Ms. Rhymes clapped her hands together in delight. ‚ÄúEnough chitchat! Let the performance begin!‚Äù     The Chimera moved to a control panel their fingers dancing across the keys. Suddenly a fine mist began to fill the room and Batman felt his senses beginning to blur.     ‚ÄúWhat‚Ä¶ what is this?‚Äù he gasped fighting against the rising tide of disorientation.     ‚ÄúConsider it a cocktail of my own design‚Äù The Chimera replied their voice seeming to come from everywhere at once. ‚ÄúFear toxin mixed with a dash of hallucinogens and a sprinkle of my own special additions. We‚Äôre going to peel back those layers of sanity Batman. One by one.‚Äù     As the mist thickened Batman‚Äôs vision began to swim. The room around him warped and twisted melting away into a nightmarish landscape. The last thing he heard before succumbing to the hallucinations was Ms. Rhymes‚Äô singsong voice:     ‚ÄúIn shadows deep and madness vast  Gotham‚Äôs hero breathes his last.  A mind once strong now torn apart  Welcome Batman to your new start.‚Äù     * * *     Across town in an abandoned warehouse that served as their temporary base Hannah Sarah and their unlikely ally Revan ‚Äì now revealed as Samantha Faith ‚Äì pored over maps and documents.     ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve checked every known hideout‚Äù Hannah said frustration evident in her voice. ‚ÄúWhere could Rhymes be keeping him?‚Äù     Sarah placed a comforting hand on her partner‚Äôs shoulder. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôll find him Han. We have to.‚Äù     Samantha her mask off but still cutting an imposing figure studied the map intently. ‚ÄúRhymes is theatrical. She‚Äôll want a stage for her ‚Äòperformance.‚Äô Somewhere significant.‚Äù     ‚ÄúLike what?‚Äù Sarah asked her brow furrowed.     ‚ÄúWait‚Äù Hannah said her eyes widening. ‚ÄúWhat about Arkham not the new one? The old asylum‚Äôs been abandoned for years. It‚Äôs perfect ‚Äì isolated symbolic‚Ä¶‚Äù     Samantha nodded slowly. ‚ÄúAnd with a history of madness. It fits Rhymes‚Äô MO.‚Äù     As they began to plan their assault on Arkham Sarah couldn‚Äôt help but voice the question that had been nagging at her. ‚ÄúSamantha‚Ä¶ why are you helping us? You were working for Rhymes.‚Äù     Samantha‚Äôs eyes hardened. ‚ÄúI was hired to do a job. To test Batman to challenge him. Not‚Ä¶ this. There‚Äôs no honor in breaking a warrior‚Äôs mind.‚Äù     Hannah studied the woman before her. ‚ÄúAnd the whole Revan persona? The baseball bat?‚Äù     A small smile tugged at Samantha‚Äôs lips. ‚ÄúEvery warrior needs their weapon. And sometimes the best disguise is one that plays into people‚Äôs expectations.‚Äù     As the trio finalized their plans the air was thick with tension. They all knew that time was running out for Batman ‚Äì and for Gotham.     * * *     In the depths of his toxin-induced nightmare Batman found himself in a twisted version of Gotham. The sky above was a sickly green and the buildings seemed to breathe and pulse with malevolent life.     ‚ÄúWell well well‚Äù a familiar voice cackled. ‚ÄúLook who‚Äôs come to play!‚Äù     Batman spun around to find himself face to face with the Joker his grin wider and more manic than ever.     ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre not real‚Äù Batman growled his fists clenching. ‚ÄúThis is all in my head.‚Äù     The Joker‚Äôs laughter echoed off the writhing buildings. ‚ÄúOh Batsy! Don‚Äôt you know? The stuff in our heads is the realest thing there is! Now come on let‚Äôs have some fun!‚Äù     Suddenly Batman was surrounded by a horde of grinning laughing maniacs all wearing the Joker‚Äôs face. As he fought them off each punch seemed to make two more appear.     ‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt win this one Batman‚Äù the Joker taunted. ‚ÄúWhy not join us? Think of the laughs we could have together!‚Äù     Batman gritted his teeth fighting against the rising tide of chaos. ‚ÄúNever‚Äù he snarled. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll never become like you.‚Äù     But even as he said it a small voice in the back of his mind whispered ‚ÄúAre you so sure?‚Äù     * * *     Back in the real world The Chimera monitored Batman‚Äôs vital signs with clinical detachment. ‚ÄúFascinating‚Äù they murmured. ‚ÄúHis mental resilience is truly remarkable.‚Äù     Ms. Rhymes peered at the screens her eyes glittering with malicious glee. ‚ÄúBut he‚Äôs cracking isn‚Äôt he? I can almost hear the fissures forming in that rigid psyche of his.‚Äù     The Chimera nodded slowly. ‚ÄúYes but we must be cautious. Push too hard too fast and his mind might shatter completely. We want to remake him not destroy him utterly.‚Äù     Ms. Rhymes waved a dismissive hand. ‚ÄúDetails details. Just keep pushing my dear Chimera. I want to see what lurks in the deepest darkest corners of the Bat‚Äôs mind.‚Äù     As they spoke neither noticed the small drone hovering outside the window its camera capturing every moment of their sinister collaboration.     * * *     Hannah Sarah and Samantha crouched in the shadows outside the old Arkham Asylum their eyes fixed on the crumbling structure before them.     ‚ÄúI‚Äôm picking up heat signatures on the top floor‚Äù Hannah whispered consulting a handheld device. ‚ÄúLooks like that‚Äôs where they‚Äôre keeping him.‚Äù     Sarah nodded her grip tightening on her escrima sticks. ‚ÄúSo what‚Äôs the plan? We can‚Äôt just burst in there. Who knows what they‚Äôve done to Batman‚Äôs mind by now.‚Äù     Samantha‚Äôs eyes narrowed behind her mask. ‚ÄúWe need a distraction. Something to draw their attention while we extract Batman.‚Äù     Hannah‚Äôs lips curled into a grim smile. ‚ÄúI think I have just the thing. But you‚Äôre not going to like it.‚Äù     As she outlined her plan Sarah and Samantha exchanged worried glances. It was risky borderline insane. But then again in a city like Gotham sometimes insanity was the only sane response.     * * *     Deep in the labyrinth of his own mind Batman stumbled through a nightmare version of Crime Alley. The walls seemed to weep blood and every shadow held a pair of gleaming malevolent eyes.     ‚ÄúWhy do you keep fighting Bruce?‚Äù a voice whispered on the wind. Batman turned to see his parents standing before him their forms flickering like old film.     ‚ÄúMom? Dad?‚Äù he croaked his voice breaking.     Thomas Wayne‚Äôs face twisted into a sneer. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôve failed us son. Failed Gotham. Look around you ‚Äì the city is as dark and corrupt as ever.‚Äù     ‚ÄúNo‚Äù Batman protested shaking his head. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve made a difference. I‚Äôve saved lives.‚Äù     Martha Wayne‚Äôs laugh was cold and cruel. ‚ÄúSaved lives? Oh Bruce. How many have died because of your crusade? How many have suffered because you refuse to do what‚Äôs necessary?‚Äù     As his parents‚Äô accusations rained down upon him Batman felt something inside him begin to crack. A small part of his mind screamed that this wasn‚Äôt real that it was all a toxin-induced nightmare. But the doubt the guilt the fear ‚Äì it all felt so terribly painfully real.     * * *     In the control room The Chimera‚Äôs eyes widened as they studied the readouts. ‚ÄúRemarkable‚Äù they breathed. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs accessing trauma so deeply buried I doubt even he was fully aware of it.‚Äù     Ms. Rhymes leaned in close her breath hot on The Chimera‚Äôs neck. ‚ÄúAnd what do we do with all this delicious trauma my dear?‚Äù     The Chimera‚Äôs fingers danced across the controls. ‚ÄúWe amplify it. We twist it. And then when he‚Äôs at his most vulnerable we offer him a way out. A new identity free from all that pain and guilt.‚Äù     Ms. Rhymes‚Äô grin was positively feral. ‚ÄúA new Clown Prince of Crime. Oh I do love poetry in motion.‚Äù     Suddenly alarms began to blare throughout the asylum. The Chimera‚Äôs head snapped up their eyes narrowing. ‚ÄúWe have intruders.‚Äù     Ms. Rhymes‚Äô face darkened. ‚ÄúDeal with them. I don‚Äôt care how. Just make sure our performance isn‚Äôt interrupted.‚Äù     As The Chimera hurried from the room Ms. Rhymes turned back to the monitors her eyes fixed on Batman‚Äôs twisting form. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs just you and me now my dark muse. Let‚Äôs see what other horrors we can conjure up shall we?‚Äù     * * *     Outside Arkham chaos reigned. Hannah‚Äôs ‚Äúdistraction‚Äù had taken the form of a series of explosions around the perimeter of the asylum each one timed to draw attention away from their true goal.     As Rhymes‚Äô goons scrambled to respond to the perceived attack Samantha Sarah and Hannah slipped inside through a service entrance.     ‚ÄúRemember‚Äù Samantha whispered as they made their way through the asylum‚Äôs twisted corridors ‚Äúwe don‚Äôt know what state Batman will be in when we find him. Be prepared for anything.‚Äù     Sarah nodded grimly. ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs just hope we‚Äôre not too late.‚Äù     As they ascended to the upper floors the sounds of conflict echoed through the building. Hannah‚Äôs lips curved into a small smile. ‚ÄúSounds like our diversion is working.‚Äù     Suddenly a figure stepped out of the shadows before them. The Chimera their mask seeming to ripple in the dim light.     ‚ÄúWell‚Äù The Chimera said their voice a disorienting blend of tones ‚Äúit seems we have some uninvited guests. How‚Ä¶ intriguing.‚Äù     Samantha stepped forward her baseball bat held at the ready. ‚ÄúStand aside. We‚Äôre here for Batman.‚Äù     The Chimera tilted their head the gesture unnervingly birdlike. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm afraid I can‚Äôt allow that. You see we‚Äôre in the middle of a very delicate procedure. Any interruption could be‚Ä¶ catastrophic.‚Äù     Without warning The Chimera lashed out a spray of some unknown substance erupting from their sleeve. Samantha managed to dodge but Hannah and Sarah weren‚Äôt as lucky. As the mist enveloped them their eyes widened in horror.     ‚ÄúRun!‚Äù Samantha shouted charging at The Chimera. ‚ÄúI‚Äôll hold them off! Find Batman!‚Äù     As Samantha engaged The Chimera in a fierce battle Hannah and Sarah stumbled away their minds already beginning to cloud with hallucinations.     ‚ÄúWe have to‚Ä¶ have to keep going‚Äù Hannah gasped her vision swimming. ‚ÄúBatman‚Ä¶ we need to‚Ä¶‚Äù     Sarah gripped her partner‚Äôs hand tightly. ‚ÄúTogether‚Äù she said firmly. ‚ÄúWhatever happens we face it together.‚Äù     As they staggered down the corridor the walls seemed to breathe and pulse around them The Chimera‚Äôs toxin taking full effect. But still they pressed on driven by a determination that ran deeper than any fear.     * * *     In the depths of his fractured psyche Batman found himself standing atop Wayne Tower the city spread out before him like a diseased corpse. The sky above was a roiling mass of green and purple punctuated by flashes of sickly lightning.     ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs quite a view isn‚Äôt it?‚Äù a voice said from behind him. Batman turned to see the Joker standing there but this time the clown‚Äôs face was a perfect mirror of his own.     ‚ÄúWhat‚Ä¶ what is this?‚Äù Batman growled his voice hoarse.     The Joker-Batman grinned the expression grotesque on the familiar features. ‚ÄúThis is liberation Brucie! This is what happens when you finally let go of all that guilt all that responsibility. When you embrace the joke that is existence!‚Äù     Batman shook his head trying to clear the fog from his mind. ‚ÄúNo. This isn‚Äôt real. I would never‚Ä¶‚Äù     ‚ÄúOh but you would‚Äù the Joker-Batman cackled. ‚ÄúYou will! Think about it ‚Äì how many times have you been one bad day away from becoming just like the monsters you fight? How thin is that line you walk?‚Äù     As the Joker-Batman‚Äôs words washed over him Batman felt something deep inside beginning to give way. The weight of his mission the endless parade of tragedy and horror he‚Äôd witnessed ‚Äì it all came crashing down at once.     And for the first time in as long as he could remember Batman began to laugh.     * * *     In the control room Ms. Rhymes watched the monitors with growing excitement. ‚ÄúYes!‚Äù she crowed. ‚ÄúYes that‚Äôs it! Laugh my dark knight! Embrace the madness!‚Äù     She was so engrossed in the spectacle before her that she didn‚Äôt notice the door opening behind her. Hannah and Sarah their minds still reeling from The Chimera‚Äôs toxin stumbled into the room.     ‚ÄúStop‚Ä¶ stop this‚Äù Hannah gasped her voice barely above a whisper.     Ms. Rhymes spun around her eyes widening in surprise before narrowing in anger. ‚ÄúYou! How did you get past The Chimera?‚Äù     Sarah raised her escrima sticks though her hands shook with the effort. ‚ÄúIt doesn‚Äôt matter. We‚Äôre here to stop you.‚Äù     A cruel smile spread across Ms. Rhymes‚Äô face. ‚ÄúOh my dears. You‚Äôre far too late for that. Batman is already falling. Soon he‚Äôll be reborn as Gotham‚Äôs new agent of chaos. And there‚Äôs nothing you can do to stop it.‚Äù     As if to punctuate her words Batman‚Äôs laughter echoed through the room growing louder and more unhinged with each passing moment.     Hannah and Sarah exchanged a desperate look. They were running out of time.     * * *     In the corridor outside Samantha and The Chimera continued their fierce battle. The Chimera‚Äôs fighting style was a disorienting blend of techniques their body seeming to flow like water around Samantha‚Äôs attacks.     ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre good‚Äù The Chimera said their voice a mix of admiration and malice. ‚ÄúBut you‚Äôre fighting for the wrong side. Can‚Äôt you see the beauty in what we‚Äôre creating?‚Äù     Samantha‚Äôs eyes narrowed behind her mask. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs no beauty in breaking a warrior‚Äôs mind. Only cowardice.‚Äù     The Chimera laughed the sound echoing off the asylum‚Äôs walls. ‚ÄúOh my dear. We‚Äôre not breaking his mind. We‚Äôre setting it free!‚Äù     As they fought the sounds of Batman‚Äôs laughter grew louder more manic. Samantha felt a chill run down her spine. They were running out of time.     * * *     In the twisted landscape of his mind Batman stood on the edge of Wayne Tower teetering between sanity and madness. The Joker-Batman stood beside him arm draped over his shoulders like an old friend.     ‚ÄúCome on Brucie‚Äù the Joker-Batman cajoled. ‚ÄúOne little step. That‚Äôs all it takes. One step and all the pain all the responsibility ‚Äì it all goes away. Isn‚Äôt that what you‚Äôve always wanted?‚Äù     Batman looked out over the nightmare version of Gotham his mind a whirlwind of conflicting thoughts and emotions. Part of him knew this wasn‚Äôt real that it was all a toxin-induced hallucination. But another part a part that had been buried deep for so long whispered that maybe just maybe this was the answer he‚Äôd been looking for all along.     *****     Batman stood on the precipice both literally and figuratively. The Joker-Batman‚Äôs words echoed in his mind a siren song of chaos and release. For a moment that seemed to stretch into eternity he teetered on the edge.     Then with a laugh that started low and grew into a manic cackle Batman stepped off the ledge.     As he fell through the nightmare cityscape his laughter echoed off the twisted buildings. The world around him began to blur and shift colors swirling together in a dizzying kaleidoscope of madness.     * * *     In the control room Ms. Rhymes watched the monitors with growing excitement. ‚ÄúYes!‚Äù she crowed. ‚ÄúYes that‚Äôs it! Fall my dark knight! Fall into the abyss of chaos!‚Äù     Hannah and Sarah still fighting against the effects of The Chimera‚Äôs toxin struggled to make sense of what they were seeing.     ‚ÄúWe have to‚Ä¶ have to stop this‚Äù Hannah gasped her vision swimming.     Sarah reached out gripping her partner‚Äôs hand tightly. ‚ÄúHow? We can barely stand‚Ä¶‚Äù     Ms. Rhymes turned to them her eyes glittering with malicious glee. ‚ÄúOh my dears. You can‚Äôt stop this. You‚Äôre witnessing the birth of a new era for Gotham. The fall of its greatest hero‚Ä¶ and the rise of its most terrifying villain!‚Äù     * * *     Outside in the corridor Samantha and The Chimera‚Äôs battle had reached a fever pitch. Both combatants were showing signs of fatigue but neither was willing to give an inch.     ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre fighting a losing battle‚Äù The Chimera panted their mask seeming to ripple with each breath. ‚ÄúEven if you defeat me you can‚Äôt undo what‚Äôs been done to Batman‚Äôs mind.‚Äù     Samantha‚Äôs eyes narrowed behind her mask. ‚ÄúMaybe not. But I can make sure you pay for what you‚Äôve done.‚Äù     With a burst of speed Samantha feinted left then brought her baseball bat around in a vicious arc. The Chimera caught off guard couldn‚Äôt dodge in time. The bat connected with their mask with a sickening crunch.     The Chimera stumbled back their mask cracking and falling away in pieces. As it did Samantha‚Äôs eyes widened in shock.     ‚ÄúYou‚Ä¶ you‚Äôre‚Ä¶‚Äù     But before she could finish The Chimera lashed out with a hidden blade forcing Samantha back. Taking advantage of her momentary surprise they turned and fled down the corridor.     Samantha hesitated for a moment torn between pursuit and the need to help Batman. With a growl of frustration she turned towards the control room. Batman had to be the priority.     * * *     In the swirling vortex of his mind Batman continued to fall. As he did he felt his very identity begin to unravel. Memories flashed before his eyes ‚Äì his parents‚Äô murder his years of training his countless battles to protect Gotham. But now each memory was tinged with a manic hilarity as if every tragedy in his life had suddenly become the punchline to some cosmic joke.     ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs it Brucie!‚Äù the Joker-Batman‚Äôs voice echoed around him. ‚ÄúLet it all go! Embrace the madness!‚Äù     As he fell deeper into the abyss of his own psyche Batman felt something fundamental shifting within him. The rigid moral code that had defined him for so long began to crack and splinter.     And still he laughed.     * * *     In the control room the tension had reached a breaking point. Ms. Rhymes stood before the monitors her arms spread wide as if conducting some twisted symphony. Hannah and Sarah still reeling from The Chimera‚Äôs toxin struggled to formulate a plan.     Suddenly the door burst open and Samantha charged in her baseball bat at the ready.     ‚ÄúStep away from the controls‚Äù she growled.     Ms. Rhymes spun around her eyes widening in surprise before narrowing in anger. ‚ÄúRevan‚Ä¶ or should I say Samantha? I must admit I‚Äôm disappointed. I thought you understood the beauty of what we‚Äôre creating here.‚Äù     Samantha‚Äôs grip tightened on her bat. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs no beauty in this. Only madness and pain.‚Äù     As they faced off the room filled with the sound of Batman‚Äôs laughter growing louder and more unhinged with each passing moment.     Hannah fighting through the haze of the toxin stumbled towards the controls. ‚ÄúWe have to‚Ä¶ have to shut it down‚Ä¶‚Äù     But before she could reach them Ms. Rhymes pulled out a small remote. ‚ÄúI wouldn‚Äôt do that if I were you‚Äù she said her voice dripping with malice. ‚ÄúOne push of this button and Batman‚Äôs mind is wiped clean. Everything he was everything he believed in ‚Äì gone in an instant.‚Äù     The room froze the tension palpable. Samantha‚Äôs eyes darted between Ms. Rhymes and the monitors showing Batman‚Äôs writhing form. Sarah supporting a still-woozy Hannah glared at the madwoman before them.     ‚ÄúWhat do you want?‚Äù Samantha asked her voice tight.     Ms. Rhymes‚Äô smile was all teeth. ‚ÄúWant? My dear I want what I‚Äôve always wanted. To show Gotham ‚Äì to show the world ‚Äì the true face of chaos. And what better way to do that than to turn its greatest protector into its worst nightmare?‚Äù     As she spoke the monitors behind her flickered. Batman‚Äôs laughter had reached a fever pitch and suddenly it cut off. The silence that followed was deafening.     All eyes turned to the screens. Batman‚Äôs body had gone still his face hidden in shadow.     ‚ÄúNo‚Äù Sarah whispered her eyes wide with horror.     Ms. Rhymes‚Äô grin widened. ‚ÄúYes. Watch closely my dears. You‚Äôre about to witness the rebirth of a legend.‚Äù     * * *     In the depths of his fractured psyche Batman stood in a void. The swirling chaos around him had stilled leaving him in a space of perfect empty blackness.     ‚ÄúSo‚Äù he said his voice echoing in the emptiness ‚Äúthis is madness.‚Äù     The Joker-Batman appeared before him but now instead of a mirror image it was a swirling ever-changing figure ‚Äì sometimes the Joker sometimes Batman sometimes a nightmarish blend of the two.     ‚ÄúNot madness Brucie‚Äù it said its voice a cacophony of laughter and growls. ‚ÄúClarity. You‚Äôve finally seen the joke that is existence. The futility of your crusade. The utter absurdity of it all.‚Äù     Batman looked down at his hands watching as his costume began to shift and change colors bleeding and swirling.     ‚ÄúAnd now?‚Äù he asked his voice utterly calm.     The figure before him grinned the expression stretching beyond the limits of a human face. ‚ÄúNow you become what you were always meant to be. Gotham‚Äôs darkest knight. Its clown prince of crime. Its harbinger of beautiful perfect chaos.‚Äù     As the words washed over him Batman felt the last vestiges of his old self falling away. In its place rose something new. Something terrifying. Something‚Ä¶ free.     He threw back his head and laughed the sound echoing through the void and beyond into the world of the waking.     * * *     In the control room all eyes were fixed on the monitors as Batman‚Äôs body began to stir. Slowly he sat up his movements fluid and unnaturally graceful.     ‚ÄúNo‚Äù Samantha breathed her bat slipping from nerveless fingers. ‚ÄúWhat have you done?‚Äù     Ms. Rhymes‚Äô eyes gleamed with triumph. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve given Gotham its new god of chaos. Behold the birth of a legend!‚Äù     On the screen Batman turned towards the camera. As his face came into view a collective gasp filled the room. His cowl had split and peeled back revealing a face that was a nightmarish blend of Batman and the Joker. His skin was pale almost white with streaks of black that mimicked the design of his cowl. His lips were stretched in a grin that was too wide too full of teeth to be natural.     But it was his eyes that truly chilled the blood. They burned with a manic intensity swirling with colors that shouldn‚Äôt exist in nature.     When he spoke his voice was a blend of Batman‚Äôs gravelly growl and the Joker‚Äôs high-pitched cackle. ‚ÄúGotham‚Äù he said his grin widening impossibly further ‚Äúyour Dark Knight has fallen. But fear not ‚Äì a new protector rises. One who understands that the only way to save this city‚Ä¶ is to embrace the madness.‚Äù     He stood his costume rippling and changing. The blacks and greys bled into purples and greens while still maintaining the silhouette of the Bat. The result was a terrifying fusion of Batman and the Joker a creature of nightmare made flesh.     ‚ÄúThe joke‚Äôs on you Gotham‚Äù he continued spreading his arms wide. ‚ÄúYou thought you needed a hero. But what you really need‚Ä¶ is a little chaos.‚Äù     With that he threw back his head and laughed. It was a sound that contained multitudes ‚Äì the deep restrained chuckle of Bruce Wayne the gravelly growl of Batman the manic cackle of the Joker and something else. Something new and terrifying.     In the control room Ms. Rhymes drank in the sight with undisguised glee. ‚ÄúBeautiful‚Äù she breathed. ‚ÄúAbsolutely beautiful.‚Äù     Samantha Hannah and Sarah watched in horror the full weight of their failure crashing down upon them. They had come to save Batman to stop Ms. Rhymes‚Äô plan. Instead they had witnessed the fall of Gotham‚Äôs greatest hero and the birth of its most terrifying villain.     As the newly reborn Batman-Joker hybrid continued to laugh his voice echoing through the asylum and beyond a chill ran down the spines of all who heard it. For in that laugh was a promise ‚Äì a promise of chaos of madness of a Gotham reshaped in the image of its fallen hero.     The Dark Knight had fallen. And in his place rose something far deadlier ‚Äì a creature of shadow and laughter of justice twisted into madness. Gotham‚Äôs new Clown Prince of Crime had arrived.     And the city would never be the same again.     As the screens went dark plunging the control room into shadows broken only by the eerie glow of emergency lights Ms. Rhymes turned to her stunned audience her eyes gleaming with triumphant madness.     ‚ÄúAnd so‚Äù she said her voice dripping with malicious glee ‚Äúthe curtain falls on this act of our grand performance. But fear not my dears. The show is far from over. In fact‚Ä¶‚Äù Her grin widened becoming something feral and terrifying. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs only just beginning.‚Äù     The asylum echoed with the sound of mad laughter ‚Äì Ms. Rhymes‚Äô the newly reborn Batman‚Äôs and perhaps most chillingly of all the laughter of a city teetering on the brink of total chaos.     In the growing darkness as the weight of their failure pressed down upon them Samantha Hannah and Sarah exchanged grim looks. They had lost this battle but the war for Gotham‚Äôs soul was far from over.     The question now was: in a city without its Dark Knight who would rise to face the coming storm?

BrujayI Want That by sixteen_not_sixteen   Words: 663 Chapters: 1/1 Language: ‰∏≠Êñá-ÊôÆÈÄöËØù ÂúãË™û   Fandoms: DCU Batman - All Media Types   Rating: General Audiences   Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings   Categories: Gen M/M   Characters: Jason Todd Bruce Wayne Alfred Pennyworth Damian Wayne Tim Drake   Relationships: Jason Todd & Bruce Wayne Jason Todd/Bruce Wayne   via https://ift.tt/eKTjkz6

My Adventures With Batman If its one thing we know about the western animation industry its that genuinely original and creative efforts are quickly followed by spinoffs bandwagon jumpers and out-and-out ripoffs  so let‚Äôs take the latest DC Animation darling My Adventures With Superman  for those unfamiliar MAWS is a ground-up reboot of the Superman Mythos that‚Äôs as much a romantic & buddy comedy as it is superheroic drama. It is quite good and I reccommend you watch it.  Naturally one of THE anticipated events for future seasons will be when Batman inevitably shows up which got me thinking on well the equally inevitable Batman spinoff which well see the title of this post.  and here‚Äôs the thing: Its doable?  How do I know because we‚Äôve seen it be done. At least thrice in fact but for simplicity‚Äôs sake lets stick with the most tumblr gif friendly option: The Lego Batman Movie  that is to say my hypothetical MAWB would through its first season anyway deal with Bruce Wayne trying to juggle not only being both Batman and Brucie Wayne Millionaire Playboy but now newly-adoptive father to his young ward Dick Grayson.  Batman: The Brave & The Bold gave us a good starting template as well making Bruce the stoic yet exasperated straight man to the antics of Gotham City‚Äôs collection of rogues and eccentrics and the bitter truth that accepting Robin as his sidekick somehow puts Dick in Less Peril   ‚ÄúAt least this way I can keep an eye on him Alfred‚Äù  ‚ÄúOf course sir I thought the same thing during your ninja phase.‚Äù  ‚ÄúIt wasn‚Äôt a phase it was training alfred.‚Äù  ‚Äúwait‚Äù pause both Bruce and alfred yelp ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre a ninja?‚Äù  as for Dick well he‚Äôs the deuteragonist he‚Äôs taking things in surprising stride and well see all those posts around this hellsite about how he‚Äôs able to somehow get along with the various rogues and drive them to distraction.  as for antagonists the one with lots of potential is of all people Killer Croc as both he and dick were circus folk.   Will I return to this? probably. but in the mean time I release this post into the wild and would like to hear your various takes on things dear followers

post_body: (My apologies for posting a paragraph and actual words instead of art for once üòî)  It‚Äôs hilarious to me that because these batjokes videos literally changed the course of my life this isn‚Äôt an exaggeration.   I was really iffy when it came to comic books then I read the White Knight because of these videos and my brain chemistry changed. I love comic books now. Same for my interest in roleplay games i honestly didn‚Äôt like them and found them boring then I played the Batman telltale games because of these videos. I love roleplaying games now.  I started falling in love with comic book art and I had a new drive to draw and I might want to pursue a career doing comic book art if I‚Äôm able.  I know this is all very silly because of what those videos actually are but my relationship with art books characters video games and media overall changed 3 years ago.  My tumblr account is my love letter to batjokes media and to the community that came from it. Especially to ZalyBrainlessGenius on YouTube and the funny videos that they posted.  (ITS SO HARD TO TAKE MYSELF SERIOUSLY WHEN TYPING WHILE LOOKING AT THE THUMBNAILS)  Ofc this is all super duper cheesy and everything but thank you guys for providing me with one of the best communities I‚Äôve ever been in and the support I‚Äôve been given it‚Äôs meant a lot.  I hope you have an awesome day/night and and thanks for reading all of this.

post_body: Been thinking about a Batfam meets the Justice League situation where Nightwing has been in the League for a bit a no one knows how he‚Äôs connected to Batman. And for one reason or another the League grudgingly needs Deathstroke‚Äôs help for a mission. And Deathstroke agrees to help but specifies ‚Äúno Bats‚Äù.  And the Justice League assumes he just means ‚Äúno Batman‚Äù. So the bring Nightwing with them and also do not tell him about this stipulation.   -the justice league approaches Deathstroke on a rooftop-  -Deathstroke immidiately turns to leave-  Green Arrow: Wait I thought you agreed to help us!  Deathstroke: And I thought you agreed no Bats.   Flash: We did! We left Bats back at the Watchtower.   Deathstroke: No. No Bats. Plural. I‚Äôm not gonna survive i‚Äôm gonna live read it on AO3 at https://ift.tt/uVeqGP3   by Izerua   The only things Gus remembers from his early years are white coats and cages many cages all bad memories.   There is one good memory though: his Pubba. Every day his dad repeated the same words over and over even in his last moments.   ‚ÄúGus you are a special boy. Everything about you is special. Not everyone will think the same. Some people will want to hurt you and take that from you. That‚Äôs why you should never show your special features to anyone. Do you understand?‚Äù   Gus tilted his head ‚ÄúEven you Pubba?‚Äù   ‚ÄúNo‚Äú he answered. "Pubba is an exception because he will protect you from the bad guys. It‚Äôs a promise.‚Äù   He kept his promise. His Pubba protected him but in exchange for his life.   Now Gus is in Gotham all alone within the grasp of the world that took his Pubba from him with bad guys still tracking him down. He wants a hug his Pubba and a donut but mainly a hug. post_body: Bruce has so much weight on his shoulders at all times balancing his work and home life being a vigilante and a himbo having to guard his emotions and identity dealing with eight kids and unappreciative team members and he never breaks. He doesn‚Äôt falter doesn‚Äôt fall. He holds the weight and adds to it pushing himself harder memorizing contingencies in case one of his friends becomes a threat even though it would kill him to have to use any of them. Sorry. Idk. Bruce just has so much shit on his shoulders and people give him such unnecessary garbage for certain things when I‚Äôm just like‚Ä¶ how would you handle It?     Like I read a snippet of a comic in a store line one time and it was Dicks perspective and he had something he had to do I think it‚Äôs when he‚Äôs Batman and he is like ‚Äòthis is all so hard. So fucking difficult. I feel like I‚Äôm about to come apart at the seams. Is this what Bruce felt like? How was he able to do this for so long? And o don‚Äôt even have half his responsibility‚Äô and I just need it to be addressed that Bruce has a ton of shit going on at all hours of the day and is trying okay

post_body: the argument that Bruce would never be Batman or wouldn‚Äôt hold his ideals if he wasn‚Äôt wealthy is kinda dumb imo.  I think that one of the biggest differences it‚Äôd make it‚Äôs making him more close to middle and low class Gothamites and their struggles he‚Äôd be more of a detective and hero for the people.  Then he‚Äôd find a way to have the same/similar training during the years he‚Äôd be gone from Gotham (he‚Äôd acquire some crazy dad lore).   Then he wouldn‚Äôt adopt but he‚Äôd take him under his wing an older and angrier Dick who‚Äôs set on revenge and getting his ass kicked by criminals. With Jason it‚Äôd be slightly similar but instead of training he‚Äôd give him a small job to do instead of stealing (most likely he‚Äôd have a place where to teach self defense or be a mechanic that has plenty side jobs). The other kids acquisition/introduction to vigilantism would be pretty close to canon though.  Since he probably would try to keep a low profile and be less batman and work as bruce most of the time the Batman would be more of a legend and wouldn‚Äôt meet other heroes for quite a while.  Also let‚Äôs not forget that Gotham would lack the work that Bruce Wayne does as Bruce Wayne so it‚Äôd be interesting to see how his absence would affect the city.

post_body: ALT

I think Joker is a bit like the Doctor in Doctor Who: your favourite version of the character is the one you discovered first (usually).  In my case I don‚Äôt really have a favourite Joker (for now) because I find most interpretations interesting but this guy will always have a special place in my heart:  I discovered the Joker and part of Batman‚Äôs lore with the Lego Batman games and this version laid the foundations of what I appreciate in a Joker namely humour smile (it may be funny but many tend to forget these two elements) insolence intelligence/ingenuity unpredictability the fact that he‚Äôs always one step ahead of everyone else his class his vicious side both narcissistic and selfless and of course his relationship with Batman; that it‚Äôs written like a romance that his affection for him is both obvious and subtle and that he refuses to kill him because otherwise his life wouldn‚Äôt be funny anymore.  But maybe it‚Äôs just me idk

post_body: Superman: Red Son (2020)

Some Cool Things I‚Äôd Like to Share Ok so I‚Äôm kind of obsessive about continuity and reading characters with long histories ‚Äúin order.‚Äù This has recently manifested in me attempting to read the entire Post-Crisis history of Batman and all his little Gotham people. I specifically wanted to read it all in order of publication not in the ‚Äútimeline‚Äù order that you can find in all the reading orders online where ‚ÄúYear One‚Äù style comics like Matt Wagner‚Äôs Mad Monk retelling or The Long Halloween will be among the first comics on the list because of how early they are in Bruce‚Äôs career. Not that there‚Äôs anything wrong with those lists I‚Äôm just weird and particular. So after searching for ages to try to find this magic list that would meet all of my weird needs (and finding nothing) I decided I would make my own. So finally after like 10 lines of reading here‚Äôs the point of this post: a 3000+ cell Google Spreadsheet of every single Batfamily title and notable storyline from mid-1986 to September 2011. This took me a full week to make and I tried really hard to include everything. Every main title mini-series and one-shot; in order of publication. And it‚Äôs color-coded. Here are the guidelines I used while making it if anyone is still reading:  I tried to keep it fairly ‚Äúarc‚Äù based so as not to break up storylines. I didn‚Äôt want a reader to have to switch to a different title every single issue. No ‚Äúmajor‚Äù team-ups. Basically this means no Justice League Young Justice Teen Titans etc. (with the exception of Outsiders from 2008 as it ties in to Bruce‚Äôs death and all of the aftermath). World‚Äôs Finest/Trinity stuff is fair game and was included though. I am totally open to criticism/suggestions. If anyone ever sees this and then if they click the link on top of that and see something they don‚Äôt like or they think should change get in touch! I‚Äôm open to changing anything and the majority of the list consists of comics that I haven‚Äôt even read so I can‚Äôt check the validity of their placement. Please tell me if you see something I screwed up. Ok that‚Äôs it I can‚Äôt think of anything else important so enjoy if you choose to look at my fun little list. I have ADHD and suffer intense hyperfixations so hopefully that provides the real explanation for why I did this. I really gotta work on making shorter posts.

Hi Alright so if I want to make this a real blog I guess I have to post. So I guess I should say some introductory stuff for the 3 people who will see this or whatever.  This is basically going to be a fun little comic blog where I post my thoughts on characters I like or whatever I happen to be reading.   I can‚Äôt think of how to structure this post any further so I‚Äôm just going to list things that are probably relevant.  I‚Äôm a huge DC Comics fan have been since I was 11 (I‚Äôm 19 now) but I‚Äôve always loved superheroes I really love the Doom Patrol. Comics show everything. They‚Äôre my favorites and Rebis is my favorite character like ever. I do still like Marvel mainly Spider-Man Daredevil and the X-Men are the guys I‚Äôm super invested in on that side. I‚Äôm a major continuity/canon nerd. I‚Äôm weird about how I read things and I‚Äôm kind of obsessed with doing it ‚Äúin order.‚Äù So for example my big project right now is reading all of the post-crisis Batman stuff. I‚Äôve also read all of the main Spidey titles from 1963 up to around 1988 and all the X-Men stuff up until around 1982. I don‚Äôt know what else to say so I guess here‚Äôs a link to my League of Comic Geeks profile so any of the 3 of you who are still reading this can actually look at what I‚Äôve read so I don‚Äôt feel like having to explain my ‚Äúcredentials.‚Äù Ok I‚Äôm done now I‚Äôll post again soon I think.

I think Joker is a bit like the Doctor in Doctor Who: your favourite version of the character is the one you discovered first (usually).  In my case I don‚Äôt really have a favourite Joker (for now) because I find most interpretations interesting but this guy will always have a special place in my heart:  I discovered the Joker and part of Batman‚Äôs lore with the Lego Batman games and this version laid the foundations of what I appreciate in a Joker namely humour smile (it may be funny but many tend to forget these two elements) insolence intelligence/ingenuity unpredictability the fact that he‚Äôs always one step ahead of everyone else his class his vicious side both narcissistic and selfless and of course his relationship with Batman; that it‚Äôs written like a romance that his affection for him is both obvious and subtle and that he refuses to kill him because otherwise his life wouldn‚Äôt be funny anymore.  But maybe it‚Äôs just me idk
