Some Cool Things I‚Äôd Like to Share Ok so I‚Äôm kind of obsessive about continuity and reading characters with long histories ‚Äúin order.‚Äù This has recently manifested in me attempting to read the entire Post-Crisis history of Batman and all his little Gotham people. I specifically wanted to read it all in order of publication not in the ‚Äútimeline‚Äù order that you can find in all the reading orders online where ‚ÄúYear One‚Äù style comics like Matt Wagner‚Äôs Mad Monk retelling or The Long Halloween will be among the first comics on the list because of how early they are in Bruce‚Äôs career. Not that there‚Äôs anything wrong with those lists I‚Äôm just weird and particular. So after searching for ages to try to find this magic list that would meet all of my weird needs (and finding nothing) I decided I would make my own. So finally after like 10 lines of reading here‚Äôs the point of this post: a 3000+ cell Google Spreadsheet of every single Batfamily title and notable storyline from mid-1986 to September 2011. This took me a full week to make and I tried really hard to include everything. Every main title mini-series and one-shot; in order of publication. And it‚Äôs color-coded. Here are the guidelines I used while making it if anyone is still reading:  I tried to keep it fairly ‚Äúarc‚Äù based so as not to break up storylines. I didn‚Äôt want a reader to have to switch to a different title every single issue. No ‚Äúmajor‚Äù team-ups. Basically this means no Justice League Young Justice Teen Titans etc. (with the exception of Outsiders from 2008 as it ties in to Bruce‚Äôs death and all of the aftermath). World‚Äôs Finest/Trinity stuff is fair game and was included though. I am totally open to criticism/suggestions. If anyone ever sees this and then if they click the link on top of that and see something they don‚Äôt like or they think should change get in touch! I‚Äôm open to changing anything and the majority of the list consists of comics that I haven‚Äôt even read so I can‚Äôt check the validity of their placement. Please tell me if you see something I screwed up. Ok that‚Äôs it I can‚Äôt think of anything else important so enjoy if you choose to look at my fun little list. I have ADHD and suffer intense hyperfixations so hopefully that provides the real explanation for why I did this. I really gotta work on making shorter posts.

World‚Äôs Finest/Trinity stuff is fair game and was included though. I am totally open to criticism/suggestions. I‚Äôm open to changing anything and the majority of the list consists of comics that I haven‚Äôt even read so I can‚Äôt check the validity of their placement. Please tell me if you see something I screwed up. Ok that‚Äôs it I can‚Äôt think of anything else important so enjoy if you choose to look at my fun little list. I have ADHD and suffer intense hyperfixations so hopefully that provides the real explanation for why I did this. I really gotta work on making shorter posts.

post_body: golden feathers and gotham What can be said of the former Robins that has not already been said? Children given weapons and permission to right wrongs as they saw fit. Little soldiers in an endless crusade for justice.  But you should have seen ‚Äòem.  The first well he was a showman to the core. He was a performer- all dazzling smiles and extra flips. His adoring audience those he saved gained protection forevermore and (arguably more importantly) hope. He was a hero- and lives were saved behind his little golden cape.  The second a smaller boy was a fighter. He was passionate- a force of nature sent to make Batman laugh and villains cower. He ran the rooftops dropping in on homeless camps and doing bed checks on the street kids. He defended the weak- he grinned boldly in the face of danger (he carried on his predecessor‚Äôs legacy). He was a protector- and lives were saved behind his little golden cape.  The third a lanky thing was a strategist. He was calculating- a whirlwind of snark and careful planning. He largely stuck to the shadows keeping Batman in check and investigating. He stopped villains on their way to commit crimes- he patrolled the worst parts of Gotham (carrying on his predecessor‚Äôs legacy). He was a detective- and lives were saved with every glimpse of his little golden cape.  The fourth a girl strangely enough was a menace. She was vibrant- a flash of blonde hair and skillful violence. She capitalized on the bright lights of dark alleys and made herself known. She helped victims make their way to clinics and shelters- she destroyed criminal enterprises on whims (carrying on her predecessor‚Äôs legacy). She was a force- and lives were saved in the shine of her golden cape.  The fifth another slip of a thing was potentially demonic. He was a terror- a glint of a blade and caustic remarks. He slunk through the shadows lingering in the one cast by Batman. The violence left in his path made those who would hurt others tremble. He trussed up meta villains with ease- he collected names from shelters and served justice and vengeance without issue (carrying on his predecessor‚Äôs legacy). He was an avenging angel- and lives were saved with every soft flutter of his little golden cape.  Each one vanished- replaced and never seen again. A chasm of fear and grief left in their wake felt in every person who found solace in their little golden capes.  But you should have seen 'em.

post_body: It‚Äôs In My Blood   Okay random idea centered around halfas that I just had to share.  What if besides death followed by resurrection via a source of ectoplasm a human-ghost hybrid could also be created She Hulk style. And by that I mean the old school comics. Not that spiteful heap of garbage masquerading as a tv adaptation made by that toxically bitter hack Jessica Gao.  This can be applied to whatever hero/villain you choose I‚Äôm going with Batman. Mostly because I haven‚Äôt seen many half ghost Bruce Wayne posts.  Anyway the scenario starts off with Alfred finding Danny roaming the streets in search of food due to running away from foster care. (Jack and Maddy left him there in the hopes of keeping him safe from the GIW after Wes finally succeeded in outing him to all of Amity) And through lots of gentle coaxing convinces him to let Alfred take him home.  Eventually Danny gets so attached he readily agrees to being adopted into the Wayne family by Alfred. Once enough trust has been built overtime to share identities Gotham automatically gains a new protector.  Then the further establishment of new relationships is suddenly interrupted by a full-scale alien invasion requiring all hands on deck. Though all the heroes manage to hold their own for the most part it quickly becomes clear they may not win this battle if they don‚Äôt find something to turn the tide in their favor.  They get that something in the form of Phantom rallying all his ghost allies/frenemies to join the fight. With their added power the entirety of the alien army is thoroughly beaten back. But not before Batman takes a hit hard enough to cause him to bleed out at an alarming rate.  The already dire situation worsens all the more when it‚Äôs discovered that Batman is a rare blood type and no one in the batclan or even the other human heroes matches. All save for Phantom. Problem is with all that ecto mixed with his blood a transfusion could possibly poison or worse kill his big brother. Everyone is aware of this. But any other option would take too long and Batman doesn‚Äôt have much time left.  So with bated breath and reluctance Phantom gives his blood. For a few scary minutes it looks like Batman might be showing signs of rejection. But then he slowly begins to stabilize giving the medical team much needed breathing room to get him properly tended to.   While Bats may be on the mend no one‚Äôs relaxing just yet. And not for a lack of trying. It‚Äôs just a little hard to be chill when Mr. Dark and Broody has started randomly going invisible or intangible speaking with an echo levitating over his bed and overall become creepily unsettling to look at. Especially with that unnatural glow in his eyes.

post_body: Goon Squad my beloved
Batman #405: Year One  by Frank Miller; David Mazzucchelli; Richmond Lewis and Todd Klein  DC

Sega Mega Drive - Batman Title: Batman / „Éê„ÉÉ„Éà„Éû„É≥  Developer/Publisher: Sunsoft  Release date: 27 July 1990  Catalogue No.: T-15043  Genre: Platform Action  My mother loved this game when it was first released in 1990 (the year my brother was born) so when I saw it the other day I thought I‚Äôd pick it up. I love the small little box it comes in too. In fact I think all Sunsoft Mega Drive games in Japan came in these little boxes such as their conversion of the Sega classic dubbed Super Fantasy Zone. After playing Batman earlier on today I realized that this game has aged quite a bit. The music is still pretty cool with its excellent deep bass tracks and funky tunes. Sadly the game‚Äôs looks are now looking a bit worse for wear.   Of all the Batman games that were released in 1989-1990 Sunsoft‚Äôs version for the Mega Drive holds true to the film which was rare for movie-based games of the time (which usually took incredible ‚Äúartistic liberties‚Äù with the plot). The gameplay remains interesting due to the cutscenes and sharp graphics and the vehicle levels break up any potential monotony to be found in the game. While not an enduring classic it‚Äôs definitely worth a look for Batman fans and a solid game in its own right. Don‚Äôt be put off by the fact the game shipped on a 4 Megabit cartridge. But overall it‚Äôs still a classic game that should be in any Mega Drive collector‚Äôs collection.  Below you can see a scan of the actual game cartridge (top front and back) and instruction book.

post_body: so all ive been able to think about is gotham for the past several days and more specifically how gothamite culture has to be SO drastically different and jarring to literally anywhere else in the world. Like even other super cities like metropolis or central city or wherever else are at least KINDA normal. Like yea u have superman or wonderwoman or the flash but they dont really have to deal with the same level of bs as Gotham.   That being said here are a list of things that I think are extremely normal to Gotham and other things that happen in thay horrible little city:  <!-- more --> ‚Ä¢ the episode of Hot Ones with Brucie Wayne where no one thinks he‚Äôll even be able to stand the 2nd or 3rd wing but he eats all of them with no reaction and Sean Evans (or the in universe equivalent) just sits there like ‚Äúwow no one has ever had literally no reaction before this is really crazy and Bruce Wayne of all people?‚Äù Afterwards Bruce has second thoughts and realizes that maybe he should have played up his reaction to the spice a bit more. People Inside of Gotham are a little shocked because everytime he eats in public it is the most boring bland flavorless food imaginable. (he handled the spice so well because Batman is ready for all potential threats and forms of torture. Ridiculous levels of spice included)     ‚Ä¢ Gotham schools offer courses in self defense. In some school districts its actually mandatory thats usually in old gotham or downtown gotham. In more affluent areas self defense is still taught in schools but most kids are sent to some ritzy trainer to make sure they can defend themselves.     ‚Ä¢ No one even blinks when theres a new vigilante by the time Damian comes around. Theres still a little buzz but by the time Duke shows up people are like ‚ÄúOh cool another one. HEY BRO WHATS YOUR NAME.‚Äù I saw someone post here about how when the Wayne kids get mad at Bruce they go to Selina and make public appearances as Stray Catwomans sidekick. I personally believe that Tim was the first one to do it but Dick does it the most and gothamites didnt even need to get used to Stray showing up sometimes nor did people really care that Stray was always wildly different heights shapes colors etc. the additude is kinda like ‚ÄúI have taxes and job security to worry about. If a new vigilante is what were doing then so be it.‚Äù     ‚Ä¢ People tend to think that Gothamites aren‚Äôt smart but that city is home to the Richest smartest most creative people alive. They mostly just lack morals. Like Dr. Freeze Harley Quinn hell even The Riddler are all insanely intelligent. Half of Gothams Villains have at minimum 2 Doctorates in something or other. Gotham generates a lot of cash as a whole and small businesses thrive there. They have high employment rates and most citizens have their associates despite everything happening around them. People who have never been to Gotham before expect to have to talk down to the citizens but Gothamites just kinda roll their eyes at them and carry on about their merriment.     ‚Ä¢ Gothamites CONSTANTLY says ‚Äúbecause I‚Äôm Batman‚Äù when they don‚Äôt want to explain themselves. Kids hear it a lot from parents and they also get ‚ÄúIf you don‚Äôt go to sleep Condiment Man i gonna come and cover you in stinky relish.‚Äù Because truly what else is condiment man good for.     ‚Ä¢ Gothamites who work at BatBurger and typically work the night shift are used to visits from Batman Robin Red Hood Cat Woman Harley Quinn etc. Sometimes they remember the workers and ask about their family and how life is and other things like that. Theres some barely 18 y/o who just graduated high school who worls at Bat Burger and asked Red Hood to help him impress his gf by saying theyre friends. He like fuck it why not and tells the gf that the kid helped him save an old lady‚Äôs cat in a tree and now theyre bffs. She totally believes it. Score.     ‚Ä¢ I see the Gotham thinks Batman is Bruce Wayne‚Äôs boyfriend theories and raise you: Its pretty common knowledge that Bruce Wayne is Batman just no one has the heart to tell him. Also theyre scared he will quit if anyone brings it up. So from this Gothamites created the joke that BW and batman are dating and when asked about it in an interview dick grayson is like ‚Äú‚Ä¶‚Ä¶yes! My adoptive father is dating the guy who dressed up like a bat every night‚Ä¶!‚Äù      ‚Ä¢ this cuased and arguement between Bruce and Dick because no! Bruce isnt dating Batman! (stray was seen again that week) HE IS BATMAN! But fuck now the public thinks theyre a couple so now bruce gets asked about it and hes like ‚Äúhaha yes my spooky bat bf is who i love very dearly!‚Äù As punishment He makes Dick bring him flowers in the batsuit because ‚Äúas far as he is concerned this is his shithead son‚Äôs fault.‚Äù Thats a direct quote btw. Little does he know this somehow ties back to Tim Drake before they met.

post_body: purely vibes. i want a game like gotham knights but that has the rest of the batkids and no major overarching plot (or a bit of an overarching plot just to keeps things moving). it‚Äôs just them going on patrols investigating cases interacting with each and going on missions.  Tim‚Äôs path would have him do things at Wayne Enterprise and mini quests like ‚ÄúFind 5 pieces of blackmail to oust one particular Board member.‚Äù Damian‚Äôs would have ‚Äúlocate the mother of the stray kittens.‚Äù Jason‚Äôs could be ‚Äúgo around and check up on the kids in Crime Alley.‚Äù Cass has a dance mini game like in FF7R. Dick would have one were he has to do tricks like the quadruple somersault or 100 push ups while balancing on his hands because one of the other batkids (probably Jason) tells him he‚Äôs losing his touch and getting old or something like that.   like any job board in rpg games you will have a list of missions on the Batcomputer where you get to select what case/mission to do and who gets to do it. You then get to play it with that character.  More ambitiously some cases have to be solved by multiple characters. You cannot progress until other characters manage to do their parts. Other model would be that the case are locked to certain character or characters but sometimes they can team up. In which case you get to be the lead party member with the others following you as support (like in Dragon Age!)  When you select a major case you get a short cutscene with Bruce summarizing it for you and handing you the file and saying ‚ÄúI‚Äôm counting on you. Good luck.‚Äù   Additionally we can‚Äôt have a game without a relationship building mechanic right????? So you get to do stuff with other characters and unlock cutscenes with them with special conversations ala Fire Emblem Three Houses or Persona 5!  The Gotham Knight‚Äôs email system was really cool so that stays but can also be expanded to text messages or group chats. So while you‚Äôre walking around doing whatever you‚Äôre doing you will get texts from your friend group. Like Tim would have Kon Cassie and Bart text him silly things; Jason would have Roy texting him about Lian or Kori sending him encouraging messages; Cass would have Steph messaging her at odd hours etc.  There is a whole training/tutorial sequence when you get to train with Bruce but with character specific weapons and abilities.  This is basically a mash up of my favorite things from DA FF7R P5 Yakuza series

post_body: Oswald frowned in confusion ‚Äú Where is the old Gabe? Is he alright?‚Äù   New-Gabe shrugged ‚Äú Boss kicked him out cuz he‚Äôs too old and slow. ‚Äú   ‚Äú I‚Äôm the boss.‚Äù Oswald scoffed ‚Äú I‚Äôd probably remember if I fired him.‚Äù   ‚Äú New boss‚Äù New-Gabe said in a bored tone ‚Äú Mr Ogilvy the Emperor penguin. boss says no more visits. He can handle The Lounge on his own.‚Äù  Oswald couldn‚Äôt help but laugh. Which caught the teen off guard. Even Though a guard stood there Oswald didn‚Äôt hesitate to push his fingernails into the back of New-Gabe‚Äôs hands. He leaned in close and grinned ‚Äú Tell the emperor penguin to come visit me tomorrow.‚Äù   ‚Äú but there are no visits tomorrow.‚Äù   ‚Äú I DON‚ÄôT CARE! ‚Äù Oswald screeched‚Äù If he‚Äôs an Emperor penguin he‚Äôd find a way to come see me.‚Äù   ‚Äú Y-Yes boss.‚Äù New-Gabe stammered.  ( The Penguin And The Peacock chapter 23 )

post_body: purely vibes. i want a game like gotham knights but that has the rest of the batkids and no major overarching plot (or a bit of an overarching plot just to keeps things moving). it‚Äôs just them going on patrols investigating cases interacting with each and going on missions.  Tim‚Äôs path would have him do things at Wayne Enterprise and mini quests like ‚ÄúFind 5 pieces of blackmail to oust one particular Board member.‚Äù Damian‚Äôs would have ‚Äúlocate the mother of the stray kittens.‚Äù Jason‚Äôs could be ‚Äúgo around and check up on the kids in Crime Alley.‚Äù Cass has a dance mini game like in FF7R. Dick would have one were he has to do tricks like the quadruple somersault or 100 push ups while balancing on his hands because one of the other batkids (probably Jason) tells him he‚Äôs losing his touch and getting old or something like that.   like any job board in rpg games you will have a list of missions on the Batcomputer where you get to select what case/mission to do and who gets to do it. You then get to play it with that character.  More ambitiously some cases have to be solved by multiple characters. You cannot progress until other characters manage to do their parts. Other model would be that the case are locked to certain character or characters but sometimes they can team up. In which case you get to be the lead party member with the others following you as support (like in Dragon Age!)  When you select a major case you get a short cutscene with Bruce summarizing it for you and handing you the file and saying ‚ÄúI‚Äôm counting on you. Good luck.‚Äù   Additionally we can‚Äôt have a game without a relationship building mechanic right????? So you get to do stuff with other characters and unlock cutscenes with them with special conversations ala Fire Emblem Three Houses or Persona 5!  The Gotham Knight‚Äôs email system was really cool so that stays but can also be expanded to text messages or group chats. So while you‚Äôre walking around doing whatever you‚Äôre doing you will get texts from your friend group. Like Tim would have Kon Cassie and Bart text him silly things; Jason would have Roy texting him about Lian or Kori sending him encouraging messages; Cass would have Steph messaging her at odd hours etc.  There is a whole training/tutorial sequence when you get to train with Bruce but with character specific weapons and abilities.  This is basically a mash up of my favorite things from DA FF7R P5 Yakuza series

post_body: I need y'all to understand that Bruce is not a normal billionaire. He is a billionaire because it‚Äôs useful to the plot but he is not a billionaire like our billionaires. Don‚Äôt make him say or do shits billionaires do he is not like that.  I just have enough of the posts and fics where people makes Bruce pro-capitalist a finance bro with nfts or against leftist ideas like free housing because ‚Äúthe economy üò≠üò≠‚Äù. That‚Äôs not him at all and y'all are showing that you only saw the Lego Batman movie.  First Bruce pays his taxes and hates that other rich don‚Äôt. It is shown in Future State: Dark Detective where he literally says that rich people who don‚Äôt contribute to making society better kind of deserve to be killed by a vigilante. Murder is still bad but he will not cry them AT ALL.  Second Bruce hates how people abuse the housing markets rising the prices kicking out poor people you know the drill. This is shown in Batman: White Knight when Bruce PUNCHES his rich FRIEND at a gala after learning that the guy is buying properties in Crime Alley kicks the poor people out and build new apartments complexes with rent way too high for the old residents. In Gotham Knights (the comics) he tests Lucius by playing the normal rich asshole and being like ‚Äúwe can‚Äôt take money from the shareholders these hard working folks to help the poor‚Äù because he wants to see if it will make Lucius angry. Once it does he is like ‚Äúgood you should be‚Äù and tell him he will sign it. Not being mad at the inequalities in the world is not acceptable for Bruce.  Thirdly Batman: The Animated Series often establishes how the real vilains are not the rogues but rich people. Bruce doesn‚Äôt disagree with Poison Ivy or Mr Freeze but with their methods. Bruce doesn‚Äôt hate his rogues because he knows they were pushed to a corner but he hates the rich in charge. The owner of a company is shown to be a bad guy because he doesn‚Äôt think his workers deserve to have a say in the company. Seriously if BTAS was made today we would be submerged with tweets and videos from people crying that they made Batman a communist.  Fourthly while we are at it with BTAS Bruce cares about the environment. I have seen this terrible panel of Bruce as Batman being mad that Poison Ivy and Harley Quinn destroyed a WE factory who was heavily polluting which is ooc. In BTAS Bruce is shown threatening to fire WE higher-ups because they made a partnership with a company hurting the environment. This partnership is why Poison Ivy targets him in the episode and tries to kill him btw which shows once again that they agree on the matter it‚Äôs the murder the problem. Outside of BTAS must I remind everyone that Bruce was going to marry Talia Al Ghul and that Ra‚Äôs Al Ghul saw a heir in him??? Like he has to be a bit of an ecologist for ECO-TERRORISTS to love him this much. Also Alfred said to Dick when he joined their household that Alfred wants ecological issues to be taken care of. No way would Bruce not has been raised to care about the environment or would harm the planet knowing Alfred doesn‚Äôt like it.  Finally WE has multiple charities and organizations dedicated to help people in Gotham. WE gives jobs to ex-convicts and help them in getting rehabilitate. Bruce feeds clothes and houses the poor he pays for any damage done by vigilantes or rogues. He has money to give and he gives it. AND all the galas exist so he can take money from the rich to give to the poor. He even encourages Dick in Nightwing (2016) to manipulate as much as possible his guests to milk their money. Bruce wants to take from the rich to help the poor that‚Äôs always been the case.
The Bat

Sega Mega Drive - Batman Title: Batman / „Éê„ÉÉ„Éà„Éû„É≥  Developer/Publisher: Sunsoft  Release date: 27 July 1990  Catalogue No.: T-15043  Genre: Platform Action  My mother loved this game when it was first released in 1990 (the year my brother was born) so when I saw it the other day I thought I‚Äôd pick it up. I love the small little box it comes in too. In fact I think all Sunsoft Mega Drive games in Japan came in these little boxes such as their conversion of the Sega classic dubbed Super Fantasy Zone. After playing Batman earlier on today I realized that this game has aged quite a bit. The music is still pretty cool with its excellent deep bass tracks and funky tunes. Sadly the game‚Äôs looks are now looking a bit worse for wear.   Of all the Batman games that were released in 1989-1990 Sunsoft‚Äôs version for the Mega Drive holds true to the film which was rare for movie-based games of the time (which usually took incredible ‚Äúartistic liberties‚Äù with the plot). The gameplay remains interesting due to the cutscenes and sharp graphics and the vehicle levels break up any potential monotony to be found in the game. While not an enduring classic it‚Äôs definitely worth a look for Batman fans and a solid game in its own right. Don‚Äôt be put off by the fact the game shipped on a 4 Megabit cartridge. But overall it‚Äôs still a classic game that should be in any Mega Drive collector‚Äôs collection.  Below you can see a scan of the actual game cartridge (top front and back) and instruction book.

post_body: so all ive been able to think about is gotham for the past several days and more specifically how gothamite culture has to be SO drastically different and jarring to literally anywhere else in the world. Like even other super cities like metropolis or central city or wherever else are at least KINDA normal. Like yea u have superman or wonderwoman or the flash but they dont really have to deal with the same level of bs as Gotham.   That being said here are a list of things that I think are extremely normal to Gotham and other things that happen in thay horrible little city:  <!-- more --> ‚Ä¢ the episode of Hot Ones with Brucie Wayne where no one thinks he‚Äôll even be able to stand the 2nd or 3rd wing but he eats all of them with no reaction and Sean Evans (or the in universe equivalent) just sits there like ‚Äúwow no one has ever had literally no reaction before this is really crazy and Bruce Wayne of all people?‚Äù Afterwards Bruce has second thoughts and realizes that maybe he should have played up his reaction to the spice a bit more. People Inside of Gotham are a little shocked because everytime he eats in public it is the most boring bland flavorless food imaginable. (he handled the spice so well because Batman is ready for all potential threats and forms of torture. Ridiculous levels of spice included)     ‚Ä¢ Gotham schools offer courses in self defense. In some school districts its actually mandatory thats usually in old gotham or downtown gotham. In more affluent areas self defense is still taught in schools but most kids are sent to some ritzy trainer to make sure they can defend themselves.     ‚Ä¢ No one even blinks when theres a new vigilante by the time Damian comes around. Theres still a little buzz but by the time Duke shows up people are like ‚ÄúOh cool another one. HEY BRO WHATS YOUR NAME.‚Äù I saw someone post here about how when the Wayne kids get mad at Bruce they go to Selina and make public appearances as Stray Catwomans sidekick. I personally believe that Tim was the first one to do it but Dick does it the most and gothamites didnt even need to get used to Stray showing up sometimes nor did people really care that Stray was always wildly different heights shapes colors etc. the additude is kinda like ‚ÄúI have taxes and job security to worry about. If a new vigilante is what were doing then so be it.‚Äù     ‚Ä¢ People tend to think that Gothamites aren‚Äôt smart but that city is home to the Richest smartest most creative people alive. They mostly just lack morals. Like Dr. Freeze Harley Quinn hell even The Riddler are all insanely intelligent. Half of Gothams Villains have at minimum 2 Doctorates in something or other. Gotham generates a lot of cash as a whole and small businesses thrive there. They have high employment rates and most citizens have their associates despite everything happening around them. People who have never been to Gotham before expect to have to talk down to the citizens but Gothamites just kinda roll their eyes at them and carry on about their merriment.     ‚Ä¢ Gothamites CONSTANTLY says ‚Äúbecause I‚Äôm Batman‚Äù when they don‚Äôt want to explain themselves. Kids hear it a lot from parents and they also get ‚ÄúIf you don‚Äôt go to sleep Condiment Man i gonna come and cover you in stinky relish.‚Äù Because truly what else is condiment man good for.     ‚Ä¢ Gothamites who work at BatBurger and typically work the night shift are used to visits from Batman Robin Red Hood Cat Woman Harley Quinn etc. Sometimes they remember the workers and ask about their family and how life is and other things like that. Theres some barely 18 y/o who just graduated high school who worls at Bat Burger and asked Red Hood to help him impress his gf by saying theyre friends. He like fuck it why not and tells the gf that the kid helped him save an old lady‚Äôs cat in a tree and now theyre bffs. She totally believes it. Score.     ‚Ä¢ I see the Gotham thinks Batman is Bruce Wayne‚Äôs boyfriend theories and raise you: Its pretty common knowledge that Bruce Wayne is Batman just no one has the heart to tell him. Also theyre scared he will quit if anyone brings it up. So from this Gothamites created the joke that BW and batman are dating and when asked about it in an interview dick grayson is like ‚Äú‚Ä¶‚Ä¶yes! My adoptive father is dating the guy who dressed up like a bat every night‚Ä¶!‚Äù      ‚Ä¢ this cuased and arguement between Bruce and Dick because no! Bruce isnt dating Batman! (stray was seen again that week) HE IS BATMAN! But fuck now the public thinks theyre a couple so now bruce gets asked about it and hes like ‚Äúhaha yes my spooky bat bf is who i love very dearly!‚Äù As punishment He makes Dick bring him flowers in the batsuit because ‚Äúas far as he is concerned this is his shithead son‚Äôs fault.‚Äù Thats a direct quote btw. Little does he know this somehow ties back to Tim Drake before they met.

post_body: Okay so I decided to go through my stickers today and find them a bigger box. Doing this I came across this Batman Begins sticker mountain that I bought on a whim because I got the entire display case for 3 bucks in 2020.   Now. Imagine you‚Äôre a kid in 2005 and you‚Äôve just watched Batman. You want the merch. You want the collectible stickers. Your parents say ‚ÄúNo those just looks screenshots from the movie.‚Äù  You say.   Fuck you mom I wish I had no parents like Batman and you buy them anyway.   So  You open the pack of expensive trading card sticker‚Ä¶things.   And this greets you   I LAUGHED LIKE A DONKEY. WHY did they choose THAT pose? Does he instill fear in you??? Does he look cool?? And those white specks??? THAT‚ÄôS FROM THE LOW QUALITY COLOR INK HAVING RUBBED OFF FROM LAYING AGAINST ANOTHER STICKER. STAGNANT.   ‚ÄúOh geez this really was my favourite scene I wish I could have a sticker for each frame!!!!‚Äù   BRUHHH THIS IS NOTHING. I know it‚Äôs a panorama picture but holy shit   THERE‚ÄôS MORE OF THESE. I AM SO CONFUSED. IMAGINE YOUR 8 YEAR OLD CHILD JUST HAS A COLLECTION OF THESE SPECIFIC MOMENTS FROM THE MOVIE (I would have been that 8 year old child if they had been available here)  Someone at warner bros just saw a potential goldmine in those landscape stickers and ran with it holy shit. This is so magical. I love it.   Please stay tuned for more goofy stickers

post_body: The Batfam and cooking  Alfred: we have so much canon info about this one. He takes pride in meeting the demands of his grandkids but the kids sometimes just pretend to like it for his peace of mind. Bruce: No. And I don‚Äôt mean in the meme way. He‚Äôs more than capable of sustaining himself and following instructions. He also chooses to subsist on those ‚Äúnutritional milkshakes‚Äù. Like to him is not a matter of learning how to cook he‚Äôs a chemist measuring his exact nutritional needs in a cup. It‚Äôs disgusting and he shouldn‚Äôt be allowed near the blender. Barbara Gordon: not the best not the worst. She has cooked she will cook again. She‚Äôs also not trying to make anything too fancy. She prefers take out mainly because she has (and will again in the future) burnt her food to a crisp because she got distracted with oracle stuff. A quick check while the potatoes are in the oven is a very dangerous thing. Dick Grayson: he would love to be that guy that takes Instagramable pictures of his food. Sometimes he manages to do just that but that‚Äôs not sustainable for him. He has a few fancy recipes he likes to bring out to impress people or to feel like a responsible adult. Most of the time he‚Äôs sauteing random vegetables with some rice and chicken and calling it a day. It‚Äôs good healthy and filling but is not much in the great scheme of things. I feel like he‚Äôd make really good salads too for some reason. Cassandra Cain: she‚Äôs not very good at being people. Cooking is part of that a survival skill and not much more. She really appreciates nice food but doesn‚Äôt see the point in learning herself when her time is better spent elsewhere. I can see her breaking into the other‚Äôs houses to join them for dinner because she forgot to make her own. Jason Todd: this man cooks. I don‚Äôt care if the whole ‚ÄúAlfred‚Äôs favorite‚Äù thing is a bit fanon it‚Äôs fun fanon. I think that since he is aware of how they lie to Alfred sometimes he‚Äôd be an even better cook. He‚Äôs the kind of guy to make any recipe work first try even if he keeps workshopping it until it‚Äôs perfect. He‚Äôs also very neat and cleans after himself. Cooking helps him wind down after a hard night. If he messes up though he might cry. Stephanie Brown: she took the whole ‚Äúcooking is like science‚Äù and decided to be a mad scientist. Her cooking works for her because she has crazy tastes. Like she‚Äôd make a salami and Nutella sandwich and consider it her Magnum opus. She loves baking too just so she can fuck around and find out. Steph usually leaves the mess there until she needs the space to cook again. Not because she‚Äôs dirty it‚Äôs just that she gets so caught up in trying the final product she forgets about it. She stresses the fuck out of Jason. Tim Drake: he‚Äôs more of an utilitarian closer to Cass. He learned a few simple recipes when he was a kid and that‚Äôs all he needs. Through the years he‚Äôs had to add a couple more to make it more balanced and fit his needs (first with the increase of physical activity and then the asplenia). He has a very healthy but very limited diet. He refuses to add anything else because there‚Äôs no need. He already knows how to cook the things he needs and likes well thank u very much. Duke Thomas: this man can cook. It takes him a while to get into it but he has great instinct for it. He‚Äôs more of a ‚Äúvibes only‚Äù kind of cook which makes him an awful baker but Alfred has the sweets covered anyways. Part of his process includes picking the spices from the back of the rack that Alfred pretends don‚Äôt exist. He‚Äôs creative but not in as much of a messy way as Steph. And unlike her he does have functioning taste buds so sometimes he ends up a victim of his own hubris. Most times it works out for him. Damian Wayne Al Gul: he helps his siblings whenever he mooches food from them (because Alfred is the only one that tolerates idle hands in the kitchen). He loves Jason‚Äôs cooking but he has more fun with Duke and Steph. They allow his input and suggestions which makes him feel like he‚Äôs contributing. He prefers Duke though because his success rate is higher.
-source: Batman (1940) #12-  Weapon of Choice: That‚Äôs two drownings in this issue now and they just do not care. They are the true villains.

post_body: I need y'all to understand that Bruce is not a normal billionaire. He is a billionaire because it‚Äôs useful to the plot but he is not a billionaire like our billionaires. Don‚Äôt make him say or do shits billionaires do he is not like that.  I just have enough of the posts and fics where people makes Bruce pro-capitalist a finance bro with nfts or against leftist ideas like free housing because ‚Äúthe economy üò≠üò≠‚Äù. That‚Äôs not him at all and y'all are showing that you only saw the Lego Batman movie.  First Bruce pays his taxes and hates that other rich don‚Äôt. It is shown in Future State: Dark Detective where he literally says that rich people who don‚Äôt contribute to making society better kind of deserve to be killed by a vigilante. Murder is still bad but he will not cry them AT ALL.  Second Bruce hates how people abuse the housing markets rising the prices kicking out poor people you know the drill. This is shown in Batman: White Knight when Bruce PUNCHES his rich FRIEND at a gala after learning that the guy is buying properties in Crime Alley kicks the poor people out and build new apartments complexes with rent way too high for the old residents. In Gotham Knights (the comics) he tests Lucius by playing the normal rich asshole and being like ‚Äúwe can‚Äôt take money from the shareholders these hard working folks to help the poor‚Äù because he wants to see if it will make Lucius angry. Once it does he is like ‚Äúgood you should be‚Äù and tell him he will sign it. Not being mad at the inequalities in the world is not acceptable for Bruce.  Thirdly Batman: The Animated Series often establishes how the real vilains are not the rogues but rich people. Bruce doesn‚Äôt disagree with Poison Ivy or Mr Freeze but with their methods. Bruce doesn‚Äôt hate his rogues because he knows they were pushed to a corner but he hates the rich in charge. The owner of a company is shown to be a bad guy because he doesn‚Äôt think his workers deserve to have a say in the company. Seriously if BTAS was made today we would be submerged with tweets and videos from people crying that they made Batman a communist.  Fourthly while we are at it with BTAS Bruce cares about the environment. I have seen this terrible panel of Bruce as Batman being mad that Poison Ivy and Harley Quinn destroyed a WE factory who was heavily polluting which is ooc. In BTAS Bruce is shown threatening to fire WE higher-ups because they made a partnership with a company hurting the environment. This partnership is why Poison Ivy targets him in the episode and tries to kill him btw which shows once again that they agree on the matter it‚Äôs the murder the problem. Outside of BTAS must I remind everyone that Bruce was going to marry Talia Al Ghul and that Ra‚Äôs Al Ghul saw a heir in him??? Like he has to be a bit of an ecologist for ECO-TERRORISTS to love him this much. Also Alfred said to Dick when he joined their household that Alfred wants ecological issues to be taken care of. No way would Bruce not has been raised to care about the environment or would harm the planet knowing Alfred doesn‚Äôt like it.  Finally WE has multiple charities and organizations dedicated to help people in Gotham. WE gives jobs to ex-convicts and help them in getting rehabilitate. Bruce feeds clothes and houses the poor he pays for any damage done by vigilantes or rogues. He has money to give and he gives it. AND all the galas exist so he can take money from the rich to give to the poor. He even encourages Dick in Nightwing (2016) to manipulate as much as possible his guests to milk their money. Bruce wants to take from the rich to help the poor that‚Äôs always been the case.
The Bat

Tripping and falling facedown into Batman fics was bound to happen sooner or later. It‚Äôs not my fault Jason Todd as Red Hood is stuffed to the gills with angst/hurt/comfort and tropey potential.   I also happen to think ‚Äòguns strapped to thighs‚Äô is a niiiiice combination of words to appreciate.   I think I was going somewhere about appreciation for whump tropes here but I‚Äôve been on a Red Hood kick lately and it shows. He should be put into Situations‚Ñ¢ more. As a treat. For me. Definitely not for him.

secondary_tags: ['batfam'  'batfamily'  'alfred pennyworth'  'bruce wayne'  'barbara gordon'  'dick grayson'  'jason todd'  'cassandra cain'  'tim drake'  'stephaine brown'  'duke thomas'  'damian wayne']
post_body: The Batfam and cooking  Alfred: we have so much canon info about this one. He takes pride in meeting the demands of his grandkids but the kids sometimes just pretend to like it for his peace of mind. Bruce: No. And I don‚Äôt mean in the meme way. He‚Äôs more than capable of sustaining himself and following instructions. He also chooses to subsist on those ‚Äúnutritional milkshakes‚Äù. Like to him is not a matter of learning how to cook he‚Äôs a chemist measuring his exact nutritional needs in a cup. It‚Äôs disgusting and he shouldn‚Äôt be allowed near the blender. Barbara Gordon: not the best not the worst. She has cooked she will cook again. She‚Äôs also not trying to make anything too fancy. She prefers take out mainly because she has (and will again in the future) burnt her food to a crisp because she got distracted with oracle stuff. A quick check while the potatoes are in the oven is a very dangerous thing. Dick Grayson: he would love to be that guy that takes Instagramable pictures of his food. Sometimes he manages to do just that but that‚Äôs not sustainable for him. He has a few fancy recipes he likes to bring out to impress people or to feel like a responsible adult. Most of the time he‚Äôs sauteing random vegetables with some rice and chicken and calling it a day. It‚Äôs good healthy and filling but is not much in the great scheme of things. I feel like he‚Äôd make really good salads too for some reason. Cassandra Cain: she‚Äôs not very good at being people. Cooking is part of that a survival skill and not much more. She really appreciates nice food but doesn‚Äôt see the point in learning herself when her time is better spent elsewhere. I can see her breaking into the other‚Äôs houses to join them for dinner because she forgot to make her own. Jason Todd: this man cooks. I don‚Äôt care if the whole ‚ÄúAlfred‚Äôs favorite‚Äù thing is a bit fanon it‚Äôs fun fanon. I think that since he is aware of how they lie to Alfred sometimes he‚Äôd be an even better cook. He‚Äôs the kind of guy to make any recipe work first try even if he keeps workshopping it until it‚Äôs perfect. He‚Äôs also very neat and cleans after himself. Cooking helps him wind down after a hard night. If he messes up though he might cry. Stephanie Brown: she took the whole ‚Äúcooking is like science‚Äù and decided to be a mad scientist. Her cooking works for her because she has crazy tastes. Like she‚Äôd make a salami and Nutella sandwich and consider it her Magnum opus. She loves baking too just so she can fuck around and find out. Steph usually leaves the mess there until she needs the space to cook again. Not because she‚Äôs dirty it‚Äôs just that she gets so caught up in trying the final product she forgets about it. She stresses the fuck out of Jason. Tim Drake: he‚Äôs more of an utilitarian closer to Cass. He learned a few simple recipes when he was a kid and that‚Äôs all he needs. Through the years he‚Äôs had to add a couple more to make it more balanced and fit his needs (first with the increase of physical activity and then the asplenia). He has a very healthy but very limited diet. He refuses to add anything else because there‚Äôs no need. He already knows how to cook the things he needs and likes well thank u very much. Duke Thomas: this man can cook. It takes him a while to get into it but he has great instinct for it. He‚Äôs more of a ‚Äúvibes only‚Äù kind of cook which makes him an awful baker but Alfred has the sweets covered anyways. Part of his process includes picking the spices from the back of the rack that Alfred pretends don‚Äôt exist. He‚Äôs creative but not in as much of a messy way as Steph. And unlike her he does have functioning taste buds so sometimes he ends up a victim of his own hubris. Most times it works out for him. Damian Wayne Al Gul: he helps his siblings whenever he mooches food from them (because Alfred is the only one that tolerates idle hands in the kitchen). He loves Jason‚Äôs cooking but he has more fun with Duke and Steph. They allow his input and suggestions which makes him feel like he‚Äôs contributing. He prefers Duke though because his success rate is higher.
-source: Batman (1940) #12-  Weapon of Choice: That‚Äôs two drownings in this issue now and they just do not care. They are the true villains.

post_body: Void Thoughts If you asked me I‚Äôd say that Enemy to Caretaker and Unfounded Fear have always been my favourite tropes but it‚Äôs rare for them to collide. Tripping and falling facedown into Batman fics was bound to happen sooner or later. It‚Äôs not my fault Jason Todd as Red Hood is stuffed to the gills with angst/hurt/comfort and tropey potential.   I also happen to think ‚Äòguns strapped to thighs‚Äô is a niiiiice combination of words to appreciate.   I think I was going somewhere about appreciation for whump tropes here but I‚Äôve been on a Red Hood kick lately and it shows. He should be put into Situations‚Ñ¢ more. As a treat. For me. Definitely not for him.

post_body: Chapter 12 Dick could feel a vein in his head about to pop. It was all Bruce‚Äôs fault. He knew that people grieve differently but desecrating Jason‚Äôs grave was a step too far. The manor doors opened to reveal an exhausted Alfred. His heart went out to his poor grandfather who was given the unenviable task of caring for his absolute nutcase of a dad.  ‚ÄúMaster Dick I am well aware that the situation is dire please spare Master Bruce from the worst of your wrath he does not know what he is doing.‚Äù Alfred pleaded the tiredness showing in his voice. Giving Alfred a pitying glance he managed to get out ‚ÄúI‚Äôll see what I can do Al.‚Äù and continued his March down to the cave.  Downstairs everything was dark save for the examination table which illuminated an unrecognizable casket. He still knew whose it was though. Resentment burned through him as he remembered how he wasn‚Äôt even informed of Jason‚Äôs passing until he stepped back onto earth from an offplanet mission. He didn‚Äôt even get to see Jason one last time after he passed. The fight afterwards wasn‚Äôt fun to remember either. Then there was the Joker the way he gloated about how hard he hit Jason the way every fiber in his body acted on instinct the need for Joker to be nothing more than a bloody splotch on the ground. He took a deep breath he had work to do.  Pushing aside his stormy thoughts he made his way next to his mentor his father and a man who had at this moment completely lost it. ‚ÄúBruce-‚Äù Dick started only to be cut off by the man himself with a single word ‚ÄúLook.‚Äù The casket was empty. There wasn‚Äôt a body to be found. ‚ÄúI did- did you take him out?‚Äù Dick sputtered out as his heart began to race and his finely honed detective instincts began to kick in.  There were scratch marks and bloodstains on the inside of the coffin one of the hinges was broken it all indicated someone clawing their way out. Dick knew that Bruce was deeply flawed but there was not a snowflake‚Äôs chance in hell that he would bury his son while he was still alive.  But the only option left was ridiculous Jason would have had to have woken up alive and dug his way up to the surface and left of his own volition. But then again it wouldn‚Äôt explain why his grave seemed undisturbed for so long and if Jason really is alive where is he now? Jason was a notable figure in Gotham high society it would be unlikely for the press to stay silent if they found the adopted Wayne boy who was thought to have died wandering around the streets in ragged clothes. No there was something more going on here.  Dick glances at Bruce the confusion in his face must have been apparent as Bruce states a single name and that clears nearly everything up; ‚ÄúTalia.‚Äù  It was the only answer that made sense. The Al Ghuls were some of the only people in the world who he knew for a fact that could bring people back from the dead with their Lazarus Pit. They may also be the only people on the planet capable of covering up a crime scene so well that it could evade even Batman‚Äôs skills.  In spite of the dark scene in front of him Dick couldn‚Äôt help but feel almost giddy at the thought of his baby brother still being alive. A long dead hope resurrected in him. Jason might still be alive.  He heard Bruce‚Äôs voice next to him ‚ÄúOnce the test results on the bloodstains come back we head for Nanda Parbat.‚Äù  Back In Nanda Parbat:  Jason paced around his room reminiscing about the fiasco that had been their last meeting. He was fully prepared for Tim to decline his invitation but much to his surprise and relief he had accepted. He supposed that he could take this as evidence that he didn‚Äôt fuck up too badly.  His plan was simple: sit the kid down and explain to him that while he had nothing against him he wouldn‚Äôt be returning to Bruce or Robin anytime soon. Being Batsy‚Äôs sidekick was fun at first but as time went on he started to see the cracks in logic. He wasn‚Äôt sure if he had grown out of Robin or if dying finally made him lose the rose tinted glasses.  He grew up in Crime Alley the most rundown and dangerous part of Gotham he knew of many people who would have benefited greatly from a second chance a tiny bit of grace from the world. But there were also those who were so far gone that it made little sense to keep them around at the expense of everyone else. He didn‚Äôt think that all criminals deserve the death penalty and even if they did it shouldn‚Äôt be decided by the Feds. But he can decide. He‚Äôs died he‚Äôs grown up among criminals he may not be the smartest kid around but he knows how to read people.  He can live with being a killer even if Bruce couldn‚Äôt.  Jason ran his fingers through his hair a faint knock on the door broke him out of his reverie.  It must be Tim no one else he knew knocked like that. The lower ranked assassins never wanted to enter his room unless they had to Damian and Cass wouldn‚Äôt bother knocking and Talia would knock once to let Jason know of her presence before letting herself in.  He rushed to the door ‚ÄúTim Come in.‚Äù he said slightly breathless he hoped it wouldn‚Äôt show too much.  The kid looked genuinely confused yet hopeful ‚ÄúYou called for me?‚Äù ‚ÄúUh yeah we need to discuss some things about Bruce Robin and some other stuff.‚Äù he winced that didn‚Äôt seem remotely friendly more like a business meeting.  Tim‚Äôs heart sank ‚Äôso it was just about Robin.‚Äô He chided himself for holding out hope that Jason wanted to genuinely get along with him. ‚ÄôJason probably wants me to quit Robin but I don‚Äôt know if I can do that. What if he doesn‚Äôt agree with me and gets mad? What would Talia think? How would I get back to Bruce?-‚Äô He was rudely brought back down to earth as the door slammed open revealing two diminutive figures one in dark green and the other clad in black.  The smaller of the two ‚ÄòWas that a child??‚Äô had a fierce frown on his face ‚ÄúTodd why have you not come to our training sessions in the past few days?‚Äù He eyed Tim suspiciously as if he were the one intruding on their time. The second figure a petite young girl looked over curiously and gave him a wave. Good to see that at least one of them was friendly.  The smaller one stepped forward giving him a withering side eye ‚ÄúTodd who is this.‚Äù He looked about ready to bring out his wakizashi as Jason promptly shielded Tim. ‚ÄúDamian calm down he is a guest of our mother Tim Drake the current Robin.‚Äù the small child who was now known as ‚ÄòDamian‚Äù loosened the grip on his sword. He still gave Tim a severe side eye but the thought of displeasing his mother put a damper on his stabby plans.  As Tim turned he could see the black figure next to Jason despite swearing that he saw her next to Damian mere moments ago. She nudged Jason who seemed to have a moment of realization. ‚ÄúUh yeah and this is Cassandra you can call her Cass don‚Äôt expect to reply though since she‚Äôs mute. You learn to understand her signs the more you get to know her.‚Äù The girl now dubbed Cassandra gave him a smile and a thumbs up which Tim took to mean that he was making a good impression.  ‚ÄúHi Cassandra hi Damian.‚Äù Tim could feel the stress melting away from him it almost seemed like he was introducing himself to a new class rather than whatever he was actually doing.

post_body: OKAY I have more Gotham Knights opinions. So like first I played exclusively as Red Hood cause my plan is to play as each character all the way through and then go back and play it a 5th time were I interchange  Also I played on PS so it might be different to when you play on PC but here are my thoughts     <!-- more -->   1. The controls? Whack. There‚Äôs no actual jump button you hold X when you‚Äôre near a ledge to climb or vault but there‚Äôs no actual designated jump button   (I learned the hard way if you run and hit crouch you slide‚Ä¶ I had to restart a mission cause I slid in when I was supposed to not get caught and immediately got caught‚Ä¶)  2. The first Mr Freeze boss fight is stupid and I hate it. I never finished the Mr Freeze story because I just could not get past that stupid fucking boss fight. His health is too high he has too many fucking lazer types there‚Äôs no cover after round one it‚Äôs dumb I hate it fuck whoever designed it I hope you pillow is always warm and your bananas are always rotten!  3. A lot of the time you have to stay undetected but it‚Äôs hard if you don‚Äôt know what you‚Äôre doing. So like when you first have to break into GCPD you just have to fucking book it while crouching for the door otherwise you will get caught. Didn‚Äôt know that the first time hid for ages and got caught. It‚Äôs also really hard to tell if you run a certain way if you‚Äôll be seen or not. Inside the GCPD bull pen I alerted all the guards to yellow cause I tried to run for the fence and vault but again vaulting in this game SUCKS     The combat is like‚Ä¶ fine I guess? I‚Äôm dyspraxic as fuck so I‚Äôve always struggled with like button mashing and shit like that but sometimes you‚Äôre fighting someone and it‚Äôs like impossible. The bog standard talons were harder to fight than the upgraded with knives or the big brute dudes cause you cannot hit them you have to shoot and it‚Äôs awkward trying to get the angle to line up especially if there‚Äôs like 4 of them.      Also the final fight with Talia right at the end she dodges waaay too much and you cannot hit her it‚Äôs so annoying. post_body: OKAY I have more Gotham Knights opinions. So like first I played exclusively as Red Hood cause my plan is to play as each character all the way through and then go back and play it a 5th time were I interchange  Also I played on PS so it might be different to when you play on PC but here are my thoughts     <!-- more -->   1. The controls? Whack. There‚Äôs no actual jump button you hold X when you‚Äôre near a ledge to climb or vault but there‚Äôs no actual designated jump button   (I learned the hard way if you run and hit crouch you slide‚Ä¶ I had to restart a mission cause I slid in when I was supposed to not get caught and immediately got caught‚Ä¶)  2. The first Mr Freeze boss fight is stupid and I hate it. I never finished the Mr Freeze story because I just could not get past that stupid fucking boss fight. His health is too high he has too many fucking lazer types there‚Äôs no cover after round one it‚Äôs dumb I hate it fuck whoever designed it I hope you pillow is always warm and your bananas are always rotten!  3. A lot of the time you have to stay undetected but it‚Äôs hard if you don‚Äôt know what you‚Äôre doing. So like when you first have to break into GCPD you just have to fucking book it while crouching for the door otherwise you will get caught. Didn‚Äôt know that the first time hid for ages and got caught. It‚Äôs also really hard to tell if you run a certain way if you‚Äôll be seen or not. Inside the GCPD bull pen I alerted all the guards to yellow cause I tried to run for the fence and vault but again vaulting in this game SUCKS     The combat is like‚Ä¶ fine I guess? I‚Äôm dyspraxic as fuck so I‚Äôve always struggled with like button mashing and shit like that but sometimes you‚Äôre fighting someone and it‚Äôs like impossible. The bog standard talons were harder to fight than the upgraded with knives or the big brute dudes cause you cannot hit them you have to shoot and it‚Äôs awkward trying to get the angle to line up especially if there‚Äôs like 4 of them.      Also the final fight with Talia right at the end she dodges waaay too much and you cannot hit her it‚Äôs so annoying.      It was a good game I enjoyed myself I will be replaying it at least four times (currently started my Nightwing play through) but also‚Ä¶ there‚Äôs issues that really should have been considered. I had to google how to do levels and seen others complaining so it‚Äôs not just a me thing but yeah‚Ä¶ also I love Jason‚Äôs build in the game but he looks a little old (he genuinely looks older than Bruce in some scenes) and man needs hair. Just give my boy a mop of black with white hair PLEASE

post_body: Jason isn‚Äôt scared of Joker Comics like to show the Joker as Jason‚Äôs greatest fear (Boy Wonder #2 Death of the Family and so much more) but I think that‚Äôs bullshit.  In UtRH Jason menages to kidnap him unflichingly listening to whatever he said. He had him at a bullet point and there was no fear. Joker was just a tool for his confrontation with Bruce. The same is in the lost days. Jason doesn‚Äôt kill Joker not because he feared him but because he‚Äôs a drama queen.   Joker has nothing on Jason that he can fear. Whatever Joker can do to him it was already done. Jason met the worst end; he got murdered by him. There‚Äôs nothing worse that Joker can do to him (at least in Jason‚Äôs mind).  Jason‚Äôs fear isn‚Äôt the Joker. Maybe in the beginning when he first woke up but with time his loa training Joker is nothing. What Jason fears is betrayal being left alone. Dying. But not Joker.

post_body: So I decided to write a piece of batman fic. it‚Äôs technically about an OC making a comedy documentary Attenborough-style about Gotham. I reckon the Documentary Section stands well on its own as a piece of work (the OC stuff requires‚Ä¶ explaining as to who she is though the BTS Making-of jokes happen between sections of documentary.)  Here‚Äôs an extract of narration for you all:  ‚ÄòNARRATOR (V/O)  Here we see a prime example of one of the lower species on the food chain in Gotham ‚Äì the humble Goon. While not holding much leverage in the city a Goon will do what it must to feed itself. Often its prey is an innocent civilian.   Unfortunately lone goons have often reduced success rates as many civilians are wise to goon attacks. They are also hindered by the presence of their natural predators ‚Äì honest police officers. ‚Äô  ‚Äî‚Äì  I imagine I could have used a better word but god Goon is just such a fantastic word for a henchman or low-tier criminal. it‚Äôs so evocative.

post_body: I want the Wayne be morally grey and have good intentions but do them through questionable or even illegal ways   I want Thomas and Martha to be fighters when it comes to their family or other people in Gotham being oppressed or treated unfairly by other rich people I want Thomas to have ties to crime despite being a doctor and I want Martha to have more experience with having bad mental health and either she or Thomas try to hide it   This is why I love stuff like Telltale Batman The Batman Flashpoint and Batman Earth One because they make Bruce‚Äôs parents are people with struggles and dark pasts instead of them either being portrayed as saints or revealed to be monsters that Bruce has to fix later on
‚ÄúI don‚Äôt work alone.‚Äù

post_body: BATMAN AND THE OUTSIDERS  When the quest for justice drives Batman into some morally ambiguous areas he calls in the most moral man he knows: Jefferson Pierce a.k.a. Black Lightning and his team of operatives known as the Outsiders!     Several years ago Batman personally put the Barrera family into hiding after they suffered through terrible experiments at the hands of an organization called the Ark. Now all but one of them have turned up dead‚Ä¶and Batman needs to locate Sofia Barrera before the wrong people get their hands on her‚Äîand her surprising power! But it wouldn‚Äôt be Batman without a hidden agenda would it? And when Black Lightning Katana the Signal and Orphan find out what Batman is really up to their every loyalty will be called into question.
